Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok ...”
Reviews.Author: chopin77
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we asked if we could upgrade. They said only for part of our five day stay. So we had two nights in a full ocean view which was beautiful. We then moved to a partial ocean view ( We paid for upgrades for both rooms) and unfortunately, the room was on the second floor with the valet parking outside the balcony, a view of the public restrooms plus the ice machine outside the room. We should have asked to see the room first. It was too noisey and not a room to pay extra for. We also had to ask for them to clean our room. The fresh fruit and cookies every eveningwas nice. It was also nice to have washing machines available. The beach area was nice and the pool area. We did manage to find parking on the street but only because it was off season. Another thing that was quite sad was the homeless people around the restrooms and the early round up by the policemen one early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Family get away”
Reviews.Author: lindsey351
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family suite on the first floor close to the pool with an ocean view. The staff was wonderful. Big draw back is no resturant at the hotel with children ranging from 1-9. They do however serve a nice breakfast from $7.00 to $15.00 (ask about discounts from cards you carry)

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzodos
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 114 with partial sea view. Walk directly to pool, dining room and nearby restaurants.We parked on the street and saved $20/night - lmited spaces but no problem in March. Very professional and helpful service. Bikes, movies, beach gear included at no extra charge. Rooms are handsomely decorated with the latesd high quality HDTV, DVD gear. Its worth every penny. We would return. Especially good for kids who like the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Callisto22
Reviews.Content: It gets a 5 rating, mainly for the staff. The hotel is clean and updated, but you could probably get a nicer hotel with better views in San Diego. The staff, however, makes this hotel a great experience! I took my husband here for his birthday, and the staff treated us like VIPs. They are so friendly and accomodating, but in a laid back way (not a creepy, overeager way). It's in a quiet location, but a short walk will take you to some cool restaurants & bars.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: MicknMike
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, on boardwalk, on a beautiful beach, within walking distance to good shopping, and good restaraunts. Not far from La Jolla, Sea World and Zoo. But what makes this location special is the fine maintenance of the hotel, and the hospitality of the staff, and great ammenities. This has been our hotel of choice both for family vacation with kids, and also a couples get away. Rooms with a view are on upper floors, and are wonderful, but the non-view rooms are still very nice, spacious, clean, well arranged and very comfortable. Pool is wonderful, with both a view of the beach, and of the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “I already can't wait for my next visit.”
Reviews.Author: Janice M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again over Thanksgiving weekend and had a great time. I wanted to write an update to take note of the exceptional customer service I received. I booked two rooms and requested that we receive the room in which we previously stayed. When we arrived, we were disappointed to find out that the hotel was sold out and our previous room was not available. We were booked into two nearby rooms, which would have been fine except that our guest staying in the second room was very upset that his room was near the elevator and the parking garage exit. I went back to the front desk and asked if they could change his room. I was fairly stressed out, but the front desk manager went out of her way to accomodate us and offered to upgrade us to a family suite with an ocean view. I couldn't believe it. This level of customer service is tough to find anywhere and it made our weekend a great one. All weekend long every single person working at the hotel treated us like gold. I cannot say enough about how great the staff is at this hotel. Also--The hotel breakfast is a great deal at $5.25 per person. They make fresh omelets and the pastries were delicious. Free WiFi is a big plus, too.

Reviews.Title: “You can't miss the sunset!”
Reviews.Author: Snydergal75707
Reviews.Content: One of the most beautiful hidden gems in the San Diego area, Pacific Terrace offers a quiet ambiance that is hard to find anywhere else in the country...combine the elegance of room furnishings with being right the on the beach, the warm and inviting pool and hot tub with gracious hotel staff, and you'd probably be quite satisfied...but the price of admission to this beautiful hotel can't cover the "show" you'll get as the sun dips into the far edge of the sea...it is spectacular!! Close to some of the best restaurants in the area, a vacation at Pacific Terrace is just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Pacific Beach location in So Cal”
Reviews.Author: pikiniki93
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 just returned from Pacific Beach and a stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. My husband booked this trip for our family and chose this hotel based on the positive reviews he read. The 3 story hotel is located right on Pacific Beach. It literally takes you less than 3 minutes to get from your hotel room to the ocean. It was very low key and uncrowded; a boutique-type gem. Upon our afternoon arrival, we were told our room preference was not available. We booked through Expedia and were told our room preference was not guaranteed because of that. The staff worked immediately to remedy the situation and placed us in a king jr suite with a full ocean view for the first night and then moved us to the room preference we had originally booked with an upgraded view. Every staff member we encountered, from the front desk to the person who brought us extra pillows, were friendly, competent and eager to help. Great staff! The rooms were upgraded and very clean. All amenities were provided that you would expect from a high end hotel including large beach towels for our use. The beds were very comfortable and the decor lovely. My only complaint would have been the use of bedspreads as opposed to duvets. The entire hotel was very well maintained, including the pool and lounge area. The pool was an ok size, no frills, but very clean with comfortable chaise loungers with cushions. And of course with a spectacular view of the Ocean! For a small fee the hotel provides beach chairs and beach cruisers. Children's beach toys are free to use. The beach in front of the hotel was never over crowed and we always had a front row seat to some great surfing. Parking was also convenient located in an underground garage beneath the hotel. We didnt eat breakfast at the hotel because we were off exploring the area each morning. Be sure to try Kono's Cafe just south of the hotel. We ate breakfast and lunch there a number of times during our stay. Great "made from scratch" food, big portions and cheap. We loved our stay and would definitely return to the Pacific Terrace Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location!”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelling77
Reviews.Content: We just returned after a week at Pacific Terrace! We did not want to leave! It is a great hotel and what a perfect location, right on the ocean ! We arrived at the hotel too early for check in,seeing our room was not ready yet,they offered us an upgrade to the Master Suite on the 3rd floor. WOW! We are so glad we did it! The room was awesome with King Room, jacuzzi tub,walk in shower,double vanities,seperate livingroom, kitchenette,dining table and 2 balconies! The views spectacular! The staff was very helpful and could not have been happier with their help. We used the hotels bikes every day for a lovely bike ride along the beach . We really enjoyed the pool area and also spend days on the beach across from the hotel. We never had breakfast at the hotel, just because we started our days with a long bike ride or walk and would end up having breakfast along the way. The Green Flash was our favourite - a 5min walk down from the hotel with glass patio overlooking the ocean,great for people watching while enjoying coffee and Blueberry Pancakes or Eggs Benni! The frontdesk staff organized a taxi for us every night to go for dinner in La Jolla, about a $13 drive. Do yourself a favour and try The Marine Room and Tapenade in La Jolla!amazing. We also had dinner at JRDN twice, a 2 minute walk down from the hotel! We had an unforgettable stay and already miss our room and views.Thank you Pacific Terrace for a perfect week!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: gldnpupper27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. This was our first stayat this unique hotel and fully enjoyed it. The hotel is a small one with an intimate feel to it. The entire staff was truly wonderful! The rooms were decorated beautifully and the bed was super comfy! Now this is not a cheap hotel and was told that the rates used to be much better, but they still don't seem to have any trouble filling the rooms. The breakfast that they have each morning is a really good one! The breakfast bar gives you everything from dry cereal to omelets and waffles. They also offer fresh fruit, yogurt, muffins, toast, coffee,toast and juice. Something for everyone! You also get half off if you are in one of the upper range rooms. The pool area is beautiful with lots of greenery and is kept incredibly clean. The hottub is also very nice and a great place to go and meet other people. At night, the lights come on and you almost feel you are in Hawaii! Not to mention the sunsets you see from your balcony! They are very helpful in making dinner arrangements for you and can even give you VIP cards at various restaurants. (Thanks Katherine!) There is underground parking that is gated, so there is never a question of safety....no matter what time you are coming or going. This is an incredible place and would not hesitate to spend time there again on our next trip to California. The Pacific Terrace is a unique hotel all around! Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views! Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kit-uk
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough!! This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever had the pleasure of staying in. We stayed here for 3 nights whilst in San Diego and had an amazing stay here. The staff are all extremely friendly, helpful and efficient and the service they provided made such a difference to our stay. We booked the presidential suite and wow, it was wonderful!! The bed was huge (I actually had to climb up into it!), comfy and had a view looking right onto the ocean from it which was beautiful and very relaxing. We had a large balcony overlooking the ocean which is wonderful for having a drink and watching the sun go down. The balcony isnâ€™t too private as it also overlooks the pool but with a view like that we didnâ€™t mind at all. The room was spacious with a kitchen/dining area and a good size fridge, the wood and kitsch tropical floral design was very fitting to the beach location. The bathroom was wonderful, with a huge Jacuzzi bath â€“ pure luxury! Separate walk in shower, WC and large marble top dressing table area with terry cloth robes. The hotel offer a turn down service in the evening with chocolates on the pillows and this was a really nice touch. The pool is nice, clean and a good size with views of the ocean. There is also a hot tub which stays open after the sun has gone down. There were lots of sun loungers and the pool area was really quite peaceful (we did stay out of season). The bar by the pool does happy hour from 4pm with 2 for 1 drinks and the friendly bartender made us some awesome frozen margaritas! Location is amazing, couldnâ€™t be better! The hotel is right on the beach, with beautiful views and beach walks and walking distance to lots of nice restaurants and bars. Valet parking is available at approx $20 a day and we did use this service on the first night. It is pretty easy however to find free parking on the streets around the hotel if you didnâ€™t want to pay. I loved this hotel and if we are ever lucky enough to visit San Diego again, we will definitely be returning and recommending to all our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a view!”
Reviews.Author: VTMommy_8
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with this hotel (well maybe if they had free wifi, but small matter) and the folks that staff it. The location was perfect for our beach-loving, food seeking, and early morning latte- needing family. The building is not fancy, but is very, very nice. And their customer service is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Views”
Reviews.Author: Dodgerduo
Reviews.Content: Great location overlooking the ocean. We saw dolphins passing by from our balcony. We have been staying here for the last 4 years, unfortunately others have identified this great place to stay. The prices have increased and availability is getting slightly tougher to obtain rooms based on the popularity. Beach front location is good for those wanting to take in all that San diego has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Why??”
Reviews.Author: Lynnpatricia
Reviews.Content: Why would you stay here when you could stay at much better hotels in the same price range but with so much more to offer? Yes, the proximity to the beach and the views are great but there is no restaurant and no bar to speak of either. Rooms are drab and full of well meaning dust traps. I am sure the staff are nice but we had to carry our own luggage and had no further interaction with any staff after check in anyway. 2 of 246 in San Diego! I don't think so!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TerryLou
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times starting back in the 80's to most recently last year 2011. Nice rooms, great location, great views, great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinked_10_11
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights there and were very pleased with the hotel, ammenities and the staff. We stayed in a Junior King Suite which was very nice to have the larger space for more than a one night stay. Nicely furnished and clean. My husband had arranged in advance for us to return to the hotel the first evening to a path of rose petals and candles. The staff paid attention to when we left the room so that they could execute his surprise for me. It was beautiful and perfect. We did not try their breakfast buffet although it smelled good. Instead we opted to walk down the beach and try some of the closeby local places. The pool was kept very clean and we enjoyed the hot tub too. We did not appreciate the many homeless beggars but found that to be quite prevalent in the greater San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful vacation spot EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: MusikPoptart
Reviews.Content: This place spoiled me. Plain and simple. Beautiful view...wonderful staff...quiet neighborhood...close to EVERYTHING...family oriented, yet private and relaxing. The boardwalk is directly in front of the hotel which makes it convenient in so many ways. There's something for all ages here. I can't wait to go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all around stay”
Reviews.Author: pottstikr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our anniversary and absolutely loved it. The attention to detail was outstanding. If you want to relax and enjoy the few and sip cocktails from your balcony and enjoy the view, this is the place. If you are one of those that just love to pack every minute of your weekend sightseeing anticipating never to return to San Diego, then this place isn't for you....The only thing we didn't like was the bedframe. It stuck out an extra 6 inches so it made getting in and out of bed difficult, bet then again I am old...It won't stop us from going again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel right on Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: brownieLuv2trvl
Reviews.Content: Pacific Terrace is a great little hotel right on Pacific Beach in San Diego. It is in a quiet neighborhood, and close to everything. It is within walking distance to restaurants and entertainment. The boardwalk right in front of the hotel makes it a convenient location. It is also close to the 5 freeway so you can get anywhere in San Diego within 10 minutes. Friendly staff and nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property and Beach View”
Reviews.Author: Phillysteaks414
Reviews.Content: This place was above and beyond what we expected. Grounds: They had lush green plants all around the hotel. Inside the lobby they had fresh flowers daily. Once you step outside by the pool you can see the ocean and beach right in front of you. The Hotel is almost on the beach, if it was not for the walkway the beach would be right up front. Room: Our room was amazing. There was a full size bar in our room, the biggest bed we have ever seen, Flat screen plasma t.v., great patio and view of the beach. Granite counter tops and wood accents throughout the room. They even had a ceiling fan (tropical style). In the lobby there is a restaurant that serves free wine tastings, great feature. The beach is just 1 minute walk from hotel. The beach is very quite, not busy and was a great feature. Easily the best value in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KAOSMUA
Reviews.Content: The room was great. We had originally rented a room with no view thinking that we were going to be in the room only at night, but upon arrival they offered us a better room with partial view and a balcony, for 15$ more a night, and we were really happy with that choice in the end. Sitting on the balcony having a glass of wine while looking at the ocean was awesome. We rented bikes from the hotel, which was great! Not far from La Jolla, the zoo, the bay, Gaslamp district. Great restaurant for breakfast near the hotel, since I don't eat much for breakfast, it wasn't worth for me to pay for the breakfast buffet. The room was big and bathroom as well. I would stay here again and would recommand the hotel to anyone: Families, couple, friends! The staff was so friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Accomodations, Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jaycie10
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I have just spent one week at the most wonderful hotel with the most wonderful staff, First encounter with Danny thank you for your kindness, and help. Now for the staff, Diego, Joe and McGarrity what would we have done without you. Your hotel, immaculate, your service perfect, your information flawless. I would come back over and over. Perfect location, perfect view. Thank you again and again from me to all of you for helping with one more trip for G's bucket list.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Lighthouse21
Reviews.Content: Loved the location and the hotel. Beautiful property and views. Staff very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Surprise for my Husband”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: I used the previous reviews from Trip Advisor to choose the Pacific Terrace for a surprise mini vacation for my husband's 60th. The hotel lived up to all the reviews and more. Location is fantastic, hotel staff very friendly and accommodating, and service above and beyond. I booked the ocean front suite, but did not select any other options. Changed my mind at the last minute, and Angela, the concierge handled everything. We will definitely return. The sooner, the better.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel - Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is steps away from Pacific Beach. Staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make sure you had a great experience. Rooms were nicely decorated, granite sink top, lighted makeup mirror for the ladies, frameless tub shower, large flat screen TV and DVR. Everything was very clean. Bed was comfy. Turn down service offered with Begian chocolates on the bed. We stayed off season and the rates were unbelievable for the location and amenities. One drawback is the parking -- $22 per night. We were able to park on the street since it was off season. Will definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely location”
Reviews.Author: Moira S
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel overlooking the ocean. Service was immaculate, room was perfect. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: taft1958
Reviews.Content: My stay was very nice; however, the hotel had some technical issues that prevented pay movies from being available for up to 24 hours after purchase, room key being deactivated prior to check-out date, and a couple of small items went missing duringthe first day after the "turn down" staff visited the room. Overall the stay was nice and the hotel waived one day of the $22.00 parking fees as compensation for the missing items. The most notible points for this facility is the nice pool area, the view (magnificient), and the friendly staff. I would stay again when the opportunity presents.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful area, amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mattmaccormick
Reviews.Content: We really lucked out on this hotel. We found it on trip advisor and it did not disappoint! Upon arriving we were upgraded by Diego for $30 a night (150 total) to a suite with two queen beds, a flat screen tv, a massive bathroom with jacuzzi tub, and a south facing balcony overlooking the beach. The breakfast buffet was delicious in the morning. The beach had great surfing and the boardwalk was perfect for running during the day or night. This area of San Diego is pacific beach and has lots of nice restaurants, shops and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful hotel, view, awesome customer service”
Reviews.Author: AJ408
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to the Pacific Terrace, we will be back again! The customer service is amazing. Enrico upgraded us to a beautiful suite upon arrival, totally unexpected. Andres provided great valet/bell service, even offering to go to a store down the street for my boyfriend's beverage! The location/view can't be beat either. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sheberlein
Reviews.Content: We just spent our 45th wedding anniversary in San Diego and chose this wonderful place to stay at. I mentioned that it was going to be our anniversary when I booked the room. When we checked in, Angela (the Concierge) asked our last name. When we gave our last name a young man was filling the coffee, etc. and said "Happy Anniversary" to us. That was very impressive to us since he was not even behind the desk. Our room was wonderful. It was very spacious with a little kitchen space and the view (partial view room) was wonderful. Our room had a wonderful balcony where we sat and watched the ocean and the boardwalk. Everyone always was very helpful with any questions that we had. Angela (the Concierge) gave us excellent restaurant recommendations. The only downfall was the restaurant in the hotel--very marginal buffet for the price of the buffet. Kona's, which is down the Boardwalk about a block is excellent. We would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Jvvalo
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, beautiful ocean views, clean rooms, close to restaurants. The list goes on and on. I definitely will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location overlooking the ocean”
Reviews.Author: bevandmark2
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in a second floor ocean view room which is definitely worth the extra money. The rooms have 2 double beds which are amazingly comfortable once you manage to clamber onto them - the heavy wooden frames around them are just at the right height for me to bang my shins every time I attempted to get on the bed. The view of the ocean from the balcony is fabulous - we left the door open to fall asleep to the roar of the waves crashing against the beach. Our room was almost right in the centre of the hotel - which meant that we were over the top of the entrance to the pool - the balconies are great but they aren't very private or quiet - indeed when there are people in the pool, especially kids playing, it can be very noisy. Service was reasonable - but not exceptional. When we booked we had a rate with a free glass of wine which didn't ever materialise - although to be honest we kept forgetting to mention it. There were a couple of other niggles which irritated - they ran out of the only decent beer they had in the bar - Sam Adams (they only did four different beers, one of which was a "lite") and 2 days later when we tried again for a beer they still hadn't got any (the bartender was a bit embarrassed and offered to pop down the shop!). The other niggle was that we asked about a late checkout - it was a quiet time so they agreed to an hour later than normal - 12noon, but if we wanted a 3pm checkout we would have to pay just under $100. We settled for 12noon. Overall we really liked this hotel - its small and right beside the beach with a great view and we would probably go back if we ever return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Long stay guest, and simply superb”
Reviews.Author: DJTravelBoy
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic with the ocean at your doorstep and long, beautiful walks a daily must. Restaurants are close, ranging from the inexpensive to the chic. And the hotel staff at the Pacific Terrace is just the best. They are accommodating, friendly, genuine and customer focused. I have already booked a return stay for next year. This is a wonderful, intimate property.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great staff, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: TLunedi
Reviews.Content: This hotel overlooks Pacific Beach & Mission Beach (a surfer's paradise). The hotel rooms are beautifully furnished with Tommy Bahama furniture along with Tommy Bahama toiletries. The hotel sits right on the boardwalk and is only a short walk to great dining, shopping and entertainment. If you prefer downtown San Diego, it is a short 15 minute drive. The beds were very comfortable, the view is stunning. The staff went out of their way to assist you with any request. I could live here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Mandy J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our USA honeymoon. We had a great time in San Diego and the hotel was in a great location. So close to the beach. The junior suite was beautiful & spacious. They do also provide a hot breakfast in their dining room for an extra charge. Only complaints were there is no proper room service and our suite was opposite an elevator which got a bit noisy in the morning. If I were to stay again I would specifically ask to not be placed near the elevator or dining room. Apart from that it was a great stay and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: asiangent
Reviews.Content: My first trip to southern California and this hotel had to be the best part! I want to specifically mention Enrico for his outstanding customer service and attentiveness, he made this stay that much more perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Tommy Bahama Meets Beach Blanket Babylon”
Reviews.Author: blissfork
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace is my go-to hotel in San Diego...especially when they drop their rates at the last minute. Their full ocean view rooms have balconies that are basically on top of the ocean, and are AMAZING for people watching if you get a room on floor 2 or 3 on the right-hand side of the hotel. Try not to get a room right in the middle of the U shaped hotel, as those are farther back from the beach and you end up just spying on people in the pool when you should be enjoying the sunset. I never pay for parking, as I'm always able to find free parking within a few blocks. I also never eat the food at the hotel, as San Diego is chock-full of marvelous restaurants. My partner and I are honestly slightly embarrassed for liking this hotel so much. We're in our early 30s, which we think is far too early to be staying in a Tommy Bahama themed hotel. The upside of that is that there isn't a party scene at night. It's always quiet, we sleep with the balcony doors wide open, and when we venture down to the jacuzzi we always have it to ourselves. The one downside is the customer service. The hotel staff tends to be reluctant to allow early check-ins or late check-outs. They also won't let you book a specific room unless you pay a $50 fee -- so even if we book months in advance, we aren't guaranteed one of the right-hand side oceanfront rooms. Even though we are repeat customers! I also never get free upgrades, even when better rooms are available :-( My final gripe: my partner called today to find out about availability this coming Monday. He called at about 6pm and was given a special unadvertised rate by the person working the desk. He said he would call back in a bit to confirm. When he called back a different person answered the phone and refused to honor the rate he had been quoted just a few hours earlier, even though the room (a King Suite) was still available. We felt like we were being jerked around a bit, so we booked a "Surf Pad" room at a different beach-front hotel just a smidge down the boardwalk. We're bummed out, because that hotel is swankier, but also louder and douchier. That said, they are much more accommodating about early check-ins and they don't bait and switch on price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Kids loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Pac Terrace with my wife and 2 small children (8,6) and we had a blast! This wonderful hotel is situated right on the boardwalk overlooking the beach and Pacific Ocean... literally steps to the sand. Our sunset view from room 220 was spectacular! The location is perfect for a business or leisure trip to the area. We loved the heated pool and hot tub, both were very clean and well maintained. The kids could have spent hours in there! The staff was so friendly and approachable. There was nothing they wouldn't do for us during our stay. The hotel supplied us each with cruiser bikes to take up and down the boardwalk.... certainly the highlight on sunny day in SD. We'll be back for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “First Class All the Way!”
Reviews.Author: GoDog514
Reviews.Content: Every staff person we interacted with was very friendly and helpful. They always asked if everything was OK and if we were enjoying our stay. We had an ocean view room and I would highly recommend it. The patio is large and has 4 chairs and a table. A great place to have a cocktail, read or people watch. My Internet reservation included a complimentary glass of wine, free wierless internet, free use of bikes and half price breakfast buffet. We chose to walk to a local restaurant for breakfast instead. The consigiere was very helpful in recommending restaurants for dinner and made the reservations for us. You will pay $22 for parking and if you don't get the deal that includes free Internet, it will cost $10. The beds are comfy and sit up high in a large, impressive wood frame with a wood headboard. They do provide a wooden step if you need help reaching the bed. Located within walking distance to shops and restaurants and steps from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jalabrake
Reviews.Content: Love stay here! The staff is friendly and made me feel welcome. The rooms are very nice. The beds are so comfortable! I love falling asleep and waking up to the sounds of the waves from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel & Area”
Reviews.Author: Maureen M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well appointed, comfortable beds, very comfortable, quiet rooms. Our room was a third floor, ocean view with a balcony. A very delicious, hot breakfast is served every mornining. The staff is excellent, very helpful and informative. The concierge helped with reservations, discount tickets and information. The hotel is affiliated with a wonderful car service that picked us up and drove us to various attractions and then was back at the appointed time to take us to the hotel. The pool and hot tub are very nice and we met some wonderful people there. There are lots of lounge chairs and cabanas and free cool drinks, near the pool area. The beach and walking path are accessible from the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Best place on Mission Beach”
Reviews.Author: Bad_Billy
Reviews.Content: We got an awesome deal here the week before Tgiving. The room was lovely and the property was very well kept. Staff was friendly and helpful. Parking fee was unfortunate but understandable. Got free wi-fi but it seems it does cost sometimes. Fixtures were all top-notch; everything was grand. It is a bit pricey, but the location is unbeatable. Ya get what ya pay for. Go direct to their site for best deals, but understand that this is not a cheap property! Once again, I don't think you can get a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: travelgal30Seattle
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location. Excellent customer service. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Room service menu incredibly reasonable, beautiful views, water pressure and temperature excelllent, good insulation between rooms, we had a wonderful time. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location & hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravelerNC
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a conference and my company booked at Pacific Terrace. I was greeted by friendly and welcoming front desk staff and found out I was upgraded to a junior suite with partial view of the ocean. Check in was quick and the person that checked me in was informative and resourceful about the hotel amenities and where to eat nearby, etc. My room was large, clean and stocked. That partial view was amazing, not sure why they call it a partial view! The front desk called me to make sure all was well in my room. The room is nicely appointed with free and reliable wireless (important item for me when traveling for business). They do not have a restaurant at the hotel, but have a few options: (1) they have participating restaurants that deliver food, and (2) they provide a food card and if you eat at the participating restaurants of that plan they just bill your room. Also, they do have a breakfast buffet in the morning which is nice and pretty reasonable in cost. Location, it is walking distance to lots of dining options and a Starbucks. The hotel is very close to Interstate 5, literally 6-7 minutes straight shot to La Jolla, and many other areas. Downside, public parking is hard to get, but there is valet option of $20/per day. Not an issue for me, but those on a budget, this is a good thing to know. Otherwise, the stay was amazing and I will certainly return to stay at Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: glen c
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay here. The staff are super friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable. Nice location, close to shops, restaurants and beach. Close to Sea World ($20 taxi) Seaworld ($40.00) - Legoland is a fair hike ($85.00 each way in Taxi). Awesome view. Great pool and spa. Very reasonably priced. Would highly recommend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My all time favorite”
Reviews.Author: treesee
Reviews.Content: This is an exceptional place especially for the price. The staff make you feel like you are royalty. Anything you need, they will help. They are always friendly....you will never get attitude. They made me feel comfortable. The rooms are impeccable and have a nice feel. No dirty or stained carpets !Nothing like sitting out on the balcony and watching the ocean. Awesome view! The location is perfect. You can park your car and walk to restuarants, bars and shopping. Once I was surprised with an upgrade to a beautiful suit. This place understands good business and how to keep customers coming back. I have told other hotels that they should take some lessons from Pacific Terrace, see how a good hotel is run and go back and train their staff. I can't wait until my next visit. Look forward to sitting out by the pool and trying out the hot tub!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful sunsets!”
Reviews.Author: Tinsman5
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located on a fun boardwalk in San Diego, Ca. The views from the hotel were awesome! My favorite time of the day was at sunset. We would sit on the chairs by the pool and have a perfect view of the sunset. The service at the hotel was excellent. Everyone was friendly from the janitorial staff up to management. I thought that was very impressive. Even before we traveled to San Diego, I was contacted by the hotel concierge to find out if we had any needs for reservations at local restaurants or any local attractions. In advance, the hotel made us dinner reservations for some near-by places, and got us our San Diego Zoo tickets. This made things so convenient and easy for us. Our room was very nice and a good size. We stayed in on of the family suites. The pull-out couch was very comfortable. The view from our room was of the pool and the ocean. I think this was a perfect room for our family of 5. As far as food, the hotel only serves breakfast. We ate breakfast there 3 out of the 5 days. The food was pretty good, but the menu did not change daily while we were there. It was a buffet with things like eggs, omelettes, bacon, sausage, potatoes, toast, pancakes, french toast, yogurt, bananas, a few rolls, and a couple of choices of cereal. We enjoyed it on the days we ate there. The coffee was Starbucks and was very good. The hotel concierge gave us 4 excellent recommendations for places to eat dinner. We enjoyed all the places they sent us to. Most of the places were within walking distance and we would walk there along the boardwalk each night to get there. The pool was nice and enjoyable for the kids, and they had a nice hot tub. The chairs were comfortable lounge chairs and they even set up tiki torch lights once the sun went down. The hotel really was a great choice for us and I would highly recommend it. The only drawback at all had nothing to do with the hotel itself, it was more the area where it is located. We found it was very interesting, but we had no problems with it. The boardwalk had some homeless people further down the road from the hotel and there were certaintly some very interesting characters we saw as we walked on the boardwalk. The hotel itself is very secure and we never felt unsafe. The area around the hotel is pretty casual with a lot of surfers around. It was fun to watch them surfing at high tide! We did not spend much time at the actual beach. The beach area is okay, but certaintly not like the white pristine beaches in the Carribean :). It is just a public beach in California. I knew that this was the case, but playing on the beach was not one of our priorities this vacation. I did see other families with their kids down on the beach playing. My kids seemed to prefer the beautiful pool at the hotel. Anyway, overall I would say the hotel exceeded our expectations. We were very happy with them and would recommend this hotel. I think the two biggest and most important reasons why you would want to stay at this hotel are: 1. the excellent staff/service and 2. the beautiful view of the oceans and the sunset!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to this amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: Bsquared1962
Reviews.Content: I scheduled us for a weekend trip to PT to include a renewal of our wedding vows on 11-11-11. Our fabulous weekend started with the assistance of Angela from PT. She was a great help in getting the "ceremony" put together. The entire staff went above and beyond make this a most memorable trip. Then you add the quality of the hotel and the location right on the beach, perfect! I have never had the level of service and attention to detail from any hotel, ever!! We can't wait to come back!! If possible, do get a 2 or 3 floor room as the views are amazing. I also found the new expanded breakfast very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: db210
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 3 nights in this hotel with my wife and our child. We got the family suite so that we could have our own space and it was well worth it. The rooms were comfortable and well appointed. We also had an ocean view which was very nice. I would say the location was the best thing about this hotel. The walk up and down Ocean Blvd is awesome, the beach is right there, and there are tons of restaurants. We walked to dinner every night. You have to do some minor driving to get to the sights, but we made it down to the Zoo and Balboa Park in about 15 minutes, La Jolla and some of the stuff up that way was about the same drive. 15 minutes to the airport as well. It was easy enough to navigate The only negative, which has been pointed out by other reviewers, is the charge for breakfast. This is a minor issue, but breakfast is complimentary just about everywhere you go. Overall, though, I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - recommended”
Reviews.Author: LambkinBern
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a nice hotel. Really exceeded expectations. The staff were so helpful and the rooms and pool were clean and comfortable. Can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: swf1107
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel October 29 & 30 and again on November 5th. The stay was very relaxing, as usual, the views from the oceanfront rooms is spectacular, especially at sunset!! The first leg of our trip we stayed in Room 319 which has the best afternoon sun!! The only thing that bothers me about this hotel at all is the charge for parking but even at that, it is convenient. Also, the elevators are a little flaky sometimes but it is only 3 floors so the steps are very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: coolcots
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a beautiful setting with a convenient location. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The room had a great view and was very tidy. However the hotel charges an extra $20 per night for parking so we parked on the street. The 24hr gym was quiet - I enjoyed this aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking...”
Reviews.Author: LeviTrop
Reviews.Content: As soon as I walked into our ocean-view suite, I was glad my fiancÃ©e chose this place! Large spacious accommodation with windows all across the suite viewing out to the ocean. You can watch almost 180 degrees of waves crashing onto the shore from your bed!. A small but adequate breakfast buffet is offered in the hotel for around $11. The boardwalk is literally steps from the hotel and lots of great things to do around the vicinity. The only con was a bit of noise coming into our unit from other guests and maintenance staff in the hallways every morning, but not enough that it affected my sleep. I would definitely come back if I am ever in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: hotcountrymusic
Reviews.Content: 3/4 of the way through our stay here and the staff is quite amazing. Friendly and helpful in every way! Kudos!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Views and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: icedkachang
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Thank you Tripadvisor for helping us find it. Absolutely amazing view of the ocean... worth paying extra for the full ocean view. Love the palm trees and sea breezes. Bed was amazing, soo comfy. Nice decor and I really loved the shampoo/ soap (Tommy Bahama, smells like coconut! really nice touch). Staff were extremely helpful and enthusastic. Honestly, everyone was so great. Really nothing to complain about at all! Neighborhood is full of resturants, bars, coffee places, great mexican food, lots of interesting characters. Enjoyed the stroll down the beach and proximity to La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Ambiance of Mauii without the Jetlag.”
Reviews.Author: Douglas B
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here in early November, 2011. The ambiance is Mauii-esque with the indoor/outdoor feeling of the open hallways on each floor, and the ocean-views from the rooms. The service is stellar. The staff go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and relaxed. By the second day, they were addressing us by our names. Special kudos to Cameron Curran and Maria Ratto; they didn't miss a detail or an opportunity to make us feel at home. Our room was fantastic! The bathroom, with the jacuzzi tub and shower, was bigger than some hotel rooms I've stayed in. The two-king suite was very spacious, comfortable, and clean. The beds are like sleeping on a cloud. The giftshop was very nice. The proximity to the boardwalk/promenade along the beach. The many restaurants within walking distance made our stay very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: kelly155032
Reviews.Content: Just recently visited this hotel in October 2011. Beautiful property with great views of Pacific Beach. Get a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor oceanfront....you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Gem”
Reviews.Author: Andrea_027
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here Oct 19 - 20 2011 with our 2.5 year old son as part of a road trip around the state of California. We had a 2 queen room with a balcony on the south end of the hotel with an ocean view. We slept with the balcony doors slightly ajar and were treated to the sound of ocean waves as we slept and the fresh ocean smell. We could see the ocean from our bed! Room was impecable - clean, very nicely decorated (rich woods and cieling panelling, obvious thought put into the styling) and apropriate amenities (minifridge, very nice toiletries and in room coffee). The balcony was ample and outfitted with chairs and a small table. Great for people watching on the beach while enjoying a morning coffee or a nightcap. The bathroom was small - just large enough for toilet and bath/shower unit, but adequate and clean. Service was excellent and staff was polite to our little boy. The recomended us to a great local seafood restaurent, the Fishery, which we enjoyed. They also have a small but good quality breakfast buffet which we enjoyed. We didn't get a chance to try the pool unfortunately, We booked through expedia and got a reasonable price for this hotel. In fact, it was worth more than we paid, given the location (great restaurants, interesting area, reasonable drive to the touristy stuff) and quality. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Our beach getaway - and we live in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: relaxationseeker0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a secret treasure. Perfectly clean, lovely rooms with decks (some with hot tubs). One of the only hotels in SD that actually sits on the sand. Great for families. You can imagine you are in Hawaii here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel & service in our California trip”
Reviews.Author: Midouille
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, right in front of the beach, with only a pathway in the middle. The pool and jacuzzi were a pure delight for our two kids and ourselves. The personnel is extremely attentive to all your needs, all without exception are smiling and greeting you with a positive energy. The room was nice (we got uograded to family suite), very roomy and equipped with all that's needed to enjoy lunches or breakfasts in the privacy of your room. We can only recommend that hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place”
Reviews.Author: Markus1003
Reviews.Content: we have made reservation for two nights in an ocean view room and had a very relaxed time there. check-in was quick and very friendly, they offer complementary parking in the garage of the hotel. everyone of the staff was very friendly and always greated with a smile. our room offered a beautiful view of the beach directly in front of the hotel which is located at front row. the area features a lot of hotels and condos but only small ones and it doesn't get really crowdy. the historic crystal pier and many restaurants are within walking distance. the pacific terrace itself only offers breakfast which was about $ 13 during our stay and of good quality.

Reviews.Title: “best stay in san diego”
Reviews.Author: dianetauzer
Reviews.Content: This is our second time back and we love it. We had not been back since 2008 but much of the same staff was there and they remembered us. The first time we needed a place that I could care for my son wheelchair bound with a badly broken leg. Pacific Terrace was very wonderful about the price and the care. They went out of their way. The second was recently as a vacation/work trip. The rooms are comfortable and quiet. We have stayed on all 3 floors in many different rooms and on both sides of the hotel. There is north and south. South is noisier and north is quieter. Most of the rooms have views of the ocean. The hotel is on the board walk in Pacific Beach steps from the beach. PB is a surfer beach: long stretch of easy waves, life guards along Crystal Pier just down the way. Warning: there are always homeless anywhere on any beach in San Diego. We have never found it uncomfortable but they are always visible. There are many restaurants within walking distance. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in area - just make sure you are happy with Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: ChiswickTurnhamGreen
Reviews.Content: So this hotel is exactly as good as most of the other reviews say. It's by far the best hotel in the area - Pacific Beach. The view onto the beach and the Pacific and the surfers is fantastic; as are the sunsets. Just as good is the level of service here - the quality,warmth, friendliness of every single team member is as good as i have ever know it in any hotel. The best room: The best rooms are on the second and third floors - avoid the first (ground) floor as it's onto the pool and not much of a view of the sea. The best rooms are on the edges of the hotel but they are the suites and I'm not sure they are worth the extra. You get a great sunset from all the ocean front rooms - it does not matter which one you are in. We were slightly to the side of the pool (on the second floor) which was good. Breakfast is really average and I would not bother with it - as one guest said: 'in other hotels this kind of breakfast is normally complimentary.' Go out. There is no restaurant in the hotel but that's fine as there are so many choices in walking distance - ask for the restaurant recommendation sheet they have in reception to find the better places. The hotel is not a trendy hotel - it's very functional but it won't win design awards! It's ideal for families. The secure garage parking, under the hotel, is $20 per day for residents, which is steep. There is free wifi which is of a good quality. I Which brings me to my main problem - the area - Pacific Beach itself. It's a surfer beach, popular with students, and the younger folks. It's NOT a top end resort at all. I guess, for California, it's a little bit of a dive. Trendy dive. So, for example, eating out is cheap and cheerful. There are loads of rowdy sports bars close by. Next time, i think I won't come back to this area (I'll go to La Jolla, see below) which is a shame because i liked the hotel. My advice is to research the area you stay in San Diego very carefully. Here's my very simple guide..... Most important to you is restaurants, busy and good bars and lots of choices. You don't mind not being by the sea.....GAS LAMP QUARTER DOWNTOWN You like being by the sea and like really loud and lively budget places with the trendy vibe....PACIFIC BEACH You want to be by the sea, will pay really premium prices and like it older and more conservative....LA JOLLA (you get the bonus of seeing seals every day on the rocks around La Jolla) In all 3, you'll need a car to get around and inland, into the forests, mountains and desert - all of which are 1.5 hrs drive from San Diego. Bye the way, San Diego is totally cool place - so definitely go. ps top tip - we went in late October and the 'coastal eddy' had started = fog, mist, cold (mid 60s). Simple... 3 days it was miserable on the coast, we drove 1.5 hrs into the mountains and then onto the desert and it was beautiful - totally cloudless blue skies and hot, hot, hot. Within 1.5 hours we went from 65 on the coast to 96 in the desert. I love the fact that that is always and option if you have fog/bad weather in San Diego. If you like my review pls click the 'useful' button - thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location -- and a great staff!”
Reviews.Author: CathyHV
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in three different rooms at this hotel and they were all different but great in their own ways. All had full ocean views. We enjoyed an end room which was directly above the sidewalk. This was perfect for people- and surfer-watching. The other two rooms were more interior and afforded more privacy and a view of the pool and hot tub as well as the beach. Everyone we encountered on the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. This last visit was on my birthday and there was a bottle of wine in the room for me from the hotel. We got dinner recommendations for JRDN (right down the beach) and Piatti (in La Jolla) which were both excellent. The fitness facility is located in the garage. It is small but has enough machines to get a workout. Free wi-fi works great. Parking is valet and is $20 per night but we got such great room rates it was still a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Strange bathroom set-up”
Reviews.Author: UtOpia210
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the northern end of Pacific Beach and we were not disturbed by noise at any time during our three night stay. Our room was one which had an ocean view and had a large balcony. I did not like the fact that the wash basin was located outwith the bathroom and next to the coffee making facility. The coffee from this machine was inferior to that provided free in the foyer each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Pacific Terrace.”
Reviews.Author: maxgjacks
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, I stay here often. I love the people and the service. Danny C. is especially helpful. I plan on staying a loyal customer.

Reviews.Title: “look no further!”
Reviews.Author: bmxm0m
Reviews.Content: The staff is unsurpassed. It's hard to beat 100% smiling faces, warm welcomes and a sincere desire to make your stay the best. EVERYONE went above & beyond here. We reserved a 'partial ocean view' room thinking we would have to crank our necks around a wall to catch a glimpse but to our surprise, it was a fantastic view of the ocean. The 'partial' part I guess was because it was on the 1st floor and the gate around the premises blocked an unhibited view? Loved the individual patio (w/ every room), we thought the breakfast was good (was advertised as "new", possibly changed since a previous review stated it was poor?). Our room wasn't really big but it was clean, had comfortable beds, and you can't beat the proximitiy to the beach. This was a family vacation and our kids loved the pool and the hot tub was very nice too. The hotel had beach toys and chairs for us to borrow as well as bikes for us to ride along the oceanside pathway. This is a very 'happening' area; a young/surfers demographic. We felt very comfortable and enjoyed walking to nearby restaurants that are popular w/ the locals. 'Joe' at the front desk was especially kind and out of his way helpful to us. The concierge was great to. We look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good view but otherwise unexceptional”
Reviews.Author: SteveM114
Reviews.Content: If you place great value on an ocean side room and good view then it will be worth you paying the extra to stay here. However, in my view it otherwise fairly ordinary. Rooms are ok, a little dated but comfortable, but the hotel has no bar and is dead in the evenings. Breakfast is very poor quality. Pool is nice and staff generally helpful.the area around the hotel lacks any sophistication with many noisy bars more suited to the yound surfer crowd. Nearby La Jola is 20 mins by bus, much more upmarket with lovely shops and restaurants. It s well worth visiting for an afternoon or evening out

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: legalmanager
Reviews.Content: This is about our 5th stay at this great hotel, which has a excellent location on the beach on the south end of Pacific Beach. Angela, the Chief Concierge, provided above and behind the norm for outstanding service when a minor issue came up about our room. The hotel is very clean, has great views of the beach and amazing sunsets and a very friendly staff. There are also numerous places to eat within a few blocks from the hotel. A have attached a few on my photos of the area, as well as my web site of my photography. http://photomanva.zenfolio.com/p145278967

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Wilda S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 9-23-11 till 9-27-11 and it was a wonderful experience. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. They helped us get a rental car at a discounted price and they gave us great tips on places to go to sightsee and to eat out. The view of the ocean is fantastic and you can walk right out of the pool area onto the sidewalk that borders the beach. There are lots of places to eat within walking distance. We would love to go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing people, amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Park3r51
Reviews.Content: I've ben to this hotel twice and they've over booked my room both times, but with that said they were very gracious and helpful they upgraded my steady both times. The location could not get any better right in the center of pacific beach and inches off the ocean. The staff is wonderful and the rooms are comfortable and modern. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the PB area.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanside Gem”
Reviews.Author: Donna0004
Reviews.Content: This is a diamond with a clear-cut mission:to deliver the friendliest customer service around. Rooms with a view of sunrise early morning surfers provide instant relaxation. Bath products are top shelf. There is a great massage room ground level and dinner delivery from close restaurants. This is the best place to stay in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Carter1234
Reviews.Content: Our 4 night stay at Pacific Terrace Hotel has been great. The rooms are updated, clean and very nice. Hotel staff is courteous and goes above & beyond. Soft drinks/water is available at the pool all day & they are literally right on the ocean (within a few steps to the sand!) Their breakfast is wonderful & priced well for what you get. We visited the zoo & Angela (consierge) was very helpful with discount tickets and directions. We would definitely recommend staying here. It's a great place!!

Reviews.Title: “Just keeps getting better”
Reviews.Author: TravelRanger87508
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd stay at the property was complete with 9+ hour power outage that adversely effected much of SoCal, but the staff was prepared and gracious with their provisions & hospitality. Outstanding location, Location, LOCATION... As a youngster growing up at kennel on Pacific Coast Highway in Malibu I'd gaze over the wall at the ocean; as a guest at PTH (from Santa Fe, New Mexico) I gaze from the balcony, inhale deeply, and feel young again... Phil

Reviews.Title: “Blackout Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: runaway_with_me
Reviews.Content: Not only the nicest hotel on the beach, but incredibly prepared when the power went out Sept. 8th for almost 12 hours. Every room was given a lantern, (thank goodness!), and staff in the dining area set out cheese, crackers, trail and chex mix packages galore, evian water bottles, and best of all, free wine! Rooms were lovely, beds cozy, and all very clean. Staff members were always pleasant. Pricey, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace - best place on the beach in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: mcrosson
Reviews.Content: Here is the wonderful hotel I stayed at in San Diego - the www.PacificTerrace.com ... right on the beach, small boutique style with impeccable service and fantastic rooms. A combination of Tommy Bahama and Ralph Lauren styling, very spacious and inviting. It gets my highest recommendation and I'm pretty darn picky.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: Katherine_Albany_CA
Reviews.Content: For years, while staying at a "modest" hotel nearby, we would walk by the Pacific Terrace Hotel and envy the folks basking by the gorgeous pool overlooking the ocean. At our old hotel, we had to walk down a crummy alley, past the dumpsters and pools of some kind of liquid to get to the bluffs. Pacific Terrace was our Shangri-La! For our anniversary, we decided to splurge and we booked a room at the Pacific Terrace. We were delighted that the price wasn't *that much* more than what we had been paying. The people were friendly and were there when we needed them. Having easy access to bicycles and boogie boards made the whole experience even more of a treat. To get to the ocean, all we had to do is step outside the front door or through the pool gate and we were on the bluffs...with a short jaunt to the waves and beautiful beach below. We love the casual, uncrowded atmosphere of Pacific Beach. And, this is the best place to stay in Pacific Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: beach_h20
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from an amazing and romantic weekend! The staff was very pleasant, the rooms were great (they have a nice tropical feel), and you canâ€™t beat the location right on the beach!! The pool area was fantastic as well! If possible, be sure to get an ocean front room for the view. If you have a vehicle, youâ€™ll have to pay to park here as there is very limited street parking. There is plenty of decent shopping, restaurants, and bars nearby, Taco Surf was great for a quick lunch, and we really liked a few of the breakfast places we tried. Konoâ€™s is great for a laid back home cooked feel. If youâ€™re looking to kick it up a notch in formality, take the short trip to LaJolla and have breakfast at The Cottage. Fantastic food and a great setting!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, even better staff.”
Reviews.Author: Justin B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the 2011 San Diego blackout. The staff really went above and beyond to make me and all guests as comfortable and safe as possible. Everything in the city was closed, but we had a pretty good time in the hotel! The pictures of this place don't lie - it's amazing. The pool is great, the rooms are amazing. They're not just the cookie-cutter rooms you would get in a Hilton or Marriott - some thought actually went into laying them out. But in my humble opinion, the staff really makes this place stand out among all the places I stayed on my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fawn07
Reviews.Content: We reserved a third floor room with a balcony and ocean view. The room was very clean. The furnishings were in good condition. The view was great -- ocean view and pool view. It was a bit noisy in the morning when the crew was preparing the pool for the day, but if the door was closed and the AC on, we heard nothing. Lounging at the pool is pleasant. Isaac is attentive to all of his guests. The location is excellent. Only a few minutes from Mission Beach and a few more in the other direction to La Jolla. We rented a car so that made it very easy to get around. (Elsewhere in San Diego be prepared to have quarters handy for the meters.) I did not encounter the rowdies from down the walk as mentioned in other reviews. No one bothered us at night. Seriously, the location is great and you don't need a car if you just want to stay in the area. Restaurants and shopping are all in walking distance. The turn-down service chocolates were very good! We departed at the crack of dawn and our tab was ready to go. The staff at the front desk were always on duty and very friendly. I will surely make it back for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: brainman
Reviews.Content: We booked a double queen ocean view room. We got room 114, on the first floor, middle of the hotel, right next to the breakfast room. We got a decent prepaid rate. We could see the ocean waves across the pool and through the wind break. The pool area entrance was steps from our back door. The room was very nice and well thought out. It had a small refrigerator, and we used the microwave in the breakfast room when needed. The staff were very helpful. One downside was that we could hear them making breakfast through the walls starting a little after 6am each morning. Also $20/night for parking, while safe and convenient, is a bit excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Completely overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Kate S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the start of our honeymoon so we splashed out a lot more money than normal after seeing some good reviews but I can't understand why this hotel is rated so highly. It is completely over-priced and you have to pay for everything ($5 to drink the bottled water in your room, $20 a day to park in the garage). No-one helped us with our luggage when we arrived after a 20-hour trip, the room was nice but freezing cold and the air con was constantly on (the maid always turned it on while we were out so when we got back it took hours for the room to heat up and I had to get into bed to get warmer) and it was the same in the breakfast room where, even though the temperature outside was unseasonably low and no-one could sit out, the air con belted out freezing air you while you tried to eat a fairly limited-choice brekkie. Reception was fairly friendly and the hotel seems clean but, overall, I would never pay that much again for such a bog-standard hotel - for that price, it should have been super.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls, ceiling, and floor, we will not be returning”
Reviews.Author: christmaszorro
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful location at a compromise. We stayed in the Executive suite room. The neighbors on all three sides were audible. It was disturbing to hear the upstairs occupants walk the length of their room at night. When we stay in a hotel quiet only comes second to the bed comfort and luxury. Unfortunately, this hotel left much to be desired. The bed was too firm and pillows too large and hard. The bed sheets were very scratchy and stiff. The brunch/breakfast was completely inedible. The pre-made "omelet" was a salty nightmare, the waffles were rubbery under the heat lamp, and the fruit was fermented and soggy. For a hotel with only 4 levels (including the garage) the elevator was excruciatingly slow, at least the stairs were somewhat accessible. The hotel does not even come close to having the right number of bike for it's occupants to rent. The only redeeming quality of such an over priced hotel was the friendly staff. Needless to say we will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for two days but loved it so much I ended up not wanting to leave so I took vacation to stay an extra day. This hotel probably has the friendliest and genuinely most helpful staff of any hotel I've stayed at (and I generally spend two to three weeks in hotels around the US every year).

Reviews.Title: “Great view and location-High Price-very average rooms at best”
Reviews.Author: mlsLincoln_MA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely situated on Pacific Beach. We had a third floor ocean room and the view is spectacular. I felt the neighborhood was safe and offers a wide variety of good dining options in the neighborhood, provided you are willing to drive to some. The public areas are well kept and the staff is extremely friendly, always going out of their way to cordially greet you every time you pass by them. Although the pool is not huge, we enjoyed it. The hot tub was also nice. We were disappointed in our room. At $500 a night and all the glowing reviews (#2 in San Diego!), our expectations were high. The rooms are dark, cramped and cluttered with a lot of large clunky furniture that is not functional. There were no regular size drawers to put our clothes in, so we kept them in our suitcase â€“ but there was barely a place to set our open suitcase (that was out of the way). The bathroom vanity was so cluttered with stuff that there was no room for our stuff. The caulk and tile in the bath and shower area was dirty and installed poorly. I recall seeing a previous review that said something like: â€œthink Best Western with wood trim.â€� I think that pretty much sums up the quality and style of the rooms. Which would be fine, if we werenâ€™t paying $500 a nightâ€¦â€¦ It was nice to have breakfast available in the hotel, and they have an adequate selection. However, the precooked breakfast is of mediocre quality (e.g., dry toast, hard waffles). They have the staff on hand and the facility to cook eggs made to order, which would be a great addition. If the breakfast were fully included, it would be harder to complain. But it goes back to the value issue: since we were paying extra for it, we were expecting a bit more. Oh, and the chocolate chip cookies that everyoneâ€™s talking about? We heard about them, we even smelled them, but we never saw one. Apparently, thereâ€™s about a 30 minute window in which you might be fortunate enough to get oneâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning location but needs to up its game a bit”
Reviews.Author: cadsden
Reviews.Content: All the comments about the location are spot on. On advice of other reviews we took a 3rd floor ocean view room and this was good advice; it is stunning. The views get better as you go up and the view from the ground floor is hardly 'ocean view', more pool view. We didn't encounter any of the noise that some reviews mentioned - we slept with the balcaony doors open and all we could hear was the ocean. Our one issue was over service at breakfast. This hotel is not cheap so if what follows sounds picky it's because we're judging it against similarly price hotels. We stayed for 4 days and: On 2 days the coffee ran out On 1 day the OJ ran out On 3 days they were incredibly slow to clear tables - far slower than just about anyway I can remember. This results in a pigeon problem if you are eating outside and you have the 'pleasure' or pigeons eating left-overs on neraby tables. All these were attended to when we asked but you just shouldn't have to point this out to staff. Don't get me wrong - this is a very nice hotel in a great location but there is a risk they are living off their location and not attending to some of the basics For UK visitors who may be thinking of staying at the LA beaches, go to San Diego instead. There is no comparison if you just want to chill out.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: Umberto B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a family suite with our 7-year and twin, 2-year old girls. Prior to our arrival we requested two cribs for the twins and were promptly assured that two pack-n-play would be waiting for us in our room upon check-in. The cribs weren't there when we arrived, but a visit to the front desk fixed that. The 2-room suite is not terribly large, calling it a "family" suite is a bit of a stretch. The living / dining room has a pullout sofa bed with a comfortable but somewhat complicated air inflatable mattress (electric pump is in the closet), and no direct access to either patio or bathroom, remember that if you like to watch TV late at night while other family members are sleeping next door. The \bedroom has two very comfortable queen beds and a small work desk, but not enough room for the cribs, so we ended up leaving those in the living room and our older daughter slept with us on the second queen bed since the cribs took all the room in front of the sofa bed, no big deal but we were hoping for some extra room in a family suite, honestly. Some nice touches in the room: a power strip with plenty of available outlets for phones and laptops by the desk, an iHome radio on the nightstand, an available refrigerator in addition to the minibar fridge for the babies' milk and stuff, two big, high quality flat screen TVs and DVD players, Tommy Bahamas toiletries, four big pool towels - but make sure you bring them back with you to the room or they will charge you for the missing ones. Not so nice: somewhat dated furniture and carpets, a bathtub with an anemic shower head (in a suite at this price we expected separate shower stall and tub), poor wi-fi coverage. We were on the first floor (suite 105) and could barely get a signal, or none at all, depending of where we sat. I hate that. Service was spotty: Very friendly staff, but we left the room at 10 am the second day and when we came back at 2 pm for our girlls' afternoon nap, the room had not been done yet. We called and scheduled it for 6 pm, housekeeping did come while we were out for dinner but must have been in a rush as they forgot a bunch of cleaning supplies and dirty rags in our bathroom. My wife and daughters had no complaints about the pool, service staff was attentive and friendly everywhere else. We ate breakfast in the room, much easier with little kids... The $20 daily "valet park" fee should be eliminated, though. First of all, the valet attendant is almost never there and it is really way faster to self park, it's a small hotel. Also, 500 bucks for a room and you want and extra $20 to park my car, seriously? Finally, a couple of hours after checking out someone called my cell and left a message saying that housekeeping could "smell some strong smoke odor" in my room and I would be assessed a $250 fee, bye bye. WHAT? We don't smoke and, if we did with 3 small kids in our room, we should probably be in jail, lol! I called them and, after putting me on hold for a while, a manager came back on the phone to tell me the fee would be waived... She never explained why I was assessed the fee to begin with, a mistake perhaps? I don't care either way, but I can't help but thinking that, had I not called right away to complain, that fee would have stuck. Everyone makes mistakes, but before you accuse someone of smoking in a $500/night non-smoking room you better make 100% sure you know what you are talking about. Finally, the location: It's great as long as you concentrate on the ocean in front of you: Unbeatable views, breezes and walks on the beach just steps away, really gorgeous. The area around the hotel, on the other hand, is definitely forgettable. It's fine to hang out during the day but I would not feel safe walking around at night with small kids. We didn't, we took the car to go eat since the hotel has no restaurant. Lots of beach dives, taco stands and fairly seedy pubs, rowdy kids in a party mood (it's the end of summer, maybe that had something to do with it) and the occasional homeless sleeping on a bench, Pacific Beach is not very family friendly in my opinion. There are a few good restaurants on Garnett, but you have to really look for them between the junk. San Diego is better than that, but you'll need to drive a while to figure it out.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: mike c
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel really made a difference, and it didn't matter whether it was the front desk attendant, a maid or bellhop. Everyone had a smile on their face and was very willing to help. The rooms and pool/spa were kept clean, the beds were very comfy, and the ceiling fan as a nice touch. Breakfast at the resort was very convenient and well worth it. Parking in the underground garage was extremely convenient considering the parking situation in PB. You really couldn't ask for a better location either, right on the beach! A short walk down the "boardwalk" led to many restaurants and shops. I took my daughters to experience the laid-back Southern California lifestyle and they haven't stopped talking about it. I usually do not return to the same place twice, but I can't wait to schedule a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Vacation, awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jason F
Reviews.Content: My new bride and I stayed here for our honey moon and the hotel certainly helped make it a special and memorable occasion. From the ocean front room, the friendly staff, and the comfortable roomsâ€”our stay was amazing and truly helped make our honeymoon special. The location is also great as there are plenty of restaurants and outlet stores within walking distance. The staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with lovely location”
Reviews.Author: TOfamily269
Reviews.Content: Have to agree with most other reviews, that this is a great hotel. Like a resort vacation in the city. It is definetly not in the centre of town but if you have a car and like to experience more than the tourist areas it is a great spot. Pool area was great and heated.There is no restaurant but we rarely ever eat in hotel restaurants. It is on the pricey side but the treat was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!!”
Reviews.Author: Mjv5
Reviews.Content: We were here for a girls' weekend trip - and LOVED our stay. Friendly staff, unbeatable location, flexible check-out times, absolutely stellar facility. Mellow vibe on site, but lots to do just steps away from the hotel. We can't wait to come back for another weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and loved the room and location”
Reviews.Author: getupandgonow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took his handicapped brother to San Diego for a 5-day vacation and stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. I was underwhelmed with the hotel lobby, but our rooms/suites with a patio overlooking the beach made up for any misgivings upon our arrival. The accommodations were very nice and offered everything we needed, including plenty of seating, a mini-kitchen area, table and chairs, desk and chair, comfortable beds, and a mini-fridge for leftovers from the wonderful restaurants not far away. When we wanted to relax, we were entertained by a non-stop parade of beach lovers -- riding, and running on the beach path -- yet we never suffered from lack of privacy, or noise. June, we discovered, is very cool on the beach in San Diego, and had we done our homework, we would have visited in July or August. I cannot say enough about the kindness of this staff toward my brother-in-law. He was treated wonderfully, as were we, always with gracious attitudes and warm smiles. I highly recommend this lovely hotel, and I send an earnest "thank you" to every member of this hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend - Big is not always better”
Reviews.Author: nancyp45
Reviews.Content: This gem of a hotel (73 rooms I believe)in in the Pacific Beach area of San Diego and right on the ocean. We had a partial ocean view room (304) and it was perfect. Bath had sink, toilet and great shower/tub. Outside the room was a separate sink area. Hotel was very well maintained - no sign of any wear and tear. If you are in to biking, hotel offers bikes to ride the beautiful paths along the shoreline All staff very very friendly and attentive from desk managers to room staff and valets.
