Genuinely seemed to care about the comfort of their clients. Although there was a parking charge, you were free to pick up your own car and have all day in and out privileges. One interesting point I have never seen in an hotel was the air conditioning system. If the patio doors were open, the air conditioning system cut out. When closed, the automatically cut in at the temperature you chose. Very green! If you are here for R and R this is the perfect little gem. If you want to see the sights of San Diego, you will definitely need a car.. There is an adequate breakfast buffet to satisfy all tastes. No other meal service available but many restaurants within walking distance. Side note: on this trip we also stayed at the JW Marriott in Santa Monica and the Disney California Resort Hotel. This one wins hands down. Big is not always better.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced!!”
Reviews.Author: Tetley12
Reviews.Content: Way too expensive for what you get!! No restaurant, charge $20 for parking, didn't even clean the room our first day, the lady came to do turn down service, we told her it hadn't even been cleaned yet. She did a few things but didn't clean, no fresh pool towels and did not replenish the coffee. Normally not a big deal but when you are paying close to $400 a night it better be perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: LobsterBrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last November, and really enjoyed our stay. Everything about this place was above average. Great rooms, great location, professional staff, etc. We can't say enough good things about this place. We are planning on coming back again, this November.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort at great location on Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: rev5
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace Hotel is definitely worthy of its high ranking. The hotel staff provided us excellent service beginning with the reservation process and continuing throughout our stay. Danielle was extremely helpful in working with me to get the best possible rate for our partial ocean view room. Cameron (bellman/valet) and Joe (guest services) offered several great suggestions for dinner and made us feel welcome each time we returned to the hotel. The hotel itself is very attractive, clean, and well located on Pacific Beach. Our room had a balcony with a great view of the ocean and nearby pier. The room was decorated with Tommy Bahama furnishings which were attractive and functional. The beds were very comfortable and the room and bathroom were extremely clean and spacious. The breakfast buffet was average and our preferred rate enabled us to get it for half price at $5.75 per day, per person. When staying in the Pacific Beach area, you should realize how congested the area is. We walked down the beach for miles and it is just one building after another. The beach is wide and nice (the water is cold). It's easy to find restaurants, clubs, and shopping within walking distance. Walking is the best way to get around because there is no other place to park your car other than the hotel. It costs $20 per day to park and the parking garage was well lit and convenient - definitely worth it, considering the lack of parking in the area. There were a lot of people partying at clubs/condos/restaurants along the boardwalk; so if that offends you, you might want to pick another beach. We saw plenty of families along the boardwalk too. The Pacific Terrace Hotel is on the north end of the boardwalk, so it doesn't get the same foot traffic and noise as its neighbors to the south. The hotel loaned us boogie boards, beach chairs, and beach towels at no charge which was a nice benefit. This location was convenient to our trip to Torrey Pines State Park and La Jolla. Though we didn't go there, Sea World was nearby. For our week-long trip to San Diego we stayed in three different places - a B&B in Coronado, the Pacific Terrace, and a B&B in Hillcrest. Each place offered different scenery and activities. There's so much to do in San Diego and this was a great way to see more of the city. I would highly recommend the Pacific Terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced in a dump of a town”
Reviews.Author: 5StarVillanearDisney
Reviews.Content: I can't believe the great ratings people are giving this hotel! Yes the staff are friendly but very young. We were asked at breakfast 'do you have a last name?' doesn't everyone? The rooms are ok but certainly not 4 star rated. We visited the Coronado on our way back to the Pacific Terrace & it is a true luxury hotel with rates about $100 less a night. We could have cried. The website really misleads guests - there is no spa as such, it is a door which is locked and you have to call a number. The pool is small and unheated with scruffy dated lounger cushions. The breakfast was lukewarm with no fresh toast or hot tea. The so called room service is from local restaurants not inhouse. We walked to see what they were like, they were jam packed with drunks, music thumping - 8pm. Then there were the vagrants, stinking on the benches we walked past along the beach which was badly lit - also people just staggering about, drugged up, smoking weed. We had our kids with us who were scared so did a quick walk round the block and came back without dinner. The hotel is in an area of small streets leading to the beach, some of the homes have furniture dumped in the gardens and it's generally a run down scruffy area with no fine dining. Fine for spring breakers, not families. Our dinner on our 2nd night was snacks from the CVS - great! Realistically the price per night should be $150. $20 for valet parking is also a joke - we got our own car out every time. It is more like an inn or motel that has been refurbished to look good with selective photography and wording. They should watch out for trading standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for anyone on a business trip or a weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: Scott E
Reviews.Content: Spend a Wed thru Friday here and was pleasently surprised at the accomodations. As most of teh reviews point out, the rooms are great and the the hotel has a lot to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding. Customer service is clearly their highest priority.”
Reviews.Author: Deeter256
Reviews.Content: Every single person I enteracted with, from the front desk to the maintainance guys to the maids, everyone was absloutly delightful. Everyone said hello to you with a willing and genuine smile. They were there to answer questions when you had them and make arrangments for you. The hotel is beautiful. Excellent location. It was a delight to stay there. A+

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: dddenise51
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, the staff was friendly, pleasant, and helpful. The room was very nice, comfortable beds, good shower, plenty of linens. The carpet was the worst part of the hotel, it was stained and funky looking. Loved the balconey. Location was tops. Breakfast at Kono's almost everyday. Enjoyed the Starbucks coffee in the lobby every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: pamr48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel, which was the last stop on our 10-day California vacation, in October 2010. We traveled the opposite way most people do, I guess, and started up north in Sacramento and made our way down the coast. Loved the entire trip, but what a beautiful way to end it! The hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, but the staff could not have been more helpful during check in and our room was spectacular! Nice big room, gorgeous HUGE furniture - 2 beds, big closet and sink/vanity area with an enormous bathroom (oddly laid out with a giant empty space where there should have been another vanity and sink) a large shower and toilet. The balcony overlooked the pool and hot tub and the view of the Pacific was perfect! The hotel is right on the path that runs along the cliffs and is close to the Crystal Pier and lots of restaurants and bars. The hotel had a concierge who was very helpful with directions, maps and advice. The free breakfast was OK - nothing fancy. We loved this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort”
Reviews.Author: Doug026
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, but a little more than I usually would spend for a four night outing.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service: Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: laurlee
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a one night stay. I have NEVER been so impressed by the service and staff at any hotel, ever. (Not even the Hotel Del Coronado in SD, which has NOTHING on this hotel except being famous and overpriced). Everyone was so extremely helpful without being insincere. They seem as if they enjoy their jobs:) (Must have a great management team). We found parking when we arrived, unloaded with help and later valet parked. Andrew (staff) delivered our bags to our room and even unloaded a box of capri suns into the fridge. Over and beyond expectations. We requested bed rails and they were delivered within 5 minutes. We loved the room #218. Beautiful furnishings, crown moulding, widescreen tv, ipod dock, etc. We borrowed their bikes and the staff helped us by attaching my trailer to one of the bikes and when we returned he collapsed it and stowed it in my parked car for me. The spa and pool were heated nicely. The only improvement suggestion would be to have a restroom outside or nearer the pool. It was inconvenient to have to go outside of the pool area with my room key, to go inside near the reception desk to the unisex restroom using my key. We were with toddlers so we frequented the restroom a bit. You also need keys to leave property. The outside shower was nice too, nice and as warm or hot as you like. The "Tommy Bahama" toiletries could have been some no frills brand but I brought my own so no big deal (but I did try them). Overall, I would recommend to anyone. Great place. I am so glad I got to experience it and hope to return one day when my budget allows, since it was $400.00 plus a night.

Reviews.Title: “Listen to the Pacific Ocean whilst lying luxury”
Reviews.Author: spinach_eater
Reviews.Content: Having never been to San Diego before we wanted to experience the Pacific Beach atmosphere but having spent the first part of our travels in basic accommodation we also wanted some luxury. We chose the Pacific Terrace Hotel for both its luxury and its position and it didn't let us down. When we arrived the check-in was handled swiftly and perfectly and after a long drive south to SD it was so pleasant to be able to walk in and check in so quickly. I needed parking and I used the onsite basement parking, You can unload and put your luggage strait in the lift up to your room. We had requested a room overlooking the sea and that is exactly what we got with a balcony and seating to enjoy the view. The reception staff were excellent and extremely helpful we used the beach chairs and umbrellas, which you can borrow from reception, a couple of times and nothing was any trouble. The staff all seem to enjoy what they do and are very helpful. We even had animals created from the towels placed on top of the TV unit or on the bed when the room had been cleaned which really was a nice surprise. It was particularly nice to be able to open the doors of the balcony and hear the waves of the Pacific crashing on the shore while lying in bed. The position of the hotel is perfect, its right on the board walk to Pacific Beach but not in the centre of activity so you are not disturbed in any way as you might be if you were based more directly in the middle of things. Our room was quite small for a family of 4 but we managed fine. The room had a coffee maker and fridge which is great. There was also a 42 inch HD TV which was also great. There are no restaurants in this hotel but having said that, the breakfast is well done and ample. This means that you have to consider that you have go out and find somewhere to eat every time. This is perhaps the only negative, all the restaurants we sampled in the near vicinity are mediocre at best. You have to go at least three blocks back into SD to find somewhere to have a good meal. Granted there are quite a few restaurants along the Pacific Beach boardwalk but they are not great as it seems that they are quite happy with the passing trade they have and seem to cater for the drinking customer more. The best we found was the Green Flash and they got our order wrong but what we had was OK. The pool is nice, clean and gets sun pretty well all day. We had a great few days here and would recommend this establishment but its quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and comfortable with family of 4”
Reviews.Author: fire860
Reviews.Content: I been reading searching which hotel to stay at. It was between Del or pacific. We are so glad we choose the pacific. The first step you wall in their hotel you are treated so kindly from hotel front to bell man to the guy ay the pool. The rooms are beautiful and large enough room for two kiddos. The view is breath taking I would suggest if you already going stay and not sure if you want to pay extra for the view. I would say do it. It's worth it. We stay in pool until 945 at night, our kids where hungry went down stairs to see where we can walk to get them bite to eat they gave us a packet and said these people delivery. This is wonderful hotel we will be back. The night before we stay at their sister hotel The Dana that was a waste pacific terrance all the way

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Beach Visit”
Reviews.Author: RickGracie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely for a couple's getaway. We stayed in a room overlooking the beach on the second floor. The property was very clean and well maintained. The secure, underground parking was superb. The hotel staff were concientious and efficient. The heated pool was very nice. My only concern was the beach culture from Ocean Beach to Mission Beach to Pacific Beach area seemed a bit more drunken & loud than I would normally prefer. Please note that our visit was on a holiday weekend, but suffice to say the natives were very friendly. This is a fun area for consenting adults, but families might be happier further north around La Jolla to Carlsbad.

Reviews.Title: “It was the right place for our family”
Reviews.Author: txfamily4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pacific Terrace 2 years ago and it was a great memory so we went back this July and stayed 5 nights. We were so thankful that we even got the same exact room we had 2 years ago,,,a King Jr Suite. We are a family of 4 that includes twin 9 year olds. I felt that the room was clean and well maintained. We loved that we had access to beach toys, chairs and an umbrella. The umbrella was a huge benefit to me as we are all extremely fair skinned and burn easily as a result. The room had a breakfast bar area with refrigerator and microwave (plus a mini bar which we never used). There was a sofa sleeper that was a little larger than twin bed size which was great for the kids. The room was a great size and arrangement for us where we could have access to our own snacks and make a lunch or dinner for the times we wanted to save a little money,,,or too tired to go out. The "kitchen" area was stocked with plates, glasses and utensils. It was on the first floor with a patio that opened out to the pool area. It is the only room I've stayed in that had enough trash cans! I thought the hotel was fairly quiet. We are not picky about things like that. My kids are usually the ones making the noise. There was a workout room that I meant to visit but never did and also a computer available. There are even books available to read which was great for me because I forgot to bring one. The hotel is right off the beach. It is exactly what my daughters loved,,,,alternating between the pool and the beach. It was so easy for us with it being on the first floor. Access to the hotel and pool is secure. We always felt safe and it was not over-run with people at the pool or the breakfast buffet. Surf lessons are offered up and down the beach. The boardwalk was great for exercise. We meant to rent bikes but never got around to it. It was a great and lazy vacation,,,,just what we were looking for. We didn't need the big resorts with the fancy pools. My daughters (age 9) were perfectly happy with the pool and beach. We met another family that had been coming there for 25 years and staying in the same room. Everyone we met was really nice. I feel like they kept up the clientele so we were never concerned with the other guests. Everyone was quiet and respectful of privacy. The breakfast buffet was simple but just what we wanted. There was a great breakfast place down the beach a short walk,,,,Konos,,,the portions were huge. Yes, hotel parking is $20 per day,,,as it is for most nice hotels on the beach. There was a lot of kelp on the beach and I did read up on that situation about the kelp washing ashore and that it is best for the environment for it to be left there. It was interesting and I recommend reading up on the subject. It certainly didn't slow us down or impact us one way or the other. The staff was friendly and helpful. We all pledged that we want to repeat it again next year,,,exactly the same as this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Slipping just a tiny bit but still a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wallywanna
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our second time at this very nice hotel in July. While we will come back again, I found the staff to be just a bit more rushed and a bit more over worked in all areas, leading to some confusion. The rooms were not quite as spotless as they had been, and a couple of items in the room required maintenance. A little dissapointing given the high summer rates. The views remain priceless, and the opportunity to walk and run the boardwalk and eat at some quaint local restaurants offset this however.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Phillytravels
Reviews.Content: A clean hotel is the number one thing I look for, so I was happy here. Housekeeping did a great job. A few times, we left in the morning and stopped back at the room fairly early, like 12:30, and the room would already have been cleaned. I stayed in a partial ocean view room for 6 nights at $420 a night. I didn't know it came with a kitchenette, so that was a nice surprise. It had a small frig, microwave, coffeemaker, sink, and plates, bowls, and utensils. It came in handy. The balcony overlooked the ocean on the left and directly underneath and to the right was grass and a view of another building. The Pacific Beach area can be noisy at night. I left the patio door open to hear the ocean overnight. Drunken carousers screaming below at like 3 am woke me up the first night. I came to San Diego for comic con, and the hotel was close to everything I wanted to see. I don't think it took longer than 10 minutes to drive to the convention center, the zoo, Sea World, La Jolla, etc. There are also a lot of restaurants you can walk to from the hotel within a few blocks. There's a Trader Joe's a couple blocks away as well, so you can buy drinks, etc. to bring to the zoo or the other attractions that want to charge you an insane amount for a snack or bottle of water. Parking isn't too bad if you don't mind sometimes having to walk a block or two. There is a garage at the hotel that is $20 a night, but we just parked on the street, and it was fine. It's well marked where you can park and can't, mostly only signs for street cleaning (no parking first Wed. of the month sort of thing). The staff was really nice about answering questions about getting around and parking and didn't push us to pay for the garage, which is what I expected. They provide a lot of nice little touches which I appreciated: free iced tea and cookies, 4 beach towels in your room, HBO, everyone on staff makes a point of saying hello. The only thing I can come up with negative is that they were doing construction on the pool area, so I didn't get a chance to use it. But it wasn't a big deal, since the beach is right there. Also it would have been nice if there was another entrace other than the lobby. It was quite a hike to get to my room each time on the other side of the building. Usually they have a back door you can stick your keycard in, but I never saw one. Overall, I'd highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “4th of July...long beautiful weekend”
Reviews.Author: azindy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 1 - July 5, 2011. We were a little concerned as we were driving through Pacific Beach and wondering if we were going to be dissapointed. However, this place is very nice and the immediate surrounding area is nice as well. We booked a partial ocean view and was not dissapointed. We were on ground level and right next to the pool and hot tub. Easily walked out the locked gate to the beach path for walks. Further south and into Mission Beach for this busy holiday weekend was frat house like, but at Pacific Terrace it was family friendly. We had our bikes on our car and the hotel had bike racks in the locked underground parking just waiting for us! We rode our bikes along the beach path from the hotel all the way to the south end of Mission Beach and around to the bay side and back up (more than once). The area through Mission Beach was a party crowd July 4th weekend, and pretty crowded. On the second trip we found the alley just behind the first row of houses and that sped things up. We ate at The Green Flash and it was just fair. We rode our bikes all the way to Luigi's on the Beach for some good pizza and very nice San Diego micro brews. Luigi's has the largest pizza I've ever seen! Very nice trip, and would definately stay at Pacific Terrace again.

Reviews.Title: “5 star resort on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: dizeeblnd
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Staff was wonderful. Beautiful property in the perfect location. Very high class.

Reviews.Title: “definately will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: westcoast25
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel and a fantastic location. All of the employees provided great service. But especially an employee named Cameron. This guy went above and beyond and made me feel like i was staying at my friends house. This employee is trully an asset to your hotel. In addition, the only complaint i have was on the fourth we wanted to park ourselves and they made us valet not to big of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “way too expensive”
Reviews.Author: aarcher888
Reviews.Content: this hotel is ok but way too expensive. you have to pay for parking. The room was huge but the bathroom tiny! paid over $400 for one night....there is not even a jacuzzi in the room....

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: knitloon
Reviews.Content: The photos online don't do this hotel justice. This is a very casual area of San Diego...not at all upscale. The location on the beach, however, is spectacular. Be sure to book a room with a full ocean view. Youbwon't be disappointed. We spent hours on our balcony just watching the waves and the surfers right out front. As others have said, the staff here is phenomenal. They not only fulfill every need, they anticipate your needs before you realize you need it! Katherine and Angela at the concierge desk are amazing and incredibly professional. Unfortunately, there is no restaurant on the premises. However, they offer a wonderful breakfast buffet (not free), and there are many reasonably priced restaurants within walking distance. We wouldnstay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottgNJ
Reviews.Content: Pacific Terrace is an excellent hotel, highly recommended. The rooms are immaculate, the staff amazingly friendly, and the beachfront location cannot be topped. Breakfast in the Carribean Lounge is well worth the cost and very covenient. Pacific Beach itself is a surfer area with many bars, clubs, and tattoo parlors, and a younger crowd that my family was not comfortable around at night. It was a bit difficult to find family oriented restaurants without driving so plan accordingly. The Firehouse and Tony Roma's were very good however. My 13 year old loved Fatburger, 2 blocks away. The beach is very nice and right in front of the hotel. Our oceanfront room view was just off the front corner of the building, we did have a lot of street view, a bit disappointing, but still a spectacular view. All the major SD attractions are only about 15 minutes away, and this was very convenient. The on site pool is very small and we did not use it. $20/night parking seems unnecessary with the room rates but it is very secure. Overall, highly recommended for families, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: FightOnAAA
Reviews.Content: We read lots of great things about the Pacific Terrace before staying there for two nights the last week of June. The good news is that it lived up to its promise. The staff was more than friendly, the room was very comfortable and the location was ideal. A small reason behind our choosing this hotel was because they rented bikes on the property. We were briefly disappointed when we learned they were out of bikes when we checked at the front desk around noon. However, we were pleased when Rachel at the front desk directed us to a rental company just a couple blocks down the beach where we were able to rent for an even lower price than the hotel offered, thanks to a coupon she gave us. We didn't mind the walk to the rental location since we were already planning a long ride and a little warm-up walk wouldn't hurt. At the bike rental place, we were on our way in under 5 minutes. We also got a recommendation from Paul for a Mexican restaurant in Old Town, plus a coupon for a free appetizer. The food was great! On the downside, just minor points. There were lipstick marks on one of the glasses in our room, but otherwise the room was impeccable. Don't expect much from the excercise room. We checked it out, but decided against it. Choose a long bike ride if you want to get in some exercise. The pool was nice and but most lounge chairs were taken when we chose to visit around happy hour. However, we had a room on the first floor that was just steps from the pool and were happy when they brought our drink order to our patio where we were taking in the view. The pool water was bath water warm. Overall, we'd definitely return. Next time we'll choose an ocean view room (there were none avaiable when we booked) and that will only improve the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mamanana25
Reviews.Content: We've been going to this hotel for at least 6 nears now and plan on staying there for future get-a-ways. Location is great! Right on the boardwalk, beautiful views of the ocean. Excellent pool. Staff is awesome, very clean and breakfast is good, wish they offered more pastries, though, as they did in the past. Hot cooked oatmeal would be really good, too, instead of instant oatmeal. Also, more rooms offered with kitchenettes would be awesome, as we love taking the grandkids there. The master suites are the only rooms with full kitchens and they are really nice rooms, but they are a little too pricey for our budget.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, luxurious room and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: Alissia_May
Reviews.Content: We walked in to this hotel and got a last minute rate more than half off the online rates. The bed was supercomfy (and huge), the bathroom and kitchen were very clean with a cool islandy modern design. The gym was nice-they have wall length mirrors which were great for free lifting weights. The pool and the hot tub were great, the sea views amazing. Also convenient location. Highly recommend. :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KLMHOUSE
Reviews.Content: We had an full ocean view jr suite (worth the extra $). Stayed 3 nights. Area is close to many nice restaurants. Didn't care too much for breakfast at the hotel, but my favorite meal is breakfast and Konos is right down the street. Wonderful breakfast. Staff is awesome. Bike, buggie board rentals right at hotel. We are already planning our next trip. Decide no further, book this one, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: 31190AmyL
Reviews.Content: the Pacific Terrace is a wonderful place to stay for a san diego vacation. The staff is nothing short of steller. Gerard is the famous one, and deservedly (sp?) so, but let's not over look Paul, the front desk supervisor. Look up customer service in the dictionary and there you will see his picture. Cameron and Andreas on the bell desk are amazing...the rooms are beautiful, the service amazing and the price is right. Love it! Can't wait to see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff - Great”
Reviews.Author: alexandrosg
Reviews.Content: Great Art-Deco hotel right on the beach... For those who don't like the pacific tides, there is always the swimming pool where you can splish splash. Its major advantage though compared to other hotels in the area is its extremely friendly staff. Thanks guys for the hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reitj
Reviews.Content: Wanted a nice hotel with beachfront access and we got a beautiful, luxury hotel with easy beach access. We were so pleased with our choice. The hotel is within a short drive to all San Diego tourist attractions. The boardwalk and beach is right outside the pool access so easy to get to beach or boardwalk. There was limited resturant facilities on-site but we had no problem easily walking or driving to local resturants, groceries, or fast food. The pool can get a bit busy with kids but only busy (10-15 people) in afternoon and early evenings. Staff at hotel were great. Parking cost was 20.00 per night but it was a comfort knowing that you always had a space to park with easy and safe access. We will definitely make this hotel our choice on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A tropical escape divulging guests in superior quality, personal attention and the most eloguent guestrooms including grounds an”
Reviews.Author: pinnipeds1
Reviews.Content: i have returned to Pacific Terrace five times in a year. I have never been treated so well, had solice and my needs personally met.

Reviews.Title: “BEST SERVICE WE EVER HAD , A CLASS ACT , SAN DIEGO'S BEST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Becerra28
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has the best staff I have ever seen , they make you feel like you're part of their Family , you will love to stay in this place and I bet you won't want to leave !!!!!! We can't hardly wait to go back , congratulations to all the Hotel Staff , you are the best . The location could not be any better , close to everything .

Reviews.Title: “Our 14th Year!”
Reviews.Author: mysterywriterdiva
Reviews.Content: This hotel has stood on their heads to make us happy during all of our 14 stays. We had 45 family members last week at our family reunion and there is only one word to describe our stay--Paradise! The wait staff, concierge, manager and everyone in between always did their best to accommodate our every need and we felt very much at home and pampered. Drinks and room service from outstanding nearby restaurants, chocolate chip cookies and fruit in the afternoon, complimentary glass of wine in your room one afternoon, Starbucks coffee, lemonade and ice water throughout the day, walk to restaurants and shops and lots to do in San Diego during the day. The pool is heated and the sunsets spectacular. We loved everything about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The most considerate staff I have every encountered”
Reviews.Author: LisaHouTex
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel was so accomodating and incredibly kind. All staff members have tried to make our stay pleasant, and it certainly was!

Reviews.Title: “Quite possibly the best service I have ever received!”
Reviews.Author: jayham22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped over in San Diego for only one night and were basically looking for a place to crash after a long trip along the coast, we got so much more than that. Beautiful, huge room (they upgraded us without us asking) great view of the ocean, nice pool and jacuzzi with poolside service, free wifi and a good location right on the beach. ALL of the staff were amazing and more than willing to help with all of our requests. If I am ever in this area again there is no doubt I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: anthempc
Reviews.Content: Location was great, as advertised. The rooms were very comfortable with a wonderful ocean view. Nice flat screen television ( not that it was needed ). The breakfast buffet was a great value !!! Much better quality than you would receive at a continental breakfast. Staff was very friendly without being overwhelming. Beach front was best in area. Will definitely return !!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: trvl2learn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace at the recommendation of our travel agent for the San Diego portion of our vacation. She picked a great location for us. The hotel was a few steps from the beach and a great walking path. The kids had a great time swimming in the pool which has a nice view of the ocean. The hot tub seemed very popular in the evenings as well. It was relatively convenient to get to the I-5 to be able to drive to area attractions. We had a "partial ocean view" room which ended up being on the first floor looking out towards the pool-we could sorta see the ocean--but from my perspective I wouldn't consider it to have been a true "partial ocean view." That being said..I would say to spend a few extra dollars to get a ocean view room on the 2nd or 3rd floors--that way you won't be disappointed. The room was nicely furnished, spacious, and clean. Our wireless internet was inconsistent--sometimes we could connect and stay connected without issue and other times we would lose the connection sporadically. We were not aware of the fees to park our car at the hotel prior to arriving-so that was a big surprise to us. $20 per day to park in the parking area under the hotel seemed a bit high to me--so be sure to plan on budgeting that into your travel costs. Also, when we booked our room the hotel was doing continental breakfast with the room--they stopped doing that just before we arrived. They are now charging a separate charge for a breakfast buffet ($11.50 for adults and $6 for children). We tried it one morning- there was cereal, muffins, yogurts, oatmeal, eggs, bacon, sausage, juice, milk, and coffee. It was nice to sit by the pool hearing the ocean, but for the price we felt you could do better by going a short drive to the IHOP.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing place on earth”
Reviews.Author: MAhmahkitty
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel and was nervous until I drove around the corner and saw the beautiful hotel. I will start by saying that the hotel staff have the most amazing service of any place I have ever stayed. EVER. They have bikes, toys and chairs to use. The view is sensational. The rooms are breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in Sand Diego”
Reviews.Author: HitTheRoaders
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family suite with lots of room and a great little patio. Staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel gives you great views of the beach while allowing security and privacy. A few steps away, your toes will be in the sand or you can cool off in the pool. Perfect for kids and adults.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved our stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hello61
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Pacific Beach hotel and we enjoyed our stay so much. The hotel is located right on the ocean with a fantastic view. Our accomodations were sooo nice. The employees were wonderful. Ted Tillman, guest services supervisor, was so helpful to us when we booked our stay. Very nice and very professional. The impression we had was that if there was anything we needed from housekeeping to the front desk, etc., all we had to do was ask. Honestly, this was one of the very nicest hotels we've stayed in. There was lots to do nearby, walking on the beach, great restaurants, relaxing by the pool and spa, our trip was so very nice. Because of the beautiful setting and the top notch quality of the hotel, you kind of feel like you're in paradise. We will definitely be back. Doug and Stephanie Mansfield

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience, would easily go again!”
Reviews.Author: TuckerQ
Reviews.Content: I have written long reviews of hotels on this and other sites but the Pacific Terrace appears to have numerous reviews already so I'll keep this short. I just want to validate what everyone says. My experience was nearly perfect. My room was immaculate and well appointed. The staff was delightful. The maid service was excellent. The ocean view room had just that - a beautiful ocean view. Being right on the boardwalk made it very convenient to beach restaurants of many types. I said nearly perfect because if I had to pick out a negative, I can only think of one. They charge $20/night for parking. It's underground, secure and very convenient. Given the excellence of the hotel, it didn't end up bothering me much. I would stay here again without thinking twice.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service; beautiful accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: poozr75
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is the epitomy of good taste and impeccable service. Every staff member--and I do mean every--has been trained to provide the friendliest and most accomodating service. The beauty is this is not a pretentious hotel, but is comfortable and genuine. What it lacks in size and overall amenities, it more than makes up for in location and room comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: studenttraveller42
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel. Great service, worth every penny. Free lemonade, iced tea, water, cookies, fruit... Right on the beach! They had turn down service at night, so free chocolates too! We had a 'partial oceanview' which included a little parking lot... but a surprisingly great view of the ocean all the same! The water there had big waves, but the beach was great. The only downside is that you are pretty secluded, not a ton to do aside from the pool/beach in the area (but there is happy hour at the pool everyday!). The pier nearby is just a hotel, and a lot of shops in the surrounding area are closed. But overall a great stay & I would make a point of staying there next time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pacific Terrace!”
Reviews.Author: JJK97
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Pacific Terrace, and I will definitely be back The staff was absolutely fantastic and the location was terrific. The room was clean, very nice and the beds were comfortable. I was in a partial ocean view room and the view was amazing! There are great restaurants and shops within blocks. Highly recommend!.

Reviews.Title: “The sun is always shining at Pacific Terrace Hotel........”
Reviews.Author: WezT
Reviews.Content: From the moment you step into the place it feels like home. Gerrard the main man in charge on the front desk offered us a service the likes of which we hadn't seen during our Californian trip. PTH is warm and charming and the rooms are decorated in a way that wouldn't be out of place in a more expenisve hotel. We didn't eat there but were offered advice on where to go, which turned out to be spot on. It's 10 foot from the beach and you get to see a beautiful sunset as well. This was paradise and as Gerrard said when he answered the phone "the sun is always shining at pacific terrace hotel....." This is the way it should be. No wonder they've scored so highly. Another trip advisor gem.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and refreshing”
Reviews.Author: bigbearians
Reviews.Content: This was a gift given to me from co-workers so I decided to use in for my Anniversary. We had a wonderful time. The room was upgraded for us to our surprise and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful, but not overly intrusive. We got room service in the morning and the food was excellent. We have decided to make this an annual stay for our anniversary and will stay longer next time. The views are beautiful and we enjoyed our walk in the morning down the boardwalk. Wonderful experience all the way around!!

Reviews.Title: “Right up my Alley”
Reviews.Author: Utravelwithme
Reviews.Content: Close to the beach if you wanted - but for me was not too far from my business meeting and restaurants close by - everything was in its place - quiet and peaceful after a hard days work - this will be my resting stop each trip to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, free cookies mmmm”
Reviews.Author: Australianberry
Reviews.Content: Not the cheapest but Right on the beach. Room ready upon arrival. Room had two queen beds with gorgeous wooden bed frames and furniture but tad squishy due to size of furniture. Shutters on windows didnt block all the light and light on outside of balcony did not turn off. The rooms as others mentioned were a bit stuffy- The fan was quite noisy but couldnt leave the aircon on it was really noisy and didnt work all that well. Bathroom adequate, could use a bit of bleach and lock on bathroom door didnt work. tiny safe, good sized tv, free bikes and dvds for the kids, pool nice fabulous pool service. Hotel quiet not much noise from other rooms although every panel in roof of your room does lift which concerned us re our items being secure Clock in room had mind of its own kept going off all night even after we pulled the plug we could laugh about it in end but....Free warm choc chip cookies in entrance and fruit basket, staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: bh_liberty
Reviews.Content: An exceptional hotel with great views. My only complaint is that there is not a bar in the hotel. I guess I got by on the mini bar in the room. I would definitely stay here again but I promise you I'll have my own bottle next time

Reviews.Title: “Upscale feel with a 'surf town' attitude.”
Reviews.Author: Ohshihtzu
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel during the third week of April, 2011. The location, as seen from the street, seems unimpressive, however the location as viewed from the balcony rooms and/or poolside is quite impressive. The room was clean and odor free (we're particular) and the accommodations were as promised. The front desk & staff were exceptionally friendly and professional. We ate breakfast there only once, and were pleased. Parking is below ground with safe, easy access to the upper floors via elevator. It was a bit chilly, so the pool & hot tub were only used once, but were very well maintained. Plenty of chairs, towels, etc. I would recommend a windbreaker or fleece this time of year, but layer! Chilly in the morning leads to some NICE warm afternoons. DON'T FORGET THE SUNSCREEN!! You'll need it! The beach is nice with lots of sunning & swimming to the south and the start of some rocky cliffs to the north...all within walking distance. If you like (or want to try) surfing, this is the place to be. Downtown San Diego is a short, easy drive, as well as some nice scenery to the north in La Jolla & Del Mar. Bring your cameras... the sunsets are INCREDIBLE. The walkway behind the hotel is great and is a nice way to head south down the beach without having to utilize the busy street/sidewalk. There are PLENTY of great restaurants & bars (most are family friendly) within walking distance, as well as a grocery store to stock up on drinks & munchies. (Our room had a small fridge that we stocked with drinks & things). We loved the laid back atmosphere and the locals were very friendly. The bar areas got a little rowdy after dark, but noting crazy, just sort of a college-type atmosphere. Don't be surprised by the amount of street bums. They re there, but they do not aggressively badger you for money. I know everyone does the zoo or Sea World, but we chose the Adventure R.I.B. rides, located in the marina behind the Sheraton across from the airport in San Diego. They offer whale & dolphin sightseeing trips as well as harbor trips and an excursion to the Mexican Coronado Islands, which is what we did. FANTASTIC!!! They're online and rated on Trip Advisor...check them out. Obviously, I can find nothing negative to say. We had a blast and would definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley fabulous”
Reviews.Author: GavMom
Reviews.Content: Sun, sleep, sand/surf -- you never have to leave the hotel room. right on the edge of the beach, running biking trail with free beachcruisers, breakfast in bed -- altogether unbelievable. very nice staff and great service. could not have had a better time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Ocean Front Hotel”
Reviews.Author: europhilestl
Reviews.Content: My family and I just stayed at the Pacific Terrace Inn in early May. We rented a family suite for just under $400 per night. We had 3 adults and 2 children (11 and 7) . We were in the Dominica Suite. The room was nicely furnished and had a refrigerator, microwave, table and chairs, and small enclosed patio facing the beach. The room was very clean and the staff is very pleasant and helpful. It's located right on the boardwalk and has a nice pool terrace with deck chairs and cabanas. We enjoyed our stay, just wish the weather would have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “great location, room & public areas extremely clean & service oriented staff”
Reviews.Author: k215
Reviews.Content: ocean view room with roomy balcony staff very helpful and always greeted you and asked if there was anything you needed steps from boardwalk & beach (easier access short walk from hotel down boardwalk) convienant to cvs & ralphs plus many dining options easy walk to free shuttel for trolley tours must try konos for brkf/lunch-huge portions & low cost first time visitors and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: vegasstaggs
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and our room with an ocean view was fantastic. Being able to sit on a very spacious balcony and watch the sunsets was worth the extra money. Our room (king suite ocean view) also included free bike rental and beach chairs. The workout room is in the garage area underneath the hotel and was a little stuffy during our workouts. We definitely will be back to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, ugh.”
Reviews.Author: sunshine467897
Reviews.Content: Positive: Location, rooms, decor, service. Negative: No breakfast variety, parking fee, no designated outdoor smoking area.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly friendly staff from hotel manager to groundskeepers made us feel welcome and well treated.”
Reviews.Author: Ken70Plus
Reviews.Content: From our initial greeting by the valet when we arrived from Colorado in our personal vehicle to an unanticipated opportunity to meet the hotel manager (strictly by chance) during breakfast on our final morning, we felt truly appreciated as guests of this recently refurbished facility. The first glimpse of our room and the view overlooking the pool and the ocean definitely brought forth a positive "WOW" from both my wife and me. Without exception, every member of the staff, including housekeeping, groundskeepers, and front desk folks, consistently gave eye contact and friendly greetings (far more sincere sounding than the typical retail sales clerk's "Have a nice day" type comments.) An earlier review we had seen online regarding this facility mentioned the friendliness of the staff, and that was the deciding factor in our staying there over a couple of other places we had considered. We were not disappointed. While I do not know how many more such trips we will be making, this hotel has set a high standard against which to make comparisons.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Views”
Reviews.Author: slucky5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous! We ran across the hotel by accident as we were lost at 3:00am from driving in from Phoenix. The customer service was superb and the front desk manager was nothing more than accommodating. They actually upgraded us to a different room since the room we were originally booked in was taken the second night of our stay. We had a lovely time staying at the hotel. We will definitely be back. Ocean and pool views, and steps away from the beach...what else can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!"”
Reviews.Author: vicandjo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in March with our three kids. The rooms are spacious, beautifully decorated, and the staff is very helpful. The location is amazing- we had a perfect view of the Pacific Ocean from our room and we were able to walk to the beach in only a few minutes. There isn't a restaurant in the hotel, but the nearby pub Hennesey's served a great breakfast lunch and dinner! We went to Sea World while we were in San Diego and it was only about a ten minute drive away. The rates were a bit high, but overall a great experience. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying here again.”
Reviews.Author: RosieMadison
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a family vacation largely as a result of favorable Trip Advisor reviews, but won't be returning. It seemed promising at first. The room was ample but I question the "newly redecorated" part. Everything felt (and looked) very late-90s to me. The staff were friendly and responsive, but we had a bunch of minor problems that sort of added up. Our thermostat didn't work, the pbs station on the tv didn't work (and that's all our kids watch!), the dvd player didn't work, and our room was missing a trash can. Very responsive fixes to most of these problems but the pbs never got fixed---we were told it was a LodgeNet issue). The location is a little odd....there appeared to be a mobile soup kitchen a couple of evenings right outside our window which drew a colorful crowd. I never felt my safety was threatened, but it was not exactly a neighborhood feel. Skip the breakfast...many local places were very good but the whole "Carribean Room/pool" scene was pretty unpleasant. The pool is very small, not particularly clean, and not somewhere we felt comfortable lingering. The worst part of our experience was the cigarette smoke. We did have a non-smoking room, but even with the patio door shut, smoke from the neighbors must have been seeping through the walls. Our poor little asthmatic three-year-old ended up on oral sterroids she flared so badly (handy CVS pharmacy a few blocks away). If we hadn't brought a portable nebulizer with us "just in case," we likely would have ended up in the ER. Most good hotels are entirely non-smoking these days, and I no longer even think to ask about cigarette smoke. Big mistake! I would not give this hotel four stars. Maybe three without all the other issues. At best, 2 1/2. The bill for six nights, with parking and only 1 breakfast, was $2,800. I think we would have been much happier at a Westin or similar business-class hotel. The beach location doesn't add THAT much. We still had a nice vacation, but it was more in spite of the hotel than because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: 37209Sandy
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, great location right on then beach, and walking distance to lots of good restaurants, easy parking, and very friendly and helpful staff. Definitely on the "stay there again" list.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: 11thchild
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights. The free bike usage, the half price breakfasts, the promptness of staff and service and the location as well as a nice, large room, including large private patio made it worth it's price. Pool and hot tub are nice! They have pool service for drinks, etc but also have free ice tea, lemonade. Free warm cookies in the evening, turn down service in the evening with chocolates on pillow. Nice robes. All the little touches added up to a very nice stay. We rode bikes everyday, keeping the bikes all day one day. Very prompt valet with both the car and the bikes! Our room was very quiet as I requested and even though they said we had a non- view room, we actually had a peek of the ocean! We didn't have to look at a parking lot or wall!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with excellent support staff”
Reviews.Author: Peaceful1012
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend our 2nd anniversay in San Diego. We chose the Pacific Terrace hotel bc of its location. The view of the ocean is outstanding and all of the rooms have balconies. It was excellent. We arrived to a staff that was welcoming and an environment that was relaxing. Once excorted to our rooms, there was a bottle of champagne and a card in our room to congratulate us on our 2 year wedding anniversary. That was very personal and showed us that the hotel/staff took effort in knowing us and celebrating with us. The room was exactly as it shows on the website. It was beautiful!!! We had all of the comfortsof home but we were in a luxurious hotel. The hotel was next to the beach, across from several grocery/pharmacy stores and in walking distance to multiple restaurants. Wow is the word for this hotel and its amenities. Thanks to the staff for making it a perfect anniversary trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Partner/Family Retreat Yet”
Reviews.Author: jcrew7
Reviews.Content: Our partnership/group has been traveling with our families for almost 10 years. We have stayed up and down the coast of southern CA and by far Pacific Terrace offered us such amazing comfort and service as well as beautiful views and convience to the beach. I believe two best features of this hotel, ok, maybe three, are the location which is at the end of Pacific Beach where it is quiet but still withing walking distance to many restaurants. Second, it is a smaller boutique hotel so we saw much more of each other than we had at some of the larger hotels we had stayed at. This was a plus for our group. Finally, Pacific Terrace has a staff that is amazing! Julie G. handled our group reservation and everything was exactly as promised and exceeded our expectations. They have a wonderful breakfast that is very kid friendly, a great fitness facility although you can't beat the views running or biking the boardwalk and they even gave our group the reins to their meeting room where we played games, watched movies and had hot cocoa and cookies each night. Keep in mind that although the price is higher than chain hotels, most families who would normally need two rooms elswhere can comfortably fit in their family or executive suites. This hotel is so charming that my husband sent me and a few girlfriends there for a surprise 40th. They all loved it too and many of the partners have returned with their families since our visit last summer. You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel Right on the Ocean”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel099
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel in Pacific Beach, North of San Diego. We loved the hotel and the best part (in addition to the very spacious, beautifully decorated and comfortable rooms) was the customer service. Although some of the facilities were less than we expected (e.g., very small fitness room in the garage) and small pool, it was a wonderful stay and we look forward to returning. When we inquired about being transferred to another room because we were woken up our first two days by noisy neighbors, the staff could not have been more accomodating. Kyla was amazing and offered to move us to another room while we spent our day at Legoland. All they asked was that we pack our stuff, not to include items in the closet and refrigerator. They upgraded us to a junior suite for the inconvenience. When we returned from Legoland, all of our stuff had been moved to the new room. We really appreciated their thoughtfulness. This was by far the best service we've received at a hotel and we travel quite a bit. The location is fabulous. Although not a budget hotel, it is well worth the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in PB”
Reviews.Author: Stargazn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been back to Pacific Terrace twice. We wouldn't stay anywhere else...steps from the boardwalk, rooms are great because you have a frig, some kitchen stuff, furnishings are upscale but still with a beachy feel and the accommodations are quite roomy...plus, you can't beat the balconies and the view of PB/MB/OB to the South and Old Man's to the north. The staff is so receptive and helpful. A very restful experience!!"

Reviews.Title: “More Condo than Hotel, Not Great Location (surf bums on Pacific Beach, crappy restaurants)”
Reviews.Author: familyfunseeker
Reviews.Content: If you like 4 or 5-star quality hotel & you're travelling with a young family, don't stay here. Spend very little more & go to the Hotel Del Coronado (we were glad we did after the 2nd night here). This place is a very beautiful 'condo' type accomodation in the wrong location (unless u are a Pacific Beach surfer dude type). No restaurant or liquor licence on premises. We did not feel safe coming back to the hotel at night. The beach is a long, steep staircase down to cold water & it's not "combed'. The nearby restaurants have slow service & cater to low-budget, surfer kids & low-budget families. There was no restaurant in the hotel. Unless you are guaranteed oceanview on the 3rd floor or higher, you will not really like the view. On one side of the hotel is a 15-storey apartment blocking natural light & your view. On the other side of the hotel is the beach PUBLIC WASHROOM building, a parking lot & the pier (better than the north side anyway). The ladies serving the continental breakfast are grumpy, especially if you get there 10 minutes before closing. The breakfast area is messy, everyone helps themselves & leaves a mess. Too much bird poop on the patio tables & chairs. And the pool --- what a joke! Way too small for all the kids using it. And it is surrounded by glass walls to keep the plentiful beach bums out of the property. Having said that, the staff did try to move us to a better room, altho' it was not enough given our other issues with the surrounding environment. This is not a beach resort hotel. It's a nice condo where u need to go out & get your own supplies & drive everywhere (eg. to good restaurants in La Jolla/ Coronado Island). If that's what u want, AND you can get the Oceanfront rooms, then it would be fine. Otherwise, it's overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Could be more constant in services”
Reviews.Author: Sponi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there in March 2011 for 14 days. The view from the "ocean view rooms" was great and the rooms for nice and comfortable. The airconditioning / heating system was loud and noisy! Generally the services were good but they varied on a daily basis. Sometimes the rroms were done quickly other days in the afternoon when we came back the had not been done. In the evening after dinner sometimes both bed were prepared on other days only one and on yet others they forgot the room! Wake up calls were forgotten. The view is woth the stay. For breakfast the better places then this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else in SD”
Reviews.Author: PepperMD
Reviews.Content: This place defines excellent service! I have honestly never stayed at a hotel with more accommodating staff. Everyone was very pleasant and asked what more could be done to improve my stay. Heated pool and hot tub were clean. Great location on beach. Breakfast was tasty but a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous getaway with my daughter”
Reviews.Author: annemconnor
Reviews.Content: Winters are long and cold in Wisconsin, so when my daughter needed a mid-winter getaway, we Googled "Sunniest places in the US" and up popped San Diego. We booked our stay at the Pacific Terrace .... a bit of a gamble since we hadn't stayed on Pacific Beach in the past. Arriving late, we received a gracious welcome and were led to the most fabulous room. My pre-teen daughter stood at the doorway for a moment just to get her bearings. We were only in town for a few days and wanted to maximize our time in the sun, but after a day and a half of sightseeing, she said, "Mom, I'd really just like to stay near the hotel!" We had everything we needed ... a warm, clean pool, easy access to the beach, and shops on the boardwalk of Pacific Beach. Who could ask for more? It was a five-star weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Not a "Top" quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: taraba
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was Okay only because we liked the location. I though this hotel was over priced and not all the rooms had microwaves, we even had a full ocean view, there is no restuarants at the hotel. The pool was closed our first day. They would not honor our AAA card and said if i would have called them three days in advance they would have honored it. I have traveled a lot and never had an issue with a hotel honoring our AAA card. I was not impressed. There are hotels along the pacific ocean much cheaper and they all look really nice. Remember you have to pay 20.00 extra a day to park also.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Meg7335
Reviews.Content: Don't let the word Hotel fool you, this resort was the nicest all around, I have ever stayed in. I never walked past a staff member without them saying "Hi how are you today"? Most even remembered your name. They had pool side service, you could order drinks or food. They also provided excellent advise of local attractions and activities. I have never had staff at any resort i have stayed at be so accomidating and nice. I can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: 91NSX
Reviews.Content: My wife I have stayed here quite a few times. We generally stay during the off season as we live relatively close by and the room rates are more favorable. The staff is very friendly. The local restaurants are great and within walking distance. We really like the Green Flash for dinner ( on the outside patio) but there are many other options. There are other hotels overlooking Pacific Beach, but this one is the most upscale in our opinion. We book the full ocean view room as we enjoy sitting on the balcony with a glass of wine watching and listening to the ocean waves. If you like to leave the balcony access door open (to hear the waves at night) be advised that at 7:00 AM the pool area is open and it becomes a bit noisy. This is a family friendly hotel and there are kids along with the noise they create. So we remember when we brought our kids (now in college) to Pacific Terrace and how excited they were and how much noise they made. A little patience goes a long ways. In conclusion, if you want a great ocean view, a nicely furnished room, many restaurant choices nearby this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service, value and property”
Reviews.Author: MsteachNYC
Reviews.Content: Super well-kept property, probably the best in Pacific Beach area of San Diego. Walking distance to everything even super market and starbucks. Located right on the beach with a beautiful pool/lounge area that is serene, clean and very well maintained. I was very impressed with the maintenance of this property and watched the maintenance man clean the pool religiously every morning. Even though I was traveling with my mother, we quickly realized that this hotel caters to families, offering children's DVDs to watch at night in the room, and having a heated pool, so regardless of the weather the children could swim. It was quiet enough though for us to be very relaxed even with kids around. The staff was super cheerful and professional and went out of their way to accommodate us as much as possible, even when my mom wanted to purchase 15 sunblock and the gift shop didn't have it, I think a staff member ran out to the store to buy it for us! I wish breakfast was included in the room cost, but at least complimentary coffee and tea was available to all guests in the breakfast restaurant. I have no complaints other than the fact that the room keys were very hard to get to work. Especially on the outside doors heading out to the board walk. The key card locks would not read my cards and I ended up getting around 5 replaced during my 4 day stay, but the staff is more than willing to issue fresh ones as needed. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Even Better Staff”
Reviews.Author: Oscar_Goldman
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently visited the San Diego area for the first time (Valentine's Weekend) and as we usually do, we researched online sites such as Trip Advisor extensively for the best accommodations in terms of value and quality. Everything I've heard about this property in terms of how good the staff are is dead on - they really do understand good customer service. Plus, they come across as genuine and sincere - as opposed to ridged or corporate. They're top notch - as good as I've experienced anywhere else in North America. The location (Pacific Beach) is great. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. We opted to park within the neighbourhood and avoided the underground fee. The beach/ocean is very close and the balconies on that side of the property are ideal. We left our sliding door open and fell asleep to the waves. We had originally only planed to stay one night but within the first 20 minutes we were so impressed we ditched our cheap Priceline reservation in the Gaslamp district and booked another night. No regrets! My only complaint? The breakfast concept needs to be revised. It really isn't a buffet style, despite what you'll see listed on the sign outside of the dining area. You don't get all of those food choices for the set price. Instead, you pick one of a couple that has something else paired with it. Nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Incredible Views from our room!”
Reviews.Author: jackiebabol
Reviews.Content: I was deliberating between getting a private condo or staying in this hotel by the ocean. I'm glad we chose to stay in this hotel. staying in the hotel is an activity in itself, It was nice to hang around just by our porch and watch the surfers right in front of our room! Thank you for making our trip incredible! The staff was friendly and efficient. Surprisingly nice to see as many men cleaning the rooms as well as women (I like that!) I'm the little girl scout that brought all her comfort food with her and was surprised to find out we do have a refrigerator but no microwave for my teas and soups. They promptly delivered one when I asked the chambermaid (but not the front desk). THe chambermaid crew was more helpful than the front desk in several good ways for us. Kudos to them! More power to you all!

Reviews.Title: “Odd Combination of spectacular views and homeless neighbors”
Reviews.Author: MaineCascoBay
Reviews.Content: Just finished five night stay in the Master Suite. The hotel is very nice and the facilities provide spectacular views, good service, with rooms that are large and clean if not a bit dated. The location is very convenient for all of San Diego.. I must say, though, that the surrounding area, surprisingly, seems a bit "downmarket". Our view looked out,. partially, on a public washroom that was refuge (in bad weather) for at least four unfortunate, homeless individuals. In good weather, they spent nights on the wooden walkway to the beach. While I sympathize with their plight - it set up a strange combination of resort versus homeless neighbors. Just what were we trying to accomplish - relaxation? or dealing with reality? In looking back on Trip Advisor comments (on return home), I noted that this situation was pointed out a couple of times back in 2009 - so its been going on for a while. So, it seems, it is a long-term issue there. I suppose the kicker for me was the nightly, late-night "singing" by our "neighbors on the beach deck". My young son joined us in bed having "nightmares". He said they were singing "help me". What do you say to that ? Other sounds along the walkway late at night were heard most nights.. So..... what should I say.? I'm not overly negative, just realistic. The hotel is great, the neighborhood is different - the posted signs against sleeping along the oceanfront don't seem to be enforced. It's not the hotel's fault., but ................

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service!”
Reviews.Author: poppies77
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed here for the fourth time in two years, it's our favorite hotel. Service has always been great, but this time was particularly notable. Our young son has autism, and has trouble being quiet, which troubled the guests below us. We felt terrible, and the staff did all they could to fix the situation. Paul, Andrew, Niki and Gerard took a tough situation and handled it with grace and kindness. We'll certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel! STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: MadMax12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for part of our honeymoon and it really exceeded expectations!! First of all the manager of the hotel was so helpful and accommodating! All the staff were so polite and always smiling. Our room had the most fantastic view overlooking the beach it was just amazing! Rooms are really big and so comfortable. Bathroom was moderne and nice. One day when we hot back to the room there was a bottle of champagne in an ice bucket waiting for us! That was so nice of the staff to do that for us! Location is really good right next to the beach and near the shops and bars. Also breakfast in the morning was very good lots of food to choose from. The pool also was brilliant with a fantastic view of the ocean. All in all I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be returning in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Angela Menna and Pacific Terrace San Diego ROCK!”
Reviews.Author: prayne987
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to San Diego for Valentine's Day and when we first booked the trip, we had another hotel in mind until at the last minute we booked our stay at Pacific Terrace San Diego on Pacific Beach. THAT WAS THE BEST DECISION EVER!! My wife and I checked in with Angela Menna and she was fantastic!!! Our hotel room was not ready because we arrived at 9am so she took our number and called us when our hotel was ready. She told us the best places to go while we waited and she followed through and called us 2 hours before she said our room would be ready. To our surprise, we got the best room in my opinion which was the St. Lucia suite. My wife and I were blown away! We had hoped for an ocean view and boy did she deliver. The staff service called us both by name our whole stay and went over and above to ensure we had the best stay possible. The hotel is centrally located and we are going to book it again in March becasue we had so much fun. The room was decorated super nice, indoor jacuzi tub and just an overall warm feel to the room. With San Diego so beautiful you would wonder why I even cared about the room but it truly was wonderful to wake up to the waves and the view with my wife. We didn't book this room specifically and it was Angela who got it for us. Talk to Angela Menna when you go to this hotel because she will make your stay as enjoyable as possible and the rest of the staff will exceed all expecations. FYI- I signed up for this just to write a review as I am not a big review guy but they deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Awesome service”
Reviews.Author: amberandmike
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last night and loved it! The staff was beyond accommodating and the views were amazing! Worth every dollar we spend and then some. We cannot wait to go back, pretty much the nicest hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: gardengatebnb
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here for our honeymoon. We are not in the $380/night hotel crowd but this was worth it for the once-in-a-lifetime experience of hearing and seeing the surf outside our open balcony. The Capri condos next door is a much taller building and has huge search lights on its roof. It lights the white waves of the surf during the night so after dark, you can still see the waves rolling in. It was pretty incredible to fall asleep to the sounds and sights of the ocean. The room was sumptuous and we enjoyed it very much. This hotel is one of those places where you don't ever really see work being done but you know there must be many workers to keep it all so perfect all the time. This was our first exposure to extra fees for everything. Our "extras" bill was over $200, above our pre-paid room/taxes. That was just parking, internet and breakfasts, not even the mini bar or room service. Breakfast was posted as $9 but it had 2 kinds of fees/taxes added to that which made it $13. I'm sure those things don't matter to the money-is-no-object crowd. This location is second to none. The boardwalk is about 5 yards past the edge of our pool/breakfast area, and then the sand and water are just below that. We soaked up the ambiance of rollerbladers, yoga'ists, surfers and California culture. Things I found odd about our room: the shower had beautiful luxury glass doors, but were placed on a standard hotel tub, which meant you had to shower with your arms up to not bump into the (marble) walls or glass doors. It was very very clean, but I still think it's gross to rub against a shower wall.The water pressure was also nothing great. The bed frames were outrageously beautiful handcarved wood. The wierd part was that the rim part of the frame running around the mattresses was about 8 inches wide. Just swinging my legs down off the tall bed without thinking about it resulted in a number of good bruises. This was a bed where you had to calculate your strategy for reaching the floor. And they don't have any King beds, just queens. I'm sure this is every hotel's battle near salt water, but there were several bits where the drywall was crumbling or rusting metal showed through. Our balcony railings seemed painted not too long ago, but you could tell it was bubbly and rough from rust underneath. Overall, I hope to be so lucky to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for sand and surf”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_aww
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Pacific Terrace and in San Diego. While the weather was too cold to allow us to enjoy the pool or the ocean, the location nevertheless was perfect. We we were able to drink our morning coffee while watching dolphins jumping through a row of surfers in their wet-suits and otherwise enjoy the coast (though, perhaps the hotel is a bit spendy if you cannot actually go into the water due to weather). Word to the wise, do not go to the nearby Firehouse PB, a "restaurant" the hotel recommends. I went there with my pregnant wife and discovered, after waiting for an hour, that the restaurant is actually a nightclub with loud music, teeny boppers, and overcrowding.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: buffaloaded
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of the January to celebrate an anniversary. We opted for a partial oceanview jr suite, but the initial room we had was a partial ocean view by only a few degrees and had some noise issues. While most hotels would have said that is what we get, these folks found us a room on the quieter side of the hotel with a little more view. We also made it known we would love to have a full ocean view if any opened up during the 3 days we were their. Again, most hotels wouldn't have bothered to help us, but this is not an ordinary staff. We did get our "middle" night of 3 in a full view. So on the second and third nights they moved us (we were sightseeing) back and forth. The rooms we had were amazing. Both had large bedrooms, and the partial view had a huge bathroom. Great bedding. Here are more examples of the great service. When they heard it was our anniversary, they sent up a bottle of wine. Because we had reserved a king bed, which they could not provide, the second night we got another bottle of wine and a free breakfast. On the last move the bellman forgot to move our refrigerated items ( we were going to make an early breakfast out of leftovers from the GREAT Thai place a few blocks away) and the maid discarded them-- they gave us another free breakfast the morning we left. Everybody on the staff gave us a hello and smile each time we entered and exited. The front desk folks alway asked what we did and how we liked it. Being right against the ocean, hearing the waves at night, makes this a 6* for location. When

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding rooms with service to match!!!”
Reviews.Author: jalhome
Reviews.Content: Traveled to San Diego in Feb 2011 for business from Richmond, VA and was lucky enough to discover the Pacific Terrace Hotel. Beautiful and clean room with outstanding ocean view and good location. Service was the best I've experienced with the hotel staff extremely helpful and their everyday attention to detail was outstanding! Gerrard at the front desk was very helpful in making our reservation. You will love this hotel !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb service with the rolling Pacific at your door step”
Reviews.Author: brubecksmum
Reviews.Content: Just spent four days at the Pacific Terrace and would reccommend it to couples and families. Out the door and you are ready for miles of boardwalk along the beautiful Pacific beaches - perfect for strolling, jogging or biking. Tell the concierge you are hungry and she has recommendations and reservations in any one of a number of places - suitable for lots of different tastes and budgets. The rooms are lovely and almost all provide some view of the sea. The beds are divine! The pool is warm enough to avoid temperature shock but comfortable for swimming and the hot tub is great and open until 10pm under the stars. San Diego is a great vacation spot and this hotel reminds you constantly where you are and how lucky you are to be there. And even though they charge you for parking we took our car in and out several times a day and never once waited more than three minutes for our car. The staff were wonderful. We will be back and encourage others to go too.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but a few suggestions”
Reviews.Author: sab30
Reviews.Content: First let me start of by saying the staff at this hotel are fantastic when it comes to service, they are able to pull it off without appearing or sounding fake...I really felt all the staff wanted to make our stay the best as possible. The location is outstanding, right on the boardwalk a 30 second walk to the beach. There is no restaurant on site which was a little more effort for those travelling with very small children/infants etc. They do offer a wonderful in house hot breakfast for $9 a person which was very very good. In addition we were told there was some arrangement for room service but mainly we strolled around the area to find a good place (ie the Thai place right around the corner is GREAT) Rooms were very clean and the beds super comfortable. Pool and hot tub were good temp (ie warm) and appeared well taken care of.
