Parking is $20 a night with free Valet, I know this may seem reasonable but after paying for the room being charged 20 bucks a day on top to park just seems like one of those annoying "extra costs" The garage was never more than half full so I would suggest just allow one vehicle per room per night. We stayed in the family suite and my only suggestion was that this doesnt work well as a "family" suite. It is on the main floor and it is a two room suite. The bedroom has 2 queens the washroom and the patio. The living room has a sofa and TV. If you have small children and put them to bed early you cant use the patio or bathroom without waking them up going in and out. Your only choice is to stay in the small living room with no access to the outside patio.We like to hotel/resorts where we can out our child to bed and have access to the deck/patio to have a drink on. Even my wife though it was a weird setup . I dont think for us it set up well as a family suite but rather it is more of an executive suite but yet it still has 2 queen size beds instead of one king. If it were possible the deck/pation should be made avaialble from the living room area. All in all a very good hotel, we would return as a couple but not with our little one just because of the setup.

Reviews.Title: “The Right Choice”
Reviews.Author: redheadfamily
Reviews.Content: Great Location and very friendly staff made our visit to San Diego fantastic. We loved the complimentary cookies and fruit waiting for us after our busy day on the town. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. We loved the pool and jacuzzi overlooking the ocean. Computers available on each floor as well as free wireless available in room. We will definitely come back for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “This was an excellent holiday getaway!”
Reviews.Author: adsouthall
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect choice for relaxing after a long day of sightseeing! I am a neat freak and was pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness of the hotel and the space for luggage in our room. There were 4 of us, and that can get a bit crazy if there is not enough space. If I could change one thing, I would add some type shelving at the vanity for toiletry bag storage. We used the fitness room as well as the pool / hot tub and were happy with both. The hotel is located near many good local restaurants within walking distance which we enjoyed and very close to Sea World and other areas to discover. The service was extremely friendly and accomodating, from the front desk, to the maid service (we needed extra laundry bags), to the breakfast room crew...all treated us like family in their own home! If I had to choose one thing I liked the best it would have to be the cleanliness because if a place isn't clean I cannot relax, no matter what. If I had to choose one thing I liked least it would have to be the fingerprints on the coffee caraffes in the breakfast room. Like I said, I'm a neat FREAK, and I notice things like that. However, if that is the worst thing I can say about this hotel, they are doing a pretty doggone great job of pleasing their guests!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at the 'pacific terrace hotel'”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBarbra
Reviews.Content: already living in san diego- we picked this hotel to have our anniversary-mini vacation -by the sea we both loved- the hotel and our full ocean view balcony room and how everyone working there treated us. we were blessed with warm san diego winter weather and full southwest view of the ocean and its -large waves we plan to stay again at this top notch hotel.. our thanks -to all the staff at the pacific terrace hotel the rhodas.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line!”
Reviews.Author: nanaandpapa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace Jan. 15-21, 2011. Everyone of the staff was friendly and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. I could name the ones that stood out, but they all did! The hotel was VERY clean. We saw someone cleaning somewhere anytime of the day. The room cleaning staff went beyond normal of what we would expect. Our car was always waiting for us when we came down. The concierge was always available and had the answers to all our questions. The view from our room was spectacular. The room was beautiful, beds were very comfortable. The bed turn down service was a treat. Coffee, fruit and juice were available in the morning. For a charge, they had a delicious breakfast available. We had a great time and would return in a second. We could walk to most restaurants and gift shops. We felt very safe in the area. The only thing we could complain about was that the towels were rough.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond What We Hoped For”
Reviews.Author: TheNieuwTravelers
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place! Easily a new favorite for our family. The location is remarkable with access to the beach and the boardwalk and an amazing view. The palm trees and layout of the pool area add a ton to the atmosphere. The staff is friendly, responsive and personable - from the front desk to the maintenance guys diligently keeping the pool and spa clean. We have kids and took the advice of the hotel staff and booked a first floor partial view. While most "partial views" may be a sliver, this one (room 117) had a great view. It was very convenient on the first floor as we could easily get to the pool with our kids through the patio off the sliding door. Even though it was January it felt like Summer as we enjoyed a long day enjoying the sun, the scenery, the pool and a nice bike ride. Make sure you ask the hotel for the coupon to rent bikes as they have negotiated a great deal with a local bike rental company. It's about a 20 minute bike ride from the hotel to the end of the boardwalk - and a blast on cruisers. While we didn't get a chance, try the local Kono's for breakfast. Thanks to all at the Pacific Terrace for an amazing time! We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: c.krzanowski
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband, our two brothers and their wives just spent an amazing 6 days in three seperate rooms at the Pacific Terrace Hotel and we can't say enough about how wonderful our entire stay was. Absolutely everyone working there went out of their way to make sure everything was perfect and that we had everything we needed or wanted. The rooms were very very clean and stylish, the grounds well cared for, and the location was incredible. We all plan on going back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View”
Reviews.Author: LaliBird
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend at the hotel. Our room was very spacious with a beautiful view of the ocean. We sat on the balcony and watched the gorgeous sunset. We could see surfers and dolphins playing. Breakfast was limited and there is not a restaurant but many in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel of all time.”
Reviews.Author: StarbellyFaith
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love the Pacific Terrace Hotel. The top reasons why: 1. Best sleep I've ever had in any hotel, ever. Beds/bedding are extremely comfortable, but leaving the balcony door open and falling asleep to the sound of waves is incredible. Sometimes when I'm having trouble sleeping at home I literally imagine I'm at the Pacific Terrace. Sounds cheesy, but it's true. 2. Best balconies and views. Pay the extra money for a Full Ocean View room, and request the 3rd floor. I mean it. On our last trip we booked last minute on a holiday, so we had to take a first floor Partial View. I had to keep pretending I'd never been there before so I wouldn't keep feeling sad about what we were missing. The rooms are still lovely, the landscaping is still beautiful, and we could still hear the ocean, but there's simply no comparison. 3. Wonderful rooms. The carved wood furniture, pretty ceiling fans, and floor to ceiling plantation-style shuttered doors make me feel happy every time I walk in the door. Most hotel rooms, even suites, usually make me feel claustrophobic and uncomfortable. These rooms make me never want to leave. Of course, I spend most of my time on the balcony watching the surfers. 4. Great pool for the kids, great lounge area for me. The kids like to swim for hours, and it can be a dreaded chore for me when a hotel pool doesn't have a pleasant lounge area. I could sit by this pool all day and be perfectly happy. The pool is not too big, not too deep, and 3 feet from the boardwalk so you can watch the kids, people going by, and sunsets on the ocean all at the same time. The full-length glass walls help keep out the wind (and wandering people) without losing the view. At night they light torches all around and light up the numerous palm trees with Christmas lights. It's awesome. 5. Just a few steps to the the beach. The stairs from the boardwalk to the beach are about 20 feet from the hotel. You can go from your room to the sand in 60 seconds, and jump right in the hot tub when you get back. There is an extremely helpful warm water shower station by the pool to wash away all the sand. All this accessibility to the beach, and yet we still feel very safe with every gate requiring room keys for entrance. These are just the main reasons why we love this hotel. There are also nice things like friendly service, good breakfast, great restaurants, fun bars, beautiful weather, clean rooms, awesome housekeeping, plenty of big towels, comfy robes, complimentary beach toys and boogie boards, and particularly delicious cookies every afternoon. It can be a little expensive during the peak season, but it's still worth it. So often, with hotels in this price range, you feel like you've paid a lot of money for a fancy lobby and a room that's no better than an $100 Marriott. We compare every other hotel we stay in with the Pacific Terrace, and haven't found one yet that we like better. This is why we keep coming back year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: megabbylily3
Reviews.Content: My 3yr old daughter and I stayed here for 5 nights. Great location right on the beach. Housekeeping was wonderful, the room was sparkling clean and they always left a towel animal for my daughter! Entire staff was very helpful and friendly. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “If a great hotel with ocean views is what you're looking for - this is it.”
Reviews.Author: Bridesmom_8
Reviews.Content: We're from Nebraska and rarely get to be on either coast so when we planned to go to San Diego the first thing I looked for was a great hotel on the Pacific Ocean. Bay views are nice but if you want to watch the surfers, the seagulls, people walking on the beach and the sun setting over the ocean then this is the place to be. Pay more to get a room with a balcony on an upper floor if you're like us and just want to soak up all the memories of a view that can't be found on the prairie. Rooms are great- so is the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyNutWI
Reviews.Content: What more needs to be said, then AMAZING. The location, right on the ocean, can not be beat. All of the staff are extremely friendly and helpful; and treat you as if you are the only customer. The pool and hot tub area is very nice, and overlooks the ocean. Rooms are large, nicely decorated, and very clean. Location is within walking distance of dining and nightlife. Easy drive to Sea World and San Diego Zoo. This is by far the nicest hotel we have ever stayed at. I would recomment this hotel to everyone, for any trip type.

Reviews.Title: “Best service anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Patches07
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed 5 nights in early Jan. Rooms were lovely and spacious Pool area was very nice and overlooking a beautiful expanse of beach. Many restaurants of all prices and cuisines within walking distance or short drive. What madetjis hotel stand out, though, was the service. From the front desk to housekeeping to maintenance all had a smile on their faces, greeting you by name, wishing you a good day. They were very helpful and just the feeling at the hotel was one of joy. Thank you for making our stay in San Diego so great!

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Janetm53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our first trip ever to the San Diego area. I picked it after a lot of research ( I love the research part!) and when I looked it up on Tripadvisors list of hotels for this area it was in the top ten yet much less expensive than the other hotels it was rated with. Granted it is outside the city but Mission Beach is such a fun and funky neighbourhood that it was a perfect choice. The hotel is small and right on the beach. We were on ground level with a patio close to the pool and hot tub so we would go for a late night swim in the dark with just the tiki lights blazing. At night we would leave the patio doors open so we could hear the pounding surf - it was right there! The room was very clean and comfortable and the beds were massive. No lie, they put steps out for you to use to climb up onto the beds! Every person we encountered that worked in the hotel from the front desk staff to the gardeners were the nicest and friendliest we have ever met. The smiles and good mornings were genuine and sincere. We will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Wedding night!”
Reviews.Author: JennyOutram
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Presidential Suite for our wedding night and it was nothing short of amazing. The wonderful staff left us a complementary bottle of Chardonnay with a card congratulating us and thanking us for our patronage. Not to mention giving my mom and I a short tour of the room the week before, when we stopped by to make sure it was a decent choice for the big day (Having only read reviews online about it). The front desk staff is young, cheerful and very accomodating. When my husband and I arrived after our wedding, we were greeted and given fresh baked cookies and some fruit to snack on. After a quick check-in we headed to our room. It's a smaller hotel than we've stayed in before, but it had a nice "private" feeling to it, perhaps due to the size and more upscale decor. We had a perfect view of the pool area and the ocean from our top floor, centre room suite. It was incredible falling asleep and waking up to the gentle sound of the Pacific Ocean right outside our large balcony window. In fact, the way the room and bed are positioned, we could actually watch the ocean as we lie in bed. It was far enough into the room, however, that there was no worry of anyone outside looking in. The spa tub in suite was huge and extremely comfortable, easily fitting my 6'2" husband and my 5'2" self with room to spare. The toiletries were nice and they provided toothbrushes and toothpaste in addition to the usual upscale soaps, hair products and lotions. Our toilet did stop working after one use, but after a quick call to the front desk, an "Engineer" came and fixed it within minutes. We were very impressed. For all the bigger name hotels we could've picked for our wedding night in San Diego, we're both in agreement that we made the best choice going with a smaller, but perhaps more detail-oriented hotel such as the Pacific Terrace. We'll certainly be back next November to celebrate our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: AZ_Crisman
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace has THE BEST staff of ANY place we've EVER stayed. They are sincerely warm, friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, and they remember you -- not only from the day before, but from years previous! And that's just the icing on the cake -- you can't beat the location -- literally a stone's throw from the beach, easy access to freeways and San Diego tourist sites -- and the town of Pacific Beach itself is a very friendly, laid-back, AFFORDABLE place to vacation. Will we be back?? You betcha!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful staff, and perfect for our family gathering”
Reviews.Author: signemaria
Reviews.Content: We came to the Pacific Terrace hotel with the extended family. It worked out perfectly for us. The staff was very helpful -- the concierge Katherine set up terrific restaurant reservations, a fun whale watching trip, and had other recommendations of things to do. The suite was a little small, but it worked to have a place to meet. We loved having a pool and hot tub. The hotel was quiet, but very close to downtown San Diego and other local attractions (like Torrey Pines). All in all, we had a great sunny Christmas holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile Stay”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: When you drive up to the hotel you can't miss it, since it is at the beach. The room was very, very tastefully decorated and did not seem like a hotel room, more like a room you might have in your house. Our room had a balcony facing the beach and, except for occasionally when people walked by, was quiet. The staff was exceptional. They were very friendly throughout our visit and reminded me of the sort of service you get at the highest end hotels. Pacific Beach is not exactly close to much, but if you want a couple of nights away from it all this is an excellent choice. We go to San Diego quite often and definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Place At All”
Reviews.Author: UPRR_engineer
Reviews.Content: Pretty good place, not the best place ive ever stayed, but its pretty good. The staff there was some of the best ive saw in a long time as far as American hotels go. Everyone that works there did a great job taking care of us. Service goes a long way there! We picked this place because we wanted to be on the ocean with the waves, vs staying in some bay. Location is great as far as that goes, its a bit of a hike to any store that sells beer, smokes, soda, and snacks, or place to sit down and eat. Pool is a bit smaller then the pictures make it out to be, big enough i guess. Breakfast there was great, good food and great coffee. Great place to come back to after going to Seaworld and the Zoo. Our two year old daughter had a good time while we were here. Good place for family with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Should have been advised about garage!”
Reviews.Author: bartgo
Reviews.Content: OK, fabulous location, friendly, courteous, and helpful staff; but.....why wasn't I told at check-in that the room we were assigned was directly over the garage door??? Who needs an alarm when the garage door opens at 4:58 AM the morning following our first night???, and each morning thereafter it opened NLT 7:00 AM. In addition, room layout was awkward--just one sink for two people is inadequate; who gets to shave while she uses the hair dryer??? There is clearly enough room in the bathing area to install a second sink. No doubt there are gorgeous rooms with great views. While I knew going in that we wouldn't have a room with a view, I am disappointed that the room we were assigned seemed below par for a hotel with this high a rating. Suggestion: pay a little more and get one of those elegant rooms others are raving about. Not all rooms at PTH are equal!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: sharonf19
Reviews.Content: This was truly one of the best places I ever had the pleasure to sty at. From the location to the staff I can't rave enough about this beautiful hotel. Made us feel like a part of the family from the front desk to the housekeeping staff. Can't say enough good things about this hotel. The view and location is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: and_dream
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. The room we stayed in was on the third floor with a partial ocean view. Even being "partial" it was still a great view. Very clean room and very comfortable beds. Staff is amazing. From check-in, room service & cleaning staff everyone was so nice and helpful. If I had to pick something as a downfall it would be the price of parking in the garage. $20 a day. Loved the HEATED pool and hot tub. We will definitely be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, service and jewell of a location by the beach”
Reviews.Author: Mario155019
Reviews.Content: We were at the Pacific Terrace for four nights and enjoyed every minute of it. From the time we checked in, the staff was courteous, polite and very helpful. The hotel is very well run and attentive to details. When we checked in, they offered a list of restaurants that you may consider for breakfast, lunch and dinner in their area acknowledging their dining room facility was somewhat limited. Our room was very comfortable, very clean and quiet. Good comfortable beds. The hotel is by the beach with a courtyard swimming pool overlooking the ocean. Our room had a fabulous view of the ocean and there is nothing in between the hotel and the ocean. Their cleaning staff and the director of guest services, Angela, were just extraordinary. I have never dealt with more honest people in my life. Four days after I had checked out of the hotel, I realized that I had dropped my wallet, $275 worth of Canadian dollars, somewhere in the closet below the safe and the wallet was probably out of sight from the cleaning staff. The cleaning staff retrieved it for me and the service manager sent it back to me by Fed Ex, following my delivery instruction. I have never dealt with more honest people in my life. Mario

Reviews.Title: “Most Relaxing Hotel Stay - Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Pattylynn49
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveld from Florida to San Diego to visit our daughter for Thanksgiving. We chose this hotel to be on the Ocean. We were very happy with our choice. The location was perfect - many places to eat within walking distance. Every staff member was friendly and helpful. Although the Hotel itself may be older - the inside was beautifully updated. Our room was clean and spacious. We could also see the Pacific Ocean from our room! We did get a wonderful off-season rate. This was the first time my husband actually relaxed on a vacation in thirty years. I love this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel right on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTom_8
Reviews.Content: We spnt two nights at The Pacific Terrace Hotel in Pacific Beach Ca. Had a great, very large room with a great view of the ocean. Right in the heart of the PB action. The front desk staff were very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: philbur
Reviews.Content: We were there for a week. Perfect location, staff couldn't be more helpful. They even have a sheet with all nearby eateries, what they offer & distance in blocks from the hotel. We travel all over the world & this was one of the best weeks we have had, anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view of the ocean and boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: NCarter58
Reviews.Content: We were treated with warm smiles and gracious hello's from very polite and helpful staff. Our room had a lovely view of the ocean and boardwalk, had a large patio and free wifi. Oh, and was very comfy! This has to be one of the best hotels we have been to in a long time. This is also close to shops and restaurants. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, clean, friendly. Top notch. Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: alohawoman39
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 days. Couldn't have been better. Right on the beach, unobstructed view of the ocean. Very clean, extremely friendly staff, convenient location. The only inconvenience was rather late check-in - 4:00 p.m. When we got there our room was not ready and we were offered to upgrade to a suite, which was available. We noticed another couple the next day was in the same situation. I found that a bit awkward, seemed like we were being pushed to pay a bit extra. In any case, it was still a good experience. We were in a suite on the ground level - walk right into the pool and jaccuzzi right from our patio, right next to the little gate onto the boardwalk. So, all was great. But I would almost recommend that you stay on the 2nd floor, that way, you see the ocean front and center, probably more breathtaking. All and all, highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lebanie2003
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to the beach. If you are in the pool you can see the beach throught the clear glass. I took my mother and my two kids to stay at this hotel for my moms 50th. We were upgraded and they brought her a birthday gift. the staff was amazing. They were able to answer any and every question I asked. There are some food places that are able to charge back to you room. This was a great location. It was close to almost any thing you could think of to eat. They were great with my kids as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: katiekatie
Reviews.Content: All the reviews are true, this place is great. The location is right on Pacific Beach, the views from our balcony were so beautiful, people thought that my photos of the trip were post cards!! The customer service was spectacular, people were always smiling and friendly and ready to help. The rooms were large enough for 5 (4 adults and an 8 year old child), we had a junior suite. The only draw back was that the beach was full of kelp, which did not really bother us surfing but it was everywhere (not the hotel's fault, just an observation). I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone, and we are already planning our trip back to the Pacific Terrace!!

Reviews.Title: “Wowee, it was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Burgbabes
Reviews.Content: Arrived October 29 to a great room and a free arrival glass of wine. Stayed at the hotel 6 nights and seven days. Staff was fabulous and always went out of their way to offer special litle things to enhance your stay. The room, view and staff and location all added up to one fabulous stay for total relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to unwind”
Reviews.Author: Bolen
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week here with my wife. Unbelievably relaxing place to hang out. Hotel service friendly and efficient. Location on the beach is perfect. Beautiful rooms. Highly recommend the ocean view king suite The pool great. Could not find one thing to complain about except $20 a night for secure parking. Make sure you rent a cruiser bike around the corner with a discount coupon from the front desk. Lots of free parking on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasSharvi
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. This is perfect if you're looking to stay right on Pacific Beach. Walk out the door by the pool and there you are. Our room was spacious and clean with a balcony that opened to the pool, hot tub and beach. The front desk and maintenence personnel are outstanding! Special kudos to Pat and David. (Mtnc came up to put in a new lightbulb- we didn't notice it was out). We will certainly be back to this one!

Reviews.Title: “The Best In SanDiego”
Reviews.Author: peske1116
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out we had great service. The staff always had a smile-all of the staff. Front desk answered all questions, got us where we wanted to go without one problem. By mistake we left expensive jewelry out in the bathroom one day, not touched, trusted the maid like no other we have experienced. Beautiful room, Great view. Only problem was the weather, but we're not willing to blame the hotel. This is the only place we'll ever stay in SanDiego! Exceptional! Thank You Pacific Terrace.....

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: home4056
Reviews.Content: We were able to stay for 2 nights and received the 3rd night free. When we arrived, it was raining, so we upgraded to the jacuzzi suite for an extra $30/night...great value! The rooms were huge and even the partial ocean view rooms had a great view. We spent quite a lot of time on our covered balcony...such an awesome view. The bathrooms are huge with a beautiful tile shower and huge vanity area. The pool was warm and had a great view from its location - unfortunately it was too cold to use it. We did splurge on a couples massage. They felt wonderful, but the location of the "spa" area was right off of the workout room and right inside of the parking area...so it was incredibly noisy, which did take away from the relaxation. We did have to close our sliders in the morning as well as there were lots of garbage trucks, sirens, car horns, etc. so, way too noisy to sleep with the door open. However, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel of my dreams!”
Reviews.Author: Quaker82
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Pacific Terrace based on the numerous accolades I read on TripAdvisor. It is everything we hoped for and more! It's difficult to say what the best part of the hotel is - the staff, the location, the amenities, room comfort, the service, housekeeping, secure parking, concierge, grounds/landscaping, pool/hot tub are all fabulous. We had only one suggestion upon checkout - they really could use more hooks in the room to hang towels. We would definitely return to the Pacific Terrace and are happy to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MarieC30
Reviews.Content: Was in San Diego for a conference. The Pacific Terrace Hotel came highly recommended on this sight. The reviews were bang on. Upon arrival was upgraded to a partial view room. Shortly after arriving in my room the front desk called to make sure I was pleased with everything and sent up a complimentary glass of wine. The room was clean had two queen beds, large bathroom and patio. The staff was fantastic. From the front desk to the maintenance fellows. They were all polite, helpful, friendly. Every night when I arrived back at my room the sheets had been turned down, couple of chocolates left on my pillow. They also left a print out with pictures of the staff on that evening and the weather forecast for the next day. Everyday they also make suggestions of things to see or do while there on your stay.. Although I didn't like the location of the gym it had everything I needed for my workout. Great pool and hot tub with a view of the ocean. The boardwalk was a great place for strolling or jogging. Although the hotel does not have a restaurant it is surrounded by them. Stroll down the boardwalk and have breakfast at Konas, arrive early there is always a line up. This hotel is located in Pacific Beach, the location is ideal. Walk to Mission Blvd. hop on a bus and be in downtown San Diego touring the Gaslamp District in less than 30 minutes. Head in the opposite direction and 20 minutes later your in La Jolla. I attended my conference at a resort down the street and was happy that I had decided to stay at the Pacific Terrace. Much nicer place. There is so much to see and do in San Diego and this hotel is a great place to stay. Hope to have the opportunity to return. Make sure you check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but great things to say .....”
Reviews.Author: saay555
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel via Trip Advisor and LOVED it!!! Right on the water and away from downtown. Great restaurants, beach and things to do within walking distiance. Staff was SUPER friendly. Continental breakfast and wifi were included with my buy 2 get 1 night free!!!! I will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Iamirish
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Pacific Terrace. It is in a perfect location. The view from our room was wonderful. We really enjoyed the pool, especially the cabanas which are no charge. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. I was however a disappointed in our suite, an upgrade which we did not pay for. I thought it was little tired especially after reading all the rave reviews about the rooms. Perhaps I was expecting too much. We enjoyed our stay and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful San Diego Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTeacher00
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently spent 3 nights at the Pacific Terrace Hotel and couldn't have been more pleased. We originally booked the most basic nonview room to save a little bit of money (we booked the fabulous stay 2 nights get one free promotional offer), however, the staff upgraded us to a junior suite with a partial view when learning we were celebrating our 10 year anniversary. The room was perfect and had everything we needed, the kitchen was a great bonus. Every staff member we encountered were incredibly helpful and accommodating, especially Gerard. The location was perfect and the view from the pool was absolutely beautiful. I did quite a bit of research before booking this trip and all of my expectations were met or exceeded. We will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Simply awesome”
Reviews.Author: cruz4ever
Reviews.Content: First time to San Diego and trip advisor helped me choose this gem. Spent 2 nights wish it could of been more. Pricey but worth it. Room was excellent. View spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have been in for awhile.”
Reviews.Author: Lorenajuarez
Reviews.Content: Amazing rooms,nice view from the ocean and the most wonderful people.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: maci0202
Reviews.Content: Great service, great rooms, great location. Worth the money. We thought all deserved a big 'WOW'. Indeed, not the average basic hotel furniture. The rooms were really nicely set up, and the view that we paid for, was well worth it: right on the beach, looking at the palms and the ocean and listening to the gentle waves....absolutely, beautiful and romantic.. The hotel is some half hour drive from the San Diego City, in the famous La Jolla area. While the area has few main streets, it is big enough for interesting walks and even better shopping. Believe me you don't have to go to the city for that, plenty around in the proximity of the hotel. Staff were really nice and eager to assist with any enquires that we had (it's just that our postcards that we gave them to post on our behalf, arrived 3 weeks later...). We had continental breakfast included in our price, but it was very, very basic. You really had to pay to get decent breakfast. Plenty of restaurants around though, including iHop! The hotel has their own underground secure parking (for a fee of course), but we parked on the street as there was plenty of room and it was for free. The area seemed trouble free and safe enough, so no problems encountered. Overall, good hotel, well maintained, great service and nice location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Would absolutely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: TDAKansas
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and clean and lovely. The service is amazing- we were always treated well, all staff was friendly and they went out of their way to make sure things were going well for us. The view was beautfiul and this may be the only quality hotel that is actually on the ocean. My 4 year old daughter loved the complimentary beach toys and heading down to the waves to be splashed and play in the sand. We left San Diego for Disneyland after a 4 day stay at the Pacific Terrace and my husband and I were missing the Pacific Terrace immediately upon walking into our rooms at Disneyland! You cannot beat the quality of the rooms, the beautiful scenery...and the complimentary breakfast you can eat poolside with the view of the ocean!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: ckbYorktownHeightsNY
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in. This was out first family trip to San Diego. The location on the beach is amazing. The sunsets just steps away on the boardwalk breathtaking. The room was beautifully decorated. The complimentary breakfast more than satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely beautiful, clean and friendly place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: TRPLLL
Reviews.Content: Everything at this hotel was very clean and tastefully decorated. The staff were all very friendly and eager to be helpful. I would stay there again for sure. Had a great time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay ever!!! Didn't want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: brownie070
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed there for four nights and we loved every minute. We had planned to stay in a partial ocean view room, but received a call from the hotel before the trip with an offer to upgrade to the Executive Suite. It was a little extra per night, but SOOO worth it. The room was incredibly spacious with 2 very comfortable queen beds, huge flat screen tv, dvd player, sound system, sofa, dining table and small kitchen area with a mini bar and fridge. We even commented that the suite was probably bigger than our small townhouse at home. There was also a spacious private balcony with a partial view of the ocean which was close enough to hear the waves crashing and watch the surfers. I highly recommend the 3rd floor rooms for best view and least street noise. The bathroom was beyond belief with a HUGE jacuzzi tub, walk-in shower, spacious closet, dressing and makeup area AND a TV!!! Watch a movie from the tub or while you're getting ready. An array of toiletries were provided including shampoo, conditioner, lotion, bath salts, shower gel, mouth wash, toothpaste and tooth brushes. The maid service was amazing; they respected our privacy and as soon as we left just for a short time, we came back to a made up room without ever seeing the staff responsible. The front desk and all other staff were all very helpful and accommodating. The heated pool and jacuzzi were very nice and the hotel location cannot be beat. It's just off the ocean and a very short walk to many restaurants, bars, nightlife, and shopping. As for the rates, they were pricey and parking is extra, but sometimes you get what you pay for and we left feeling like this stay was worth every penny. Could not ask for more and wouldn't stay anywhere else the next time we're in San Diego. Thank you Pacific Terrace Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff- Best Hotel on the Beach!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GLemond
Reviews.Content: Wow- after reading all of the amazing reviews I don't think we can come up with anything more flattering than what has already been written! There must just be something "magical" about Pacific Terrace. In our times, with everyones busy lives, for all of these happy guests to sit down and take the time to write multiple paragraphs praising this hotel must say something great about this jewel of a hotel. We are rate shoppers! Never once in negotiating our room rates, comparing with other hotels, etc., did the staff ever make us feel "cheap" or badly for trying to get the most room for the money- quite the opposite in fact. Paul, Danielle and Carli were all wonderful to deal with as we changed rooms (different views and sizes) three times before deciding on one! When we arrrived at 7:00 am (after a 6 hour drive from Phoenix) they took our number and promised to get the room ready early for us...they also recommended a restaurant up the street called Hennesseys. The concierge Katherine overheard us looking for a place to eat breakfast, called the restaurant and arranged for us to get a two for one breakfast:) Hennesseys also is a wonderful, casual place to eat- equally friendly and accomodating staff... low key though, so if you are looking for "fancy" this is not your place! Great food, great drinks- and a very lively football watching group was their clientele! So, true to their word, we got our room early... having booked a full ocean view and coming out to see palm trees blocking our view- we asked to switch rooms.... again- NO PROBLEM:) They rushed a bellman up to us- he helped us pack up the room we had just unpacked and they moved us down the hall- the whole time assuring us that the room we had was the only one with the palm tree "blockage" and not to feel badly about wanting to switch. We did this and got the most AMAZING view!!! After a long day of sun, drinking and eating, we decided to rent a movie on the PPV they offer at the hotel- being technologically challenged, we had to call down a few times to figure out how to get it to work- again- no problem... every request, small or large was met with a smile, and NO PROBLEM- that should be the theme for this hotel- WE HAVE NEVER HAD SUCH AMAZING SERVICE AS IN THIS HOTEL! We have stayed in resorts in many cities- many of them more expensive and "high end" with less amenities, and certainly worse service. Its as though the entire staff goes to customer service seminars on a nightly basis to keep it so consistent:) One last thing we would like to point out, and yes we are going to mildy bash a couple of the other beachfront hotels here- Ocean Park Inn, Tower 23, Beach Cottages, Best Western Blue Sea Lodge..... We have stayed at these places. We have occasionally made reserverations and then called the cancel them... well, before staying this time at Pacific Terrace, we had also booked a room for $30 less at Ocean Park Inn. When we booked the room at Ocean Park I called Pacific Terrace to cancel- they didnt just say "ok, heres your cancellation number"- they asked why? And they asked if there was anything they could do so we didnt have to break the reservation....it worked! Even though Pac Terrace was higher by $30 a night, we stayed with them- number 1- because they made us feel that our visit mattered- number 2- they offered us a nice bottle of wine! So, I then called Ocean Park Inn to cancel and got "heres your cancellation number"- not even a why.... that kind of service with our kind of take on it could mean thousands of extra dollars a month for one hotel over the other! Our special thank yous to Katherine, Paul, Kyla, Carli, Danielle, Angela, Ted and the bellman- sorry guys we do not remember your names! Even the housekeeping staff who were always smiling and friendly- who also left animal shaped towels on our bed!! Little things are everything at this hotel!!! Everyone should experience it at least once!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: 2010family2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Partial ocean view suite and had a 2 year old with us. The room was great! Quiet and beautiful at night. The bedding was nice and comfortable. Continental breakfast was awesome! Starbucks coffee was available all day also tea and lemonade...For FREE! If you must have a nice hotel when you travel this one is great especially with kids.

Reviews.Title: “I had high expectations and they were all met”
Reviews.Author: wallywanna
Reviews.Content: Rest assured, this place is as good as all the reviews lead me to believe. From the moment we checked in, the service was superb. Having the "wide eyed" look of a first timer, even an employee leaving for the day stopped us and asked if this was our "first stay" ... and when we said yes, she told us "you are in for a real treat" ... and was she right. I can't add much to what others have to say. While the facility is great, it is the people that make it special. Everyone welcomes you and asks what they can do to make the visit more pleasurable. The only thing I'd nitpick -- and this is a function of staffing, not the individuals ... we found the pool beverage service to be a bit uneven, having to track down the person to order a drink once in a while. There is plenty of seating outside now for breakfast, and the food is excellent. I did the "cook to order" each morning and it was well prepared and fast. No restaurant on site is not an issue, as there are lots of places to eat very close, and room service is available. One comment on parking ... some have said to pass on the underground parking ($20 per day) and find a spot on the street. At least during the busy season forget it --- there is really no street parking close by. Try the first night in the garage, and then look yourself ... but the $20 is worth it. Great mix of the beach, the pool, and people watching on the boardwalk. I have already made reservations to return the same time next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect beach getaway hotel. Combination of ambiance, service, location and quality.”
Reviews.Author: travelerSP54
Reviews.Content: Every day was a perfect day. Easy to get to anywhere, from the beach to the Midway aircraft carieer and Seaport Village. Next time we want to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grinanbear
Reviews.Content: We (family of 5 with sons agaed from 14 to 20) stayed here on a family holiday. The location is perfect, right on the front at Pacific Beach. Even the partial view rooms have an excellent sea view. The room sizes are very good and if you have selected a room with two "queen size" beds, these are a genuine equivalent to a UK double bed size. Service is very professional and efficient but not in your face. Whilst staff are obviously looking to maximise their tips, they would never be so rude as to mention or suggest it. Facilities are a little limited (fitness room is small and no restaurant), but you have a plethora of eating and drinking establishments nearby. The "boardwalk" at Pacific beach is lively during the day, but not noisy at evening. There are one or two homeless around, but the area is very safe for walking around even late at night. It doesn't really have a spa, but the treatments/massages are as good as any we have encountered in many luxury spas in the UK and elsewhere. The place has personality rather than corporate blandness. It is not 5 star as it doesn't have the full facilities you would expect in a 5 star, but the quality of the hotel and the friendliness of service put many of these to shame. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms and wonderful service right on Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: sandtravel
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay so much at the Pacific Terrace!!! Ignore reviews from 2005. All rooms have been updated. Our family of six planned a last minute (10days in advance) trip to San Diego. Our late plans ruled out renting a house on the beach--the next best thing was the Pacific Terrace (and about $5000 less than a house for six nights). We have traveled the Caribbean extensively, and the service was as great here as anywhere we have been! Nice, clean comfortable rooms. Because of alittle booking glitch (ours not theirs!) we did end up switching rooms, and saw four rooms in the hotel. I don't think there is a lousy view in the place! They all are "partial" which practically means "full" ocean views. The only rooms I spotted that could be questionable were the ones on the first floor facing north towards the parking ramp exit. Very clean, great beds, and very accomodating front desk. Purchased tickets at concierge for Zoo at a discount. Great restaurant within walking distance down Boardwalk (which is really concrete sidewalk) called JRDNS. Fantastic breakfast or lunch. Ate there twice. Did not eat there for dinner. Great little mom and pop owned breakfast place 2 blks called Sweet & Savory Cafe at 4600 Mission Blvd. Unbelievable stuff!! Great breakfast wraps etc. Only takes about 20 min to get downtown San Diego (in light traffic). Have to admit; the amount of homeless peeps in the San Diego area is a downer--but in this economy I'm sure that is up in all temperate climates. Drive down along the harbor in late afternoon. Great photo opportunities. Also the Seaport Village is rather interesting--not just for the touristy shops; but the live Mimes hoping for a handout.

Reviews.Title: “So nice we were there 3 times in July”
Reviews.Author: beezee168
Reviews.Content: Relax and enjoy all that this place has to offer. Great staff great place wonderful sunset views. You will return again I promise you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: nifty16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights at the end of our 10-day trip that began in LA, and it was amazing: Location: Right on the boardwalk on Pacific Beach. The view of the surfers riding the waves is great, from your balcony or from the pool area. Plenty of restaurants and shops within an easy walk. Drive north a few miles to La Jolla to see the seals or snorkel with the leopard sharks, or just take in the gorgeous scenery. Only 10-15 minutes from downtown, the zoo and the aiport. The hotel: The rooms have an elegant touch to them, yet are very comfortable. The beds were great, the bathroom had plenty of space (separate vanity area), and there is a large hi-def TV. The balconies were roomy enough for the four of us to have our pizza while taking in the view. The pool is not huge, but it's fine because the hotel is small. Everything is lit up at night, giving it a very warm, romantic feel even with the kids there. Amenities: Large towels are provided in your room when you arrive to use at the pool and/or beach. They are yours for the duration, but they are happy to provide fresh ones. There is free lemonade, iced tea and water in the Caribbean room by the pool, and cookies during happy hour. Boogie boards were provided for the kids at no charge. The continental breakfast included in the rate was more than adequate with bagels, danishes, muffins, fruit, juice and coffee. Parking is $20, but it includes valet service. There are also computers with free internet access and printers for guest use. Service: The staff is what really pushes this hotel over the top. Everyone had a smile and a hello, and seemed eager to please. Check-in was a breeze, and the front desk was happy to provide info on food, shops, etc. Our room was made up each day while we were out, and the kids loved the chocolates with the turn-down service. The staff members were happy to take photos for us, and Danny the bellman was even able to give us some pointers on using our camera. Overall: Unbeatable, even though it is expensive. You often feel that four and five-star hotels try to nickel-and-dime you with extra charges, but the Pacific Terrace is just the opposite. All the included amenities and the great staff make worth every penny. If you can afford to splurge a little bit, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: wisonsinmom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from San Diego and quickly wanted to add our review of this excellent hotel. The location - gorgeous, funky, convenient, safe, walking distance to lots of things, and best of all...not downtown. The roar of the surf is part of the appeal, as well as the view and people watching. The hotel feels small and intimate - you recognize when there are new people at breakfast in the morning. We would get up before our kids, sneak out of the room and go have coffee and read the paper poolside while they slept - glorious. The hotel has quite an international feel of the clientele, and there are plenty of kids around. Another amazing thing - and even our kids kept commenting on it - was how nice everyone is. From the housekeeping staff that would run things to our room to the engineer that was fixing the pool heater at 10:00 at night and proudly said it would be ready for us in the morning, the staff was simply outstanding. And finally, I have one tip and a final compliment for the staff. We knew that we were going to go to the Wild Animal Park, Zoo and Sea World while we were there, but decided not to buy the 3-1 pass online because the hotel web site said they sold discounted tickets. As it turns out, they are unable to offer the same discount that you can get online due to restrictions from Sea World, so it ended up costing us more to buy at the hotel. It was MY mistake, as I didn't ask ahead of time where to purchase them. However, the hotel CREDITED ME the difference between what I would have paid online and what they can charge! I'm not kidding - these people are the best. So, buy your tickets online, but stay at the Pacific Terrace when you visit. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location... INCREDIBLE VIEW!... warm, friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: KnudsenFamily
Reviews.Content: Our two night stay at the BEAUTIFUL "Pacific Terrace Hotel" was a lovely, peaceful, and extremely welcome respite after nine days/nights of "frenzy" (all fun and good, but insanely busy)! Not only will we recommend to others, we would happily go back in a heartbeat... take others with us.... and spend a LOT more time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Pick”
Reviews.Author: sunbelly
Reviews.Content: Just came back and couldn't wait to write a rave review of this hotel. The service is outstanding. If they forgot one small thing- they rushed it right up to our room immediately. Its a great location on the beach- we had a junior suite oceanfront- well worth upgrading to the oceanfront as I don't think the side view would have done it for me. Having breakfast, watching the surfers, dolphins, seals and the local traffic on the "boardwalk' below was very enjoyable and relaxing- even with a 4 year old in tow! Hearing the ocean at night is the best. Pacific Beach is also a great little surfer town, can walk to most restaurants and you are close to La Jolla and not terribly far from anywhere else in the San Diego area. I highly recommend and do not recomend stayign downtown. Nothign there but listening to the train all night (been there and willl avoid at all costs)

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic location”
Reviews.Author: ScottieGirl190739
Reviews.Content: This was like staying in paradise. The hotel was fabulous and is situated looking out at the swimming pool and then onto the Pacific ocean. You could watch the sunset and it was one of the most beautiful places I have been to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beachfront Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: djbarnes
Reviews.Content: Our family (myself, wife, & our 7 and 10 year olds) spent 5 nights here in July 2010. I chose it due to reviews on Tripadvisor and it did not disappoint. The location is great right on Pacific Beach. The staff was friendly, the room was great and clean. Our balcony was on the north side so we could watch the surfers and had a great view of the sunset each night. Continental breakfast was included and was good and for added cost you could order hot items which were great as well. The kids enjoyed the pool. Parking was easy (in and out - you park below the hotel and pay a small fee each night) and there were plenty of restaurants within walking distance to the hotel. We enjoyed the San Diego Zoo, Legoland, kayaking the caves in La Jolla, the USS Midway museum, and enjoyed a great day in Coronado. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL ON THE BEACH!!!”
Reviews.Author: Waterpark8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome!!! The rooms are large and the hotel is very clean. The hotel staff went out of their way to make sure that we were comfortable. The hotel staff was one of the most efficent and friendly staff of any hotel that I have stayed at. Our room overlooked the pool, every morning the maintenance department was cleaning and checking the chemical levels in the pool and hottub. You will not find a better hotel or find a better staff then Pacific Terrace Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel on the beach in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ItalophileNJ
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at the Pacifc Terrace Hotel, with two ocean front rooms for the four of us. Although the weather was cool (San Diego is having the coldest July in over a half century) we enjoyed our stay very much. Our rooms were comfortable and nicely furnished, with overhead fans, great shutters AND screens and of course good AC. We went to sleep every night listening to the waves breaking on the shore belowl The pool was great, the pool lounges comfortable. Front desk service was wonderful, great staff as others have said. Poolside food service, ordered from a couple of local restaurants, was convenient. The location was great, with many decent ---- and even GOOD ---- restaurants within easy walking distance. It was nice to walk along the above-ocean path in the morning to get that second cup of coffee and see all the others out getting ready for whatever daytime ocean activity drew them.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: SGKlausner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace for our 25th anniversary - we were in the Santa Cruz suite, with a good sized terrace overlooking the pool and the ocean, an enormous bathroom with a jacuzzi, a kitchenette, generous sized closet and a sofa. We didn't hear a sound from outside the room even once the entire time, even from the pool down below. The staff was attentive and the room was always made up beautifully. They were almost too generous with the towels and bath products! The resort is on the north end of a 3 1/2 mile boardwalk: if you get up before the crowds it's an awesome run. Definitely rent bicycles and pedal down to Mission Bay and through the lovely park. The boardwalk is mighty busy, but the hotel is a little off of where the action is so you wouldn't even realize how crazy busy Pacific Beach actually is while staying at the hotel: but just walk out the door and south one block and you're in the middle of it all! We enjoyed watching the surfers at all hours of the day from our balcony, and pool area was tropical and lovely. The concierge took care of every possible question and request we had. My husband and I felt perfectly comfortable on our own at the hotel, but it was filled with families who seemed to be having a great time as well. I didn't feel overrun by all the kids there, and our visit was still quite romantic. My only suggestion is try not to rent a room on the south side of the hotel - the balconies overlook the parking garage and a street that seemed very busy with early morning surfers: you might find that action disturbing. Spring for a room overlooking the pool. Although there was no restaurant on the premises, there are great places to eat steps from the door. Try JRDN for an absolutely amazing meal right on the ocean. I hope we make it back to this fantastic little hotel very soon!

Reviews.Title: “lovely views right on the sea”
Reviews.Author: robertadams
Reviews.Content: stayed here in august 09 one night as part of our san diego to san fran road trip anyone who has given this place 5/5 has pretty much covered everything that needs to be said so i will not add anymore. think maybe it was slighty expensive so have given it 4/5 for value

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jersey08
Reviews.Content: first time to CA back in Oct 09...the hotel was a great location...walk to beaches, shopping, restuarants. Our room was HUGE and really nice. There was no bar at the hotel and the pool was small, but we were off sight seeing at most times. This was a great hotel to come back to after a long day traveling around SD.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay!”
Reviews.Author: VacationFamilyGuy
Reviews.Content: Spent the 4th of July weekend at Pacifc Terrance. The room was awesome. The entire staff (front desk, bar, housekeeping) was great! It's probably the best service I've received in a long time--very refreshing. Pool side is comfortable with an awesome view of the ocean and boardwalk. Steps for the beach. Walking distance to shops and restaurants. Our room had a large size patio. Free WiFi! We're coming back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: Flygirl2222
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel for a b-day "stay-cation" get-away and everything about it was awesome...from room amenities to view to service!!! The room overlooked the pool which overlooked the ocean...definitely recommend a room with a view and a balcony...spectacular! But beyond the hotel was the service...the service was 5+ star!!! From front desk to bellmen to guest services, they all went above and beyond. The hotel itself does not have it's own restaurant or bar, but have set up accommodations with other local restaurants and bars to be able to go, dine and have the bill charged to the room...total convenience for the guest all the way around. They also have their own in-room fridge with bar and snacks and finally a hotel that doesn't gouge you...everything from liquor to snacks is priced accordingly!!! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to vacation with or without the family, a quick getaway, romantic rendezvous or a stay-cation for the locals...Pacific Terrace is one of the best!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Surgery Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: wangdang83
Reviews.Content: When I found out that I was having back surgery, I had my daughter book me the "nicest room in San Diego" for a mini-vacation. While recovering from surgery, my girlfriend always says, remember how you felt in San Diego. We stayed in the room the whole time, ordered room service and ate on our balcony. There is no reason to leave your room! Thank you for getting me through the most painful experience of my life. I look forward to a quick recovery and return.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Pacific Beach!”
Reviews.Author: mroady
Reviews.Content: Pacific Terrace Hotel is a great place to stay in Pacific Beach. Right on the Ocean overlooking the waves, you can hear them from your room. The staff is very friendly and warm and the surroundings are perfect. I travel to San Diego on business and stay here whenever I can. It sure beats the more "sterile" hotels that most business travelers stay. It feels like I am on vacation after work and in most cases the price is the same as the bigger chains. I also stay here on vacation when my family travels with me to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “My all time favorite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PBBigBear
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Pacific Terrace Hotel for over 20 years, since it was Pacific Terrace Inn. This hotel is small and hidden in Pacific Beach, right on a cliff on the ocean. The adjacent boardwalk is beautiful and you can walk south all the way into Mission Beach. The view of sunset is just perfect. It's true every room does not have a great view, but we have stayed in many rooms, and always thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff has always been great, and they seemed even better than ever this week. We understood when they began to charge for the full breakfast, but they also provide great service for paid or complimentary items, which are good quality, and we love the coffee. You should book directly with the hotel and make sure you understand what type of room and view you will get. Most of the views are truly fantastic, and some of the rooms have great additional features. We travel a lot and enjoy beaches up and down the west coast and in Hawaii. We have never enjoyed another as much as we do the Pacific Terrace. Pacific Beach has tons of restaurants of all kinds, several on the ocean, some better than others. This time, we returned to a favorite nearby restaurant, the Fishery. It is a fantastic little getaway I will also review.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Caring service and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: azroepke
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in we were treated as if we were the only guests. All employees were very polite and helpful. Our room was lovely and the view, which was considered partial view was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome so far...June 2010”
Reviews.Author: vvccoach
Reviews.Content: We are staying here right this very minute. When walking into the room you are enveloped with sophisticated tropical decor. It really is awesome and very clean. We are in a full ocean view room with two double beds. There is so much room even with the large, wood furniture. Much more room than the pictures on the hotel site show. The view is breath taking, however, a partial view room would be really good to and would safe a few bucks. The balcony is very large, comes with four patio chairs and a small cocktail table. The bathroom is functional as well as the closet. Nice minibar and a refrigerator. The hotel really is right on the beach, lots of surfers and people walking on the boardwalk. $20 for parking in a underground parking structure is a great deal. Free valet too. Warning to smokers; no smoking on the premises, however, the walk is short and safe to smoke. Also, there is only one electrical outlet for use in the main room and it's not by the desk. We are staying 2 more nights so if anything changes I will add another review. By the way, we got a great deal on hotels.com

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace is the best place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Randi123
Reviews.Content: If you are coming to San Diego and want a fantastic view, great service, great location at an incredibly reasonable price, stay at Pacific Terrace Hotel. The staff is remarkable in taking care of your needs and making sure your stay is comfortable, convenient and memorable. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Diego. We live within a mile of the Hotel but rented a room for our visiting 13 year old nephew. He loved it and so did we. We would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ocean Resort”
Reviews.Author: beckertravel4
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay right on the ocean. Good waves for boogie boarding and lots of surfers to watch. Rented wet suites and boogie boards from Pure Life for $10 per person. Needed the wet suites as the water is cold. Excellent service and very nice staff. Stayed in a Junior suite for a family of 4 which had plenty of space. Great counter/vanity space separate from the bathroom. Kitchenette area helpful for breakfast and snacks. Heated pool nice for night swimming. Boardwalk fun to walk and people watch. Underground secure parking but $20 per day. Lots of restaurants in walking distance. Great food at Nick's on Mission Bay Blvd. Good day trip to San Diego Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: abbyrae
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and in a perfect location. Staff was very friendly. I've read reviews of people complaining about parking. There is some street parking available at certain times of the day. We paid for the parking garage during our stay and happy we did. Some reviews also complain about no restaurant on site. There are quite a few restaurants within walking distance and breakfast can be ordered in the hotel for a charge. Most people walk to a coffee shop down the boardwalk where the food is good and cheap. Overall we loved this hotel and would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we expected”
Reviews.Author: timamg60
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it had had such great reviews. It was nice and had the weather had been better Im sure we would have enjoyed it more but we felt overall it was just ok. Notes of caution... There are very limited facilities in terms of food and drink on the premises. There is no bar, no snacks and the breakfast area is badly designed and not able to cope with the volume of people. Food is available to order but comes from a local restaurant and is therefore expensive and takes a while. Pool are is ok but quite small. On the plus side the rooms are clean and well maintained - although furniture is a bit weird! The staff however were excellent and couldnt do enough for you. Its probably the best of what there is to offer in Pacific Beach but not sure if it represents value for money unless you get a good deal. Also we had an adjoining room and could hear everything next door were doing and their TV etc.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment. NOT what it use to be!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jfamilyof8
Reviews.Content: Made my reservation through the hotel directly. Was told my room would be a â€œJr. Suiteâ€� with two beds and a sofa sleeper, w/best view available. The hotel employee encouraged me to upgrade to this suite, over a standard 2 queen, to make our stay here more enjoyable, with the extra space & bed. It had an extra cost of $75 but after speaking w/him agreed to additional charge. We were very excited, as we had not stayed at this hotel in the past 5 years, but before this time had stayed many times and had been very pleased. Upon arrival we were given the â€œJr. Suiteâ€� which seemed to be a standard room with 2 queen beds. I went to the front desk, and asked about the sofa sleeper, and explained this was the reason I had upgraded to the â€œSuiteâ€� over the standard queen. They told me there must have been some mistake. They offered a larger suite, which had a sofa sleeper, with no view to compensate. I told them the reason for our stay was for the view. They then stated they had a comfortable â€œAeroâ€� bed which had an additional $20 charge, which they were willing to comp for the misunderstanding. We received the bed, which was a little twin blow up mattress, which rested directly on the floor. After we had settled into our room, we began to hear hammering and pounding from the room below our room. We called the front desk to ask about this. They informed us the room below us was under construction, and was being re-carpeted. We asked how long the pounding would continue and we were informed it would be another hour. The hammering and pounding continued all afternoon. We had to leave the room because the noise was so loud. When we returned to the room, and went to sleep, the blow up bed I was sleeping on had a hole in it, and I slept the entire night on the floor. In the morning, we went to get a towel from the pool area to take to the beach. The security guard yelled at us, and treated us like we were criminals-he wanted to know how we got into the pool area. I explained I had used my key. The guy seriously needs to learn some customer service skills. I went to the front desk, and spoke to the same lady I had been speaking to all along, blonde with glasses. She had a great big smile, and tried to pacify me with it. She wanted to make things â€œrightâ€� for all of our hassle. She told me that we could stay another night at no charge. I asked her which room we would be able to stay in. She told me we could not stay in our same room, because it was booked. She had someone show me a room they could offer us. The room was a large room, w/NO VIEW... the view was of a hotel next to ours. Upon returning to the front desk, we told her it would not work for what we had paid to stay, she said there was another room with an excellent view that might be available, and that we should go and do our daily activities, and then she would call us when she knew if it would be available. After waiting 1 hr, we had not heard back, so we went to have breakfastâ€¦. Again HUGE disappointmentâ€¦ it is not what it used to be. We returned to the front desk, and asked her what were the plans. She still did not know. By this time, it is 10:30am, and we need to know if we need to pack up our stuff and check out, or move to another room. We asked to see the room, but she refused to show it to us. We told her we could not make a decision, until we were able to see what kind of a room they were willing to offer. She said she was not able to show it to us, but encouraged us to just "take the offer". We then went to the 2nd floor, where the room was that they were offering, and saw the door open, and asked the maintenance staff who were working on the room if we could take a peek. There was no view, except for a view of the parking lot and public beach bathrooms. Once we saw the view, we understood why she refused to show us the room. We then called the front desk, and told them we would be checking out, and we wanted a discount on our room for all of the issues we had experienced. Upon checkout she had a smile on her face, but her body language showed our issues were a serious inconvenience for her.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely first class people, view, and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Burtonvic
Reviews.Content: This place sits right on Pacific Beach. The view and sunsets are awesome. Great staff. Had a wonderful week. Dinner at the Green Flash (twice), and JRDN's(twice). Breakfast, Lunch, and Coffee at Kono's Surf Cafe (five times)...all were great.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER SORRY I STAYED HERE”
Reviews.Author: Pickeetravelor
Reviews.Content: In a time when customer service is poor, this place goes out of there way to make sure you are happy. This is my second time staying here and once again. They knocked it out the park. The ocean view is fabulous. Sleeping with the ocean waves right outside can't be beat. Even though there was a frig problem, they replaced it immediately. Folks can by the room just to see if we needed anything further. If I ever go back to San Diego, I will definitely stay there again. Honestly, the ocean is the star. I really couldn't tell you much about other amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome ... it's what vacation is all about!”
Reviews.Author: RainySilverton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent close to a week at the hotel. Positive friendly staff who always said hello to us no matter where we were in the building. A sweet smelling spotless room with a comfy bed, beautiful ocean view, soft bathrobes, chocolate on our pillows, etc., etc. I can't say enough good things about our stay here. I don't know why this hotel isn't #1. Just walk out of the lobby into the friendly Pacific Beach community and there are lots of great places to eat, sand dollars to find and surfers to watch. Not to mention that awesome sea lion I saw on the beach. Wow. The pool was beautiful and warm too. What a great stay... but now that I'm back home in Oregon all I can do is go to the pacific terrace hotel web cam and dream about my next trip back!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise and personal attention all in one”
Reviews.Author: kuck
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace Hotel has the most professional, accommodating, and friendly staff I have ever encountered. I love to vacation and highly recommend this hotel to anyone who values great customer service and a feeling of paradise on their vacation.

Reviews.Title: “BEST STAFF EVER!”
Reviews.Author: DiMor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pacific Terrace based upon reviews on this site. We were not disappointed. Upon arrival, the desk had fresh apples and cookies. Complimentary glasses of wine were delivered to our room. Our room had two beds and a balcony overlooking the ocean. We watched surfers by day, and saw the most beautiful sunsets at night. My hubby and grandson took surfing lessons right on the beach, which was fun to watch. At first I thought it would be a drawback to have no restaurant on site, but there are many nearby, some that allowed us to charge back to our room, and room service from two restaurants only took 30 - 45 minutes to arrive. The staff was SUPERB. Ted wouldn't let us lift a finger with our luggage; when a light bulb burned out, I went out for a bit, and returned to find it fixed. If you don't want to bring your own laptop, there is a PC station on each floor. The only drawback was that the beds are high, but I did find a bed stepstool in the closet. This would probably be a problem for an elderly person. We plan to return to Pacific Terrace for a glass of wine on the ocean view balcony watching the sunset...ahhhh.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience - Can't Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: BeachGal815
Reviews.Content: Arrived late afternoon and was greated by a smiling bellman who offered to take our luggage and our car. Every staff member we encountered from then on out was top of the line. We had booked a full ocean view junior suite which fit the bill in every way except for the view (we are very, very picky) which looked out over the pool and then to the ocean. When we asked to be moved we were accomodated quickly and shown several other rooms to choose from. We settled on a corner room (but not a junior suite) with a view of the ocean and coastline as far as the eye could see. We spent much time on our terrace with books and afternoon cocktails. We had a decent continental breakfast included in our room rate -- additional items or a hot cooked breakfast could be added. Breakfast on the terrace was lovely but a bit chilly - a heater or two would have been nice. Pool was small but well kept and our kids really enjoyed it. Concierge service was superb - weather it was making dinner reservations (try JRDN for dinner), ordering take out for us or getting tickets to the zoo. My only minor complaint was the cost of parking - $20 per night. I realize that parking in the beach areas is precious but given the room rate parking could have been a little cheaper or even included. Having said that, we've decided this is our new home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: hernameiscalifornia
Reviews.Content: I really would like to give some props to the staff at the Pacific Terrace. One of the most impressive things was how you were greeted every time you came and left the building. Everyone was happy and friendly, and they even addressed you by name when you called the front desk. Pacific Beach turned out to be one of the coolest beaches around, with plenty of surfers and even kite-surfers to watch from the balcony. Garnet Ave. shops and nighlife are right around the corner, tons of restaurants and even a CVS are right around the area, and I had a great time at Hennessey's down the way for Karaoke Night. They have some nice cabanas around the pool, too. The only thing I didn't care for was the kind of mossy green color of the building; even so, It's obvious when you go there that Pacific Terrace is THE place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: LGP6868
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace hotel the first week in San Diego for Spring Break. We loved so much about this hotel! First, the location. It's in Pacific Beach, which is just south of LaJolla. Whereas LaJolla has hoity-toity boutiques, fancy restaurants, and Bentley dealerships, Pacific Beach has taco stands and surf shops. It's got a casual, funky, surfer-dude feel. We loved it. If you don't want to have to get dressed up, and you want to walk to any number of casual seafood restaurants for dinner, this is the spot for you. THe hotel is right on the boardwalk, but about two blocks down from the more commercial area, so you avoid the noise and chaos. You access the beach by going down a staircase. We could watch the surfers from our balcony window. The view is amazing. The pool is small, but managed somehow, even during spring break with lots of families there, to have seats for everyone each time we went. The pool has a glass wall separating it from the boardwalk, which allows a great view, but protects from the wind. Our room, a suite, was very large and comfortable. The furnishings are a little bit dated, but very nice nonetheless. The staff bends over backwards to make you comfortable, whether it's cocktails by the pool or going to nearby restaurants to pick up "room service" for you. Any complaints were answered promptly and with great care.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: clkmak
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace Hotel lived up to the reviews we read online. We stayed in the Trinidad Suite...room 321. It was the best room in the hotel. Great views of everything. We watched the dolphins in the morning and surfers all day long. What a great location this hotel is on the north end of the boardwalk. We sat on one of our balconies most of the time but when we ventured out for a walk, the boardwalk was the perfect spot. So many places to eat within walking distance. We took a taxi from the airport($27.00-$32.00 one way). We ate at Nick's Seafood twice. It's about four blocks south(great seafood), Gringos(great Mexican food), and Bare Backs(best burgers around).
