While I can understand them charging for the hot stuff, you can get a better continental breakfast at a place half the price. Go on the off season and you'll have a great time for a decent price... go when it's full price and you'll probably feel a little cheated. Not because it's not a great stay - it is - it's just not worth $500 a night plus parking. Oh, and watch out for the birds.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing + Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelFactor
Reviews.Content: I really like this boutique hotel and Pacific Beach especially. The rooms are nice. The staff is friendly and it's right on the beach. The hotel currently serves a complimentary continental breakfast with *interesting* one-piece-only rules that are given to guests by a very sincere employee. Instead of being offended that we were policed for our breakfast picks, I was actually sort of tickled! (I always have a piece of fruit and coffee, so it was no big deal.) Another good thing about the location is that I never had to leave the area. Small shops, restaurants, the beach, the boardwalk -- all were right there. I never felt the need to visit the other attractions. The hotel met my need to veg out, hear waves, and never have to jump in a taxi during my stay. Last thing: housekeeping can be pretty slow. If you are someone who needs your room cleaned daily and before noon, make sure to let them know beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful sunset on very private balcony!”
Reviews.Author: thriving88
Reviews.Content: We had an unforgettable time here! We are locals and came here for a mid-week post-Valentine's/husband's birthday getaway. When the amazing staff noticed it was my husband's bday, we were upgraded to the Presidential Suite and it was fabulous!! It really created a special memory for us and what a bummer we didn't stay an extra night. The first thing we did was enjoy the sunset from the balcony which immediately relaxed us. We then walked to Gringo's and had a delicious dinner. There are a zillion restaurants to choose from in a 1 block radius, FYI. Upon return, enjoyed the jacuzzi tub while watching the awesome bathroom TV (we don't have an LCD at home). The room was beautifully decorated and you can leave your balcony door open to hear the ocean waves as you lie in the ginormous bed. The TV from the bed was great too. Just being that close to the ocean was soooooo spirit-changing. Even staying just one night was renewing. The cool thing is most of the rooms face out to the ocean. We will definitely be back, and for longer next time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: ParticularAnne
Reviews.Content: We decided to pop into this hotel for one Saturday night prior to checking into our so-called "5 star resort." When we arrived the next day at said fancy resort, we were so disappointed at how it compared to Pacific Terrace. We stayed one night and then checked back into Pacific Terrace for the remaining 10 days of our trip. The hotel itself is perfectly situated on Mission Beach with most rooms offering terrific views of the ocean as well as the hotel's beautiful, warm and lighted pool surrounded by comfy lounge chairs (some under a shaded canopy that I certainly needed for my red head!) The grounds are beautiful and well kept up with maintenance people all over collecting towels and any litter that (rarely) seemed to find its way to the pool area. What I loved about the pool is that there was no smoking, no food and beverages (since the eating area patio was just steps away) and no music....Just peace and quiet. Even the very few children in the pool were quiet and well behaved. The tone was just automatically set to be this tranquil. We swam everyday despite SD having a record cold spell during our trip. When I asked the hotel desk to turn up the heat in the pool even more than the 80 degrees it was set at, they immediately complied and the next day, and for the rest of our trip, the pool was a haven away from the cold winds off the Pacific. Each room has a fantastic balcony where we had our breakfast delivered daily. To look at the beautiful ocean and that pristine beach over coffee every morning was the best way to start our day. There is also a walkway along the ocean path for bikes, rollerblades and the like, but we loved walking on this amazing beach best with its hard packed damp sand making it super easy to traverse. The rooms are newly renovated with very comfortable beds, lovely furnishings and lighting, new, clean carpeting, and plenty of space to stretch out. The staff, though, is what made this a special trip for us. We were treated with such cheerful smiles and genuine offers of help in every way by every staff member there. Lynette, Ted, and Cassie were especially helpful. Lynette brought us complimentary wine one evening for us to enjoy on our balcony and even remembered a treat for our 3 year-old son, Leo. The housekeeping staff, too, was exceptional, going out of their was to accommodate our changing needs daily. We loved them all! My partner didn't want me to even write this review for fear that the hotel will become too popular, but they really deserve kudos for their fine service and wonderful facilities. Even with the "incident" of a broken water main on our first night, leaving all of us with no showers for 36 hours, the staff went out of their way to make us comfortable and were profusely apologetic about the accident (which wasn't in any way their fault to begin with.) It was impossible to be angry about it with the entire staff scrambling to help us all out. I wouldn't necessarily go to San Diego again just for Sea World and the Zoo (the main reason we took our son) but knowing that we could stay at the Pacific Terrace again ensures that we will, in fact, be back. I have already planned a trip with my sister and her family for next year and we will be staying at the Pacific Terrace. THANK YOU, PACIFIC TERRACE, FOR A WONDERFUL TRIP!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: saabco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a long needed vacation to California and spent four nights at the Pacific Terrace. The room, the view, the location and the service was great. While there I had a biking accident. The employees couldn't have been more helpful, offering ice and wrap, a wheel chair and even a glass of wine to ease the pain. We enjoyed coming back to the room after our siteseeing, relaxing on the patio while watching the sunset. Lots of activity outside the window. Then a short walk to dinner down the boardwalk(concrete). It would be better if they had a restaurant and bar at the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Love the location”
Reviews.Author: anlatao
Reviews.Content: They made some mistakes with our reservation, but the front desk was very nice and helpful. They compensated us with lower rate and free parking plus a bottle of our choice of wine. We got the oceanfront junior suite and the view was fantastic! The room was clean and very roomy. The only part that we don't like is the parking garage. The garage opener wasn't working all the time and parking space is very small. Other than that, everything was great. With 2 little boys (3 and 5), this is the 1st time that we actually felt like it was our vacation as well. We were chatting, drinking wine and enjoying the views on the balcony after kids fell into sleeps. It was really nice and relaxing. I will definitely go back and recommend to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience imaginable.”
Reviews.Author: duckincali
Reviews.Content: We checked in for a weekend getaway by booking our reservation through a 3rd part website. Once we arrived, they stated our booking had been lost and we would need to check in to another hotel 3 miles from the existing location. This was all done with a big smile with absolutely no concern for inconvenience we would have to endure. After speaking with 2 different managers, we were able to get a "wait one minute while I check with our General Manger" response. After waiting 30 minutes in the lobby, she came back and stated we were lucky and we would get a room even though they weren't obligated to honor our reservation since it was made through a 3rd party website. Never in my life have I ever met a hotel manager that was so rude, callous, and void of managerial competance. The view was spectacular and the rooms were sufficient but the service received by the woman front office manager with blonde hair and glasses will never be forgotten. I would never stay here ever again even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanfront Location + Great Service = Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Carrie R
Reviews.Content: Pacific Terrace was outstanding. My mother and I sadly only stayed for one night in January 09. We paid $119 on hotels.com and were upgraded to an oceanfront room upon arrival for an additional $50. The room normally is about $250 in the off season. Our room was lovely - 'princess and the pea' beds, very high and cozy. Full mini bar with sink, but also with an empty fridge to stock your own goodies. We were happy that they had actual glassware - coffee mugs, wine glasses, and cocktail glasses. The room was clean and modern with a HUGE television. A nice layout with a more private bathroom / changing area - especially useful with the oceanfront boardwalk right outside your window. The surrounding area included quite a number of restaurant choices - mostly pub / grill type places, which looked casual. We were only there one night and ordered room service, which was fast and yummy. The hotel offers a number of room service options from surrounding restaurants. The only downside is that they charged $20 per day parking fee, but included 'free valet', which was efficient and friendly. I suppose they get away with charging this in the summer months, but in the winter, it seems a bit high - and I'm from Chicago. Overall though, worth every penny and would highly recommend this lovely oceanfront hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: DPJChicago
Reviews.Content: Not only tastefully decorated, but very comfortable as well. Of course, you can't beat the location and the view. The hotel staff was friendly, professional and very accommodating. Don't fuse with taxi service, contact the hotel and hire Carlos. He is a great driver, reliable and knows the city well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: jentow
Reviews.Content: We wanted something a little special for a family reunion and chose this because of the location on the beach, good reviews, and nice off-season rates. Compared to the other hotels in the Gaslamp Quarter it was a great deal. THe hotel upgraded us for our special occasion. The rooms all overlook the pool and the ocean. It was still a reasonabley short drive to the Gaslamp, Sea World and the SD Zoo. You can rent bikes and ride along the beach. The only criticism of the hotel was that the air conditioning units were loud, and the floors/walls were a little thin. We were on the ground floor and every morning at 6am the people above us stomped around and woke us up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: apodko
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in January and we both loved it. We are both 24 I am not picky but my friend is and she loved the Pacific Terrace Hotel. There are no restaurants on site but there are diners, bars, and many other restaurants within easy walking distance. They do provide Starbucks coffee in the morning and throughout the day, an actual Starbucks is less than a 10 min walk away. The staff was always extremely nice, the rooms are excellent, we used our robes a lot especially to walk to the hot tub at night. The rain shower heads could use more pressure but an extra minute or two in the shower really shouldn't be something to whine about. Weekend rates are expensive but if you travel during the week search rates often because you can find a great deal. The only legitimate complaint that I think anyone could have is the parking fee but if your not lazy and don't mind a short walk you can find a place to park.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in scenic location”
Reviews.Author: syee99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Pacific Terrace during a recent road trip out to San Diego. The location is nice, right on the beach front, and far enough away from the bars so you don't get too much of the traffic and noise associated with it. Rooms were very clean and spacious - I got the economy room with no view (although there is a slight view from the balcony). The mini fridge and microwave was a bonus. Beds were comfy, and the plasma TV's are a nice touch, especially with the large number of high def channels they had available. It's one of the few times I've actually wanted to stay in my hotel room instead of going out. As another reviewer had mentioned, I was expecting a continental breakfast since I had read somewhere that it was provided. Unfortunately, it's not offered anymore, and breakfast is now a $12 option. Dennys and iHop was close by so I didn't bother with the in house stuff, and just went to one of the many local restaurants nearby for breakfast. The $20 parking was a bit steep too, but with the limited on street parking, you'll probably want to pony up the $20 for it if you're going to be there during peak season. I was there during the winter, and parking was still a little scarce at times. The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. They greeted me by name when they saw me which was actually quite surprising and a nice personal touch. They also offered to help with my bags which was also nice. Turndown service every evening is a nice touch that you only find in higher end hotels. Overall, a nice hotel. Very modern, comfortable, and nice location. Stay there if you get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker073
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Pacific Terrace many times. We recently stayed at the Pacific Terrace with our children The property has been renovated beautifully. The staff couldnot have been more helpful. It is a rare find when you can get the boutique hotel feeling while traveling with your family. When we were there with out our children it felt like an exclusive hideaway . When we returned with the kids they fell in love with the Pacific Terrace. Just as we had 5 years earlier. We are looking forward to staying with you all again. We have traveled around the world. Stayed in five star accomadations,Pacific Terrace by far is one of our favorites. Thank you for another wonderful stay. The Burrell Family

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catherine226
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 6 day stay here. We loved the hotel. We had a very spacious junior suite with full ocean view. If you are traveling with kids, here's some things about the amenities that they don't seem to highlight on their website. Huge flat panel TV with DVD player--we always bring our own movies to give the kids some down time and this was the only time I didn't have to figure out how to rig our personal DVD player to a hotel TV Guest laundry available in the basement--if I had known, I would have packed less Microwave and fridge in the room with dining table Books in the lobby for guests to take or leave the books they don't want to carry home Heated pool open from 8 am - 10 pm. I thought the room and furnishings were beautiful. The bed was super comfortable--like an old fashioned feather bed that you sink into. The staff was very helpful. We even had complimentary wine delivered to our room when we checked in. The $20 per day parking was a detraction. Overall, one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were expecting!”
Reviews.Author: Kimi_Smith
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed in the hotel. The employees were very nice but beyond that we could not wait to leave. The carpet was dirty and the bed was very incomfortable. When we initially entered the room it was stuffy and smelly! Our "partial view" did in fact have an ocean view but it was directly over the street and parking lot. There were car all night and all morning who were coming and going with music blasting and car alarms sounding. This noise was finally drowned out once the bars closed at 2am and the drunk students proceeded to light fireworks, scream and party within an earshot of our room. It was the least peaceful place ever and by far the least romantic! We paid about 30% less than the quoted rate and were angry about paying that amoun for the expierence we had. I can't imagine how livid people are that pay full price! Definately NOT worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Accommodations !!”
Reviews.Author: KapOhio
Reviews.Content: We made arrangements at the last minute to stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary, and to watch our son play football at a local university. We had reservations elsewhere, but changed them to be near the ocean for a few days. The moment we walked into the hotel we were greeted by kind and helpful staff, and even offered wine upon our arrival to our room. The staff made sure our room was comfortable ( it was AMAZING!!! ) and that we had all we needed. Everything was wonderful! The grounds were beautiful, the staff in all the areas were friendly and helpful. It was Halloween and they dressed up to celebrate, making it even more relaxed. Our view of the ocean was incredible ( thanks Matt !), and the price was great for the treatment we received ! We weren't sure if the hotel was older because of the picture in the AAA book, or just a retro looking hotel, but it was beautiful, very clean and updated. We plan on returning in two years for another football matchup, and we do plan on staying here again. Thank you Pacific Terrace Hotel for such a warm and welcoming experience !!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and superb service at the beach”
Reviews.Author: TravelLuvr45
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Pacific Terrace and it is truly one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. We have stayed at luxury hotels in Europe, Hawaii, the Caribbean and throughout the US and I can truly say this one is in our top three - and I'm vert picky. The service is unbelievable and special thanks to Danielle in reservations and the front desk. Danielle and the rest of the staff really make you feel at home. The room was exceptionally clean and was decorated in beautiful tropical decor. The bathroom is marble and there are granite counter tops by the sink which is separated from the toilet/tub area. The pool and hot tub area is landscaped very nicely. Remember that this is a small hotel so there is no restaurant onsite but there are many little restaurants nearby or within a short driving distance. There was a basic breakfast with cereal, breads, fruit, yogurt, juices and coffee included with the room. The service though is unreal and that's what sets this property apart. Thanks everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: SeattleGirl08
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! What a beautiful hotel right on the ocean. We stayed here for our 40th Wedding Anniversary and had a wonderful time. The Staff is the best you'll find anywhere. Rooms were spotless, our overall experience with The Pacific Terrace was A++++. If you want to stay at a clean, very friendly, on the beach hotel in San Diego I would highly recommend The Pacific Terracel!!

Reviews.Title: “The word "Awesome" comes to mind....”
Reviews.Author: Gceres
Reviews.Content: Needed a break from life for a night so decided to book a hotel room here after searching endlessly online. Got an amazing deal at $99.00 a night (normal price is $389.00). Was leery as I'd never heard of the hotel before despite living in Pacific Beach before. VERY satisfied! Check-in was seemless....got there at 2:40 and was told room wasn't ready until 4:00 despite being told on the phone it would be ready. After informing the concierge of this, she promptly got us a room. They bring a complementary glass of wine directly to your room shortly after you get there, have an amazing pool area with an ocean view, and offer free coffee and juice all day and night. The room itself is elegant with AWESOME beds (the mattresses were PERFECT!). The 42 inch flat screen television was an added bonus. They have a fully stocked refreshment bar which we didn't utilize but is a plus. The tub was adequate with a great hand-held shower. Phone in the marble tiled bathroom. Wooden shuttered doors to a balcony with chairs and a table....VERY CLEAN! To our surprise, there was even a maid that knocks on the door offering chocolates and turn down service. Oh, and they have the coolest complementary bath robes! Overall, QUITE relaxing and one of the best hotels I've stayed in for a while. Next time I think we'll upgrade and try the jacuzzi suite which was on discount for $299.00 (just out of my price range this time). HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: sassychigal
Reviews.Content: After reading a review on Orbitz - I called the Hotel directly and they honored the online rate. I received the best service from everyone. My room was HUGE - non ocean view with a big HG TV. The b-fast was good as was the happy hour from 4 - 5pm. The location was amazing and the pool was great.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there any time I'm in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: TJBSEA
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to the pictures and reviews on Orbitz.com. The staff was always very friendly, gave great restaurant recommendations. The rooms were very clean, new, large plasma HD tvs, porches with shutters, clean and modern bathrooms, all fixtures in great shape and more tasteful than your average "tropical" designs. There is a free wine reception from the patio just outside the pool from 4pm to 5pm. The gated porch and pool area opens right out onto the boardwalk. Great views of Crystal Pier and overall just an awesome laid-back feeling in Pacific Beach. Close to great restaurants and 15 minutes from La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: teeharrow
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Pacific Terrace for three nights and loved every minute of it. The location is excellent right on the beach (hire a bike and explore the area - it's wonrderful!) whilst the staff are perhaps the most helpful I have ever come across at a hotel. The complimentary breakfast was a real bonus (coffee, pastries etc) as was the free wine (afternoon 4-5) and soft drinks/coffee (all day). Whilst the pool is small it affords an excellent view of the beach (accessed via gated entrance) and is a wonderful place for a late afternoon drink. We would definately visit San Diego again and would return to the Pacific Terrace without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location, little overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TicTacToeFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an ocean view suite ie king bed and sleeper sofa. Sleeper sofa was supposed to be queen but one 7 year old barely fit. The accommodations themselves were above average but not excellent, though they were very clean. The staff here are definitely their best asset. Friendly, approachable and just very hospitable all round. Also very family friendly. The breakfast on offer was cheap and unappetizing, considering the price of a $550 a night suite - yogurt, dry muffins, bagels and pretty bad coffee. Had to pay for parking each night - it should be included in the price of the pricey rooms! The view from our room was spectacular. To be able to open the doors and have an unobstructed ocean and sunrise/ sunset view was unbelievable. But right outside of the hotel ie in front of all the rooms is a very busy boardwalk, which kept going pretty much all of the time so patio privacy was a little limited. But the beach itself was also very close and accessible so it was a fair trade off. Local area is pretty run down but seemed safe enough. We found several very good family run type restaurants within 10 minutes walking distance which were reasonable and good.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bo C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for three nights in October 2008 and we loved it. The hotel is about 30 years old but the owner has done a great job renovating it. We paid an extra $50 (for a total of $200) per night to upgrade our hotel to a junior suite that has a perfect view of the Pacific Ocean. Our room was clean, roomy and well appointed. The pool and hot tubs were great. We loved the large comfortable bed and the 52â€� plasma hi-def TV. The hotel has free wi-fi Internet, serves great breakfasts and even provides free wine samples in the afternoons. We loved having our breakfasts in the garden patio. The location is also great as it is about 15-20 minutes from La Jolla and downtown San Diego. The only minor annoyances I have are the hotel charges you $20 per day for parking and the beach in front of the hotel has a lot of seaweeds. Other than that, weâ€™re extremely pleased and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: smtsmith
Reviews.Content: After looking for hotels in the SD area, we decided on Pacific Terrace, eventhough it was over priced, we wanted to enjoy the the beach instead of staying in downtown. The overall stay was "okay." The staff was very friendly, and the continental breakfast was alright, not great. What really bothered us, was the AC. My husband likes it very cool in our room, and the AC was not working properly, and it would get up to 82 degrees in the room. We called an had this worked on 3 times within 2 days. I would have appriceated if they offered to change the room, but they did not. The AC was still not working properly, upon our check out. We told the front desk upon check out what had happened during our stay, and she just smiled and said "sorry." Which leads me to beleive that this might be a common problem. I would expect staying at a pricey hotel, prolems like this would be handled better.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Southern California surf vibes”
Reviews.Author: Philgmanchesteruk
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have just returned from a 14 night stay at the Pacific Terrace and can truly say that in all aspects its the best in San Diego that we saw during our stay - Location/staff/rooms, all fantastic. We wanted a base that we could use as we checked out the San Diego scene, and we could'nt have chose better, the location of the hotel is probably the best if you want to be right on the beach and in the middle of a buzzing surf style community, with loads of bars, restaurants and shops all close by, the staff are very attentive and if you have any request or concern then they are prompt and efficient in sorting it out. The rooms are very nice (the beds are amazing) and our room # 319 had a fantastic view looking right onto the sea & beach, but if you sleep with the doors open the sound of the waves crashing can be really loud - that suited us fine, waking up and watching the surfers aleady out there, we even saw Dolphins one day. There are quite a number of homeless, but they never once bothered us or even acknowledged us in any way, they just keep themselves to themselves - we used the local bus service and also hired bikes to get about, did'nt want the hassle of hiring a car, and it was better we did'nt feel so restricted. Loved San Diego - for guaranteed sunshine and a safe and modern beach city - I'd recommed it to anyone, Were defo going back next year

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay”
Reviews.Author: equestrianesse
Reviews.Content: I will preface this review by explaining that we found a great rate on Orbits ($200 a night for ocean front) and then were upgraded to a Presidential Suite (which is usually $580 a night). I really enjoyed how friendly and helpful the staff were- it is quite common to deal with quite rude people, so I liked how nice everyone was. The room was beautiful, clean and spacious. I liked the jacuzzi tub very much, and the toiletries were amply replenished every day. No on-site restaurant, but we had a car and didn't want to stay at the hotel anyway. If you do not have a car, there are many restaurants in easy walking distance. The beach is right there. For those who complain that this isn't "beach front" as you have to walk down a couple steps, that seems a silly complaint to me. They can't help it that the beach is naturally lower than the land. It's nature, people. I am not sure what the previous reviewer meant about self-parking as we only saw a valet. It was $20, but we discovered that many hotels make you pay for parking when we stayed at a hotel that charged $30 the next weekend in LA. A very nice place, but I would not pay full price as it was not worth that much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: sawbo2
Reviews.Content: Hotel is indeed on the beach and we had a lovely view from our room. However lots of the rooms faced a really rough site - shed -like buildings and concrete. The room itself was clean and well laid out with a small balcony. The whole hotel (inside and out) is painted in a dreary khaki/olive paint which makes it look dull and hostel like. The pool is very small but looks out onto the ocean. The staff were all pleasant (bit put off when I saw Bell boy spitting!) and helpful. Our total stay cost $2559 for 4 nights which included $80 for parking (self parking!!) Parking at the Bellagio in Vegas was free so felt this was a bit steep! The area is ok but no nice restaurants nearby. More surfer type locale really. Breakfast is ok (not great) and no restaurant on site. Definitely way over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than I remember”
Reviews.Author: ebowen
Reviews.Content: Stayed the first week of August with my Mother and 5 year old nephew for a family vacation. Had stayed here many time in the past but it had been years. The last time I stayed it was in need of remodeling and boy did they. The room are completely remodeled...freshly painted, new furniture, large flat screen tv, etc. The grounds and location are beautiful as always. The exterior of the property has been painted and cleaned and looks modern. They also updated their patio furniture and added a beach bed. Can't beat this location on Pacific Beach...still love watching the surfers in the morning. Continental breakfast by the pool is complimentary and we very much enjoyed it every day. Cereal, fruit, breads, bagels, juices, hard-boiled eggs, etc. Room service is provided by a couple of local restaurants and was great. Concierge also did a great job of recommending some nice kid friendly restaurants. There is valet parking and underground parking for a daily fee. Overall, still a wonderful property. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Essexfamilyontour
Reviews.Content: The hotel has large and well equipped bedrooms - ours was a ground floor room and our doors opened out onto the pool terrace - noisy but nice nonetheless. 2 minutes to the oceanfront. Breakfast was very good. Valet parking efficient. I thought it was a bit expensive for what the hotel offered but I would not hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Pacific Beach!”
Reviews.Author: ryanwhite17
Reviews.Content: This was my newly wife and I's (we stayed at Pacific Terrace for our honeymoon) first time staying in San Diego and I couldn't have asked for better. Before we even got to the hotel the concierge went above and beyond my needs to make us happy and set everything for as soon as we got there. Once we got there we were met, as we were every other time during our stay, promptly and respectfully by the valet boy and the front desk personnel. Once we got to our room we were astonished by the effort they out into our room (I asked for a heart shaped rose on the bed and a cookie bouquet) and they threw in a free bottle of wine. They then called two times right away once we got to our room to check to see if we needed anything. They checked our room twice everyday, once in the morning and once for turn-down service. Every person there had a great attitude, smile on there face, and worked to ensure our gratification. The view and location couldn't have been better. Walking distance to anything and everything and the beach is right in front of you. When we left the hotel the car was already pulled in front, the valet came up to get our luggage and even placed water bottles in the car for us for the ride home. Definitely and HOME AWAY FROM HOME!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but worth it?”
Reviews.Author: Moirende
Reviews.Content: My wife, almost four year old daughter and I just got back from a week at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. We stayed in one of the "Family Suites" because we wanted a bit of a kitchen available so we didn't always have to feed our little girl restaurant food all the time. Here's what I liked about it: - If you want a "beach" holiday in San Diego, the hotel is perfectly located for that; its right there on a very nice one - The local area is great for walking around. Not a lot of high end restaurants, but quite a few mid-range / family friendly ones to choose from, all walking distance - Reasonable drive to Sea World, the Zoo, Old Town, downtown, etc. - Excellent front desk staff; always extremely helpful - Excellent room staff - Prepare to be surprised by how nice the furniture is. - LOVED the two 40" flat screen hi-def TVs with DVD's. Here's what was not so much: - Bell service... hmm... called for assistance with the inflatable sofa bed. No one ever came. My wife eventually figured it out. - Gave up on the valet parking by the end of the first day. There was NEVER anyone out front when we were coming and going, so we just got used to parking ourselves. - Last day wake up call... asked for 8:00am, got it at 8:18am. How hard is it to get that, of all things, right? Good thing we weren't in a hurry to catch our plane... this alone would make it impossible for me to ever consider staying here on a business trip - Standard collection of all the usual hotel annoyances... cracked wine glasses, sinks that don't drain properly (and the SMELL when they don't...), only tolerably clean carpet, one of the phones didn't work, yada yada yada. - The pool is definitely on the small side, and some days it was a challenge getting a lounger. In the end, while we enjoyed our stay there, we wouldn't go back. Or at least if we did, we wouldn't stay in the family suite, which cost us over $600 per night. At $100 - $200 per night sure, I'll put up with the little stuff, its kind of expected. But for $600 a night the whole experience should be top notch from start to finish, not just parts of it. Frankly, take away the super nice furniture and TVs and basically the average Marriott Suites is going to give you virtually the exact same experience... at a third the price.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, a bit over-priced”
Reviews.Author: DamLou
Reviews.Content: Booked here because of tripadvisor reviews. Not disappointed, but overall it is pricey for what you get. Pacific Beach area of San Diego is a laid-back and scenic extent of beach that doesn't suffer the pretentiousness of La Jolla, or the city feel of the San Diego centre. This is a small hotel with some great features, including: good breakfast included, great complimentary wines at 4pm daily, twice daily room service with turn-down service, sumptuous bath-robes provided in room, in-room fridge, huge TV, heated pool and plastic wind-barriers round the pool so even when a chill sea-breeze blows, it is hot sitting round the pool. Above all, it is located above a really attractive beach, and there is a great view of the sunset from the beach. However, parking is extra, a rollaway air-bed is extra, and the total cost is similar to a 5 star hotel, which is I think hard to justify. It is a compact hotel, and when busy, it can feel squashed with insufficient space around the pool..Hotel is in a "V" shape, with a south and a north wing. The South wing rooms get best views of ocean and sunset, and they get sun on the balcony, the north wing rooms don't, apart from the top floor. So ask to be in South wing if you like sun and sunsets, and north wing if you don't! Oh - really good Thai just around the corner, 5 mins away, cheap but really authentic taste. Glad I stayed there?- yes - But would I choose it again? - no.

Reviews.Title: “Echo the Great Reviews”
Reviews.Author: blynbrook
Reviews.Content: Booked the Pacific Terrace based on the reviews in this forum and was not disappointed. Great location, great views and great service. No need to add our own photos as the traveler photos cover everything very well. Before our stay at PTH , we stayed a few days ast Casa Del Mar in Santa Monica so PTH at first felt like a step down. They quickly won us over with their approach to service. The rooms are very nice, especially when you add the terrace with ocean view, pool and hot tub, free wine every day from 4-5, and the sunsets. Previous posters complained about the lack of a restaurant and that is a bit annoying. We found that that Pacific Beach is not a center of fine dining so you have to make the best of it. It's a beach community so expect mostly casual dining with many restuarants you can easily walk to. We liked the locations at both the Green Flash and Tower 23. Gringos has good Mexcican food and margaritas though it does not have an ocean view like the others. We loved the boardwalk that passes in front of the hotel. We walked it to the end at Mission Beach and loved the whole walk in the San Diego beautiful weather. Also made our way to Torrey Pines which is a great spot for hiking with great views. Will definitely be back at the Pacific Terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Choice”
Reviews.Author: MarcandCiara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace as part of our Highway 1 Honeymoon Road Trip. We booked online a few days before arriving on the strength of the reviews on this website and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is in a great location, right on the beach and on a quiet street but close enough to bars and restaurants to make going out for the evening without the car very easy - not always a given in the US. (Take your passport though, bars on Garner will only accept a passport as proof of age, drivers licence is not enough) The hotel staff we very pleasant and friendly and the rooms huge. Rooms were cleaned to perfection and the turndown service was a real treat - even got chocolates on our pillows! The afternoon wine reception was a welcome treat after a day's sightseeing and a day at Seaworld - nothing quite beats a glass of rose wine while soaking in a hot tub on the coast of the Pacific! I would absolutely recommend this hotel - look no further, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: dar362
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautiful hotel in awesome location right on the beach. We were on the 2nd floor with an ocean view room, the view was spectacular espeacially at sunset. What really makes this hotel special is the customer service. The staff goes above and beyond to make your stay here a special and memorable one. The nightly turndown service with the chocolates was something we looked forward to nightly. The daily wine and cheese sampling should not be missed. The staff here is superb and I will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but over-priced”
Reviews.Author: a visitor from ireland
Reviews.Content: This is everything that the other reviewers have written. Lovely sea views, nice beach, good staff, great rooms but a bit over-priced for what you get. For 550 dollars a night you would normaly get a hotel with more facilities and a bit of soundproofing (very thin walls made for disturbed sleep). Also the additional 20 dollars for parking and 55 dollars tax meant a whopping 625 dollars per night. However, the room was clean, comfortable with a fantastic view of the ocean. The wine at 4pm was a nice touch. Breakfast was basic, the pool area is nice. There are a lack of up-market restaurants nearby. Tower 23 is quite good but the rest seem to be very casual/family orientated.

Reviews.Title: “perfect beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: dianetauzer
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay for over a week at the Pacific Terrace Hotel while my son recovered from surgery. The staff was professional, courteous, helpful and very friendly. We had to extend our stay twice during the US Open . Not only did they graciously extend our stay but kept our rates (which were a special internet rate) the same. I was so pleased that we intend to return for vacation soon. The hotel has no bad rooms just better. The nonview rooms have some views. i would recommend the north side rooms if you have a choice. The breakfast is substantial and they serve Starbucks coffee. Many people grab food downstairs and eat it on their balconies. In the afternoon, they have a wine hour. The $20 parking fee is well worth it. Pacific Beach parking is some of the worst I have ever experienced. You can leave your car and get almost anywhere The boardwalk and beach are right there. You can easily walk to a number of different restaurants of varying prices and types. The downside was no hotel restaurant and even though they provide room service through nearby restaurants it sometimes was cold by the time we got it. Still, it was available. I have stayed at a number of 4 to 5 star hotels and found this to be the most enjoyable because of the staff and their attitudes. They seemed to honestly enjoy what they were doing and enjoyed seeing how well they could do and how they could make it better for you. I highly encourage anyone planning on staying in San Diego to give them a try. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: gjob
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace hotel was very good but expensive. I stayed in a suite which was brilliant apart from the fact that you can hear everything in the room next door. The decor was very good as was the room appointment with a beautiful balcony/view along the beach. It cost approx â‚¬1200 for our 3 nights stay which compared to every other hotel suites we stayed in California during our visit was excessive. There is no restaurant within the hotel so the continental breakfast was just ok, I would have expected more for the price.The staff however were very attentive & I could not fault them.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: Simon14
Reviews.Content: The PTH is everything that they say. Upon check in we were offered an upgrade to a ocean front room on the 2nd floor, which we took. I highly recommend taking the upgrade, if offered, it was worth it. We had a HUGE room with kitchen and lovely bathroom. Balcony faced the ocean, about 40 yards away. wonderful. The last couple of nights there, a large party booked the suite above us and at about 2 am. tramped around like a herd of elephants. The following night, the same issue, just starting at 9pm or so. I would recommend asking for a 3rd floor room to eliminate being effected by this sort of rudeness from other people who believe they are the only hotel guests that exist. The hotel was not at fault, but I mentioned it to the front desk upon check out and the upgrade fee was waived! Very nice! The front desk staff was very nice and do everything they can to make your stay pleasant. They go above and beyond at every opportunity. The neighborhood was not bad, no different then any other beach side community. Some homeless, but by far outnumbered by tourists and surfers. I would have felt safe staying there by myself. The garage is expensive, but worth it. I also would suggest getting tickets to the attractions at the front desk and saving the time in line at Seaworld, SD Zoo etc. . . . Go to La Jolla and check out the seals! It's a short 10 minute bike ride and really cool!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!! Above and beyond my expectations......”
Reviews.Author: IceCream30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Pacific Terrace Hotel on 6/6/08 in celebration of our anniversary. When researching hotels in the area, I came across a couple of travel sites with old outdated pictures, when I went directly to the hotels site, I was surprised at how lovely the rooms were. I called the hotel to confirm, that the pictures on their site were current, and I was told that all the rooms have been completely remodeled. I booked a partial view double bed room for 159.00 plus tax (what a bargain) since the price for that class room is normally 440.00 The only downfall was no king bed. I requested for for a room on the 3rd floor, I was told that they couldn't guarantee it, but that he would note that I am requested a room on the 3rd floor. After reading several reviews, I had mixed feelings, but it was really the only beachfront hotel I could find in the 200.00 price range, that looked maintained. The staff was super friendly, attentive and professional. I have never been to a hotel that every class (bellboy, front desk, house keeping, cafe, security) of employee was kind, courteous and willing to bend over backward to accommodate your needs. This hotel is VERY customer service orientated. Upon check in, I asked if they could accommodate us with a king bed, mentioned we were celebrating our anniversary (really tried). Unfortunately they were unable to do so, since they were completely booked. They were able to accommodate my request for the 3rd floor, as the view is so much nicer. Some reviewers complaining about the 20.00 underground parking, but the peace of mind is worth it, very safe, key access only, and direct access from hotel elevator. The room decor was very inviting and up to date. Nice dark solid wood beds, granite counter tops, marble bathroom, huge plasma TV, ipod player clock radio, snack bar, coffee maker, iron, blow dryer, safe. The room was immaculate, and well stocked with towels, comfy bathrobes, bath goods even q-tips & cotton balls. The beds were very comfortable, pillows were fluffy, the sheets were high thread count and super soft. The balcony was spacious, with 4 chairs and a table. Our room was facing South toward the pier, and it was an amazing view. I could have sat on that balcony our whole visit just listening to the waves crash and people watched. There was a little parking lot below our balcony, that was normally occupied by surfers. I had a blast watching the surfers change in and out of wetsuits in the parking lot, lol. It was a little noisy at times (car alarms, beeping delivery trucks, ice cream truck) but I didn't mind, I liked all the action. I do have to say that there were quiet allot of homeless people in this area (most beach areas are this way), but I never felt unsafe or threatened in anyway as they just mind thier own business. Lots of restaurants, clubs and shopping on Garnet which is about a 3 block walk. This area is populated by allot of young college students, majority is 25 and under. There were a few nicer restaurants like Jordan at Tower 23 hotel which is 2-3 hotels down from PTH that had a more mature crowd 30 and over. It's definatley a lively happening area, which my husband and I enjoy. We live in Los Angeles so we are used to this type of atmosphere, it might be a little shocking to people who are not accustomed to this. Beach access is super close and easily accessed through the pool area which is accessed with your room key. We didn't use the pool/spa, but it looked really nice, heated, ton of towels and lounge chairs. I did notice allot of families on the lower level and pool are which is were the family suites are located. Which might be a little odd if you are there for a romantic getaway or honeymoon. Some little perks that make ALL the difference in feeling pampered........... Free iced tea, lemonade, Starbucks coffee (self serve) Basket of apples and fresh baked cookies in the lobby Free wine from 4-5PM in the cafe (self serve) Turn-down service, with Belgium chocolates on your pillow Basket of towels in front of every room in the morning Continental breakfast included I was expecting danishes, cereal and fruit, but the variety was impressive. 5-6 different types of pastries and muffins Bagels, croissants, english muffins (variety of cream cheeses, jams, peanut butter) Fresh fruit, variety of melons, oranges, apples, bananas Variety of hot and cold cereals Boiled eggs Yogurt Starbucks coffee, Tazo teas, Juices, milk The dining area seats about 15, but there are several tables right outside the cafe around the pool or you can get a tray and take your food to your room. If you really want to be pampered, for 12.00 you can put in a request the night before to have breakfast delivered to your room. I myself, got a tray and took it up to my room and enjoyed breakfast on the balcony watching the sun come up. This hotel went above and beyond my expectations, I will definatley be visiting PTH on a regular basis when I need to getaway with my hubby. Hopefully I can get a budget friendly rate again in the future, because $440 is a little steep. The only thing I disliked was the early check out time of 11:00am. I have stayed at allot of hotels and resorts, and I can confidently say that this was one of my best experiences. So go ahead and BOOK IT!!!! ENJOY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: racecargirl911
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed the weekend in this hotel had a great time, I have stayed here before with my boyfriend so I kinda knew what to expect and I was excited to stay here again. Pacific Terrace is such a cute Boutique hotel. We had a ocean front Jr suite and the room was great as well as the view. The weather was amazing. The belIboy/valet was super friendly and nice the whole time. The hotel doesnt have a restaurant but they have room service from nearby restuarants and it was pretty good and pretty quick. The free breakfast they have in the morning is better than most hotels that offer the same kind of thing, lots of variety. Over all, I really like most everything about this hotel and I will be definitely be back sooner than later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZN8TIV
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute book but so glad we did it. The hotel is in a perfect spot away from most of the crowded beachstrand of Pacific Beach. It literally is on a bluff overlooking the ocean and within 30 yards of the stairs to take you down below to the sand. The check in process what very easy and best of all the hotel has underground parking for a stressfree nightsleep. They have a nice little wine hour and free continental breakfast. There's no shortage of towels and the landscaping for a small property is lush and inviting. Hopefully some of my pictures will convey the boutique atmosphere and the closeness to the coast. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice extras”
Reviews.Author: Familiafour
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this hotel, at the last minute, based on Tripadvisor reviews. We were very happy with our stay. The hotel had great staff, from the bellhop/valet to front desk staff, to the buffet helpers. Their advice on what to do in San Diego was right on. We stayed in an ocean view room on the top floor. The rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious with a great flat screen TV and turn down service available. Bathroom was clean and modern. Outside the door in the morning was a basket of extra towels if we wanted it! The staff printed out our boarding passes for our flight the next day and printed out mapquest directions to a restuarant of our choice. By the way "The Fishery" was close by, casual, moderately priced and a great choice for seafood. Wish we could have stayed longer. We had the breakfast buffet, that is included in the room price, which was adequate with a lot of fresh fruit, baked goods, cereals and Starbucks and staffed by two ladies. It is a small, well run hotel. Good view of the beach. Short walk down some stairs to get to the beach. We loved the personal attention we got from the staff. Thank you to Laura, Kevin, Chris and Cindy!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for seeing San Diego with 2 kids”
Reviews.Author: Mayadog
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (two boys age 7 and 9) recently stayed at this hotel and loved it! We loved the location and found it easy to get to all of our destinations---Legoland, Seaworld, Zoo etc. Staff was very helpful. Rooms were very nice, breakfast was more than adequate but the locations made it for us. We watched dolphins and surfers from our room and were able to walk to a variety of good restaurants. I was also very impressed with how quiet the hotel was each night. Despite a full-house, including a packed room of Bachelorette party girls across the hall, we had a good night sleep every night. We kept the sliding door open and could hear waves crashing. The concierge service was nice and helpful but we were usually able to get better rates at the attraction (particularly Legoland) with our AAA card. Don't miss the Scripts Aquarium! Our kids loved it and it was an easy drive through cool La Jolla to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Terrific Staff”
Reviews.Author: zanemacc
Reviews.Content: Pacific Terrace Hotel far surpassed our expectations. The room was very nice and spacious. We booked a "non-view" room and to our surprise, the staff gave us a "partial view" room at no extra charge. There was always someone to hold a door, provide towels while we sat in the jacuzzi during a rain shower, and help make the entire stay very pleasant. This hotel provides true "service with a smile". Everything we needed was either provided by the hotel or just a short walk away. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be treated like their comfort and needs are truly important.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: rachaar
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely beautiful hotel with an incredibly helpful and friendly staff. Other than two people in a major fistfight in the apartment complex across the street while we were checking in (which of course was not the hotel's fault) everything was absolutely perfect. My husband was able to upgrade our room from a 2-queen room to a king bed ocean-view junior suite for only $25 more a night four days before we arrived for our honeymoon. My parents (unbeknownst to us) called a few days before our arrival to order a gift basket to be placed in the rooms for us newlyweds and said that the people they chatted with were wonderful. We couldn't have been happier, and when we got to our next hotel in Anaheim for the second leg of our trip, although it was theoretically a fancier hotel we really longed for the Pacific Terrace. We will definitely come back here when we return to San Diego. I will say one little thing - we were really surprised by how many families with young kids were staying in the hotel and swarming around the pool. The pool does have very limited adults-only hours but other than that, tons of kids. This isn't really a complaint, we were just a little surprised that a place like this was such a family destination. It was a little jarring on our honeymoon :)

Reviews.Title: “The Pacific Terrace has it all!”
Reviews.Author: kyroby
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I recently stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel and truly LOVED it! The staff was TOP notch and went above and beyond for us. You really feel like more than a room number at this hotel and that is a compliment to every member of the staff. The hotel itself was gorgeous too and the location was terrific-right on the beach. We loved it and should we ever travel to the San Diego area again we will most certainly be staying at the Pacific Terrace!!

Reviews.Title: “How is this the #1 hotel on TripAdvisor ??”
Reviews.Author: stevewynnerival
Reviews.Content: I honestly cannot understand how this is the #1 rated hotel in San Diego on TripAdvisor. It's incredibly over-rated and very expensive for what is a 3* motel with a great looking pool and sea view. The rooms are floral-themed circa 1978 and are in drastic need of updating. The wash basin is in the room itself which isn't great. The toilet and shower over the bath (which again is like a motel bathroom) are off the room separately. The "free" breakfast is served in pokey, dark room just off the pool - and you have to walk through it to get the pool. Breakfast is cereals, some bagels, bananas, apples and juice so don't get too excited. The pool is nice enough though smoking is allowed and with kids around, not brilliant. There is no pool service for drinks or food. There is some free wine for an hour in the afternoon but no great shakes. There is no restaurant - but there are restaurants locally who will deliver. There is free parking within walking distance of the hotel but it is limited - it's there though. Noise-wise, you can hear other balconies and because the area overlooking the pool is half-moon shaped, can be quite loud, although my 3-year old slept through soundly. For the price, this hotel (motel) is hilariously expensive. It hasn't had much competition in the past, but with hotels like Tower 23 springing up (2 minutes walk from the Pacific Terrace and better in almost every way) I hope they will have to reconsider their proposition. If you think you're going to get a great hotel because of the rate, you won't. But if you're happy with a good motel that has a pool and view and you think it's worth $350+ then book away !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience in California”
Reviews.Author: purpletrippy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this establishment in April of 2007, and had a great time here. The staff was attentive and offered help at every possible juncture. They gave us excellent recommendations for restaurants in the area and the hotel was quite lovely. I have found that a lot of the time when looking for hotels they can be all the same with the price all over the map, and this one was on the more expensive side. I do think Pacific Terrace was worth the money and we are planning another trip back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: tikisuz
Reviews.Content: This was the most romantic place I've been in a long time. The hotel is right off the water, the staff treat you like royalty and overall the experience is just amazing. It's almost too good to be real. Free internet? Free breakfast? What's the catch, right? The answer is no catch, this is just a good quality hotel that might be "rated" 3-4 stars but treats you more like a 5 star. It's like the Ritz Carlton on a budget (even if it's not that cheap). Will try to stay here every time I can on future trips to San Diego. I travel here at least 4 times a year and this is by far the best place I've found with the Southern California vibe and access to restaurants, beaches and bars.

Reviews.Title: “has gone dowhill”
Reviews.Author: shannpann
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times over the past two years and I am sad to say that it has gone downhill. Two years ago I thought that I had found a gem and was nervous to even tell friends as I wanted to keep the secret to myself. My last stay was a week ago and I booked a partial ocean view for two nights. I knew that the rooms are rarely ready before 4pm so did not bother checking in until my conference was over for the day. Upon check in I was shown where my room assignment was and asked if there were any other rooms (I knew this one was not optimal). The gentleman at the desk told me that they were entirely sold out - he assured me that I would like the room. Needless to say, the room was not acceptable. It was directly over the lobby of the hotel and essentially faced the street with a street light shining in to the room and cars parked behind it. When I called and said that this was not what I had expected - he asked in a snippy voice "can you see the ocean?" to which I replied " not really, there is a light glaring into the room". I told him that I would prefer to check out than stay in this room and then magically there was another room. Both days that I went to the pool there were no towels for the beach or for the pool (only a pile of used towels). In fact, I stood next to a soaking wet man in the lobby the second morning as there were no towels at the pool so he was going back to his room to dry off. The "breakfast buffett" is in a small room that feels rather dirty - you can get a tray and bring items to your room which I recommend. The rooms are still nice although do not feel quite as pristine and new as they did 1-1/2 years ago. I agree with the reviewer who stated that if you have a car, you are roped in to the $20 parking fee as there is sparse overnight parking around the hotel. I am not sure that I will stay here again - would probable consider renting a beachhouse if I needed to be by the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace Hotel is Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: reagpCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the Trip Advisor's ratings and I found this hotel to be extremely over-rated. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary after several years of marriage and were looking for something different and romantic as my wife would say. I am an appraiser by profession, so I may be a little more critical in my observations. If you like a noisy beach location then this is your place. The hotel is on the beach boardwalk and lies between two feeder streets that lead to the beach. It has underground parking which is another $20 for each night. Considering the amount of beach traffic you really have no other alternative, but to pay the extra $20 for parking so factor that into your costs. We asked for a partial ocean view to take advantage of the beach location and yet to be a little more economical then the very expensive beach front location, but one had to be on the balcony to see the partial view. What was really annoying is that you were directly facing one of the streets I refer to. If you don't mind being bothered at 6 AM by people arriving at the beach then your OK, but like us, we like the slider or window ajar to get fresh air during the night when sleeping. There is late and early traffic on the streets and since the hotel is only 3 stories high you are going to be relatively close to the noisy streets regardless of which floor you are on. We were on the 2nd floor. One noise that could have been avoided is the hotel Help early in the morning. I didn't understand a word they said, but all I know is that there was one hotel worker that appeared to be in charge of the others and she was doing a lot of yelling to her subordinates in the hallway. The doors were not well insulated and we did complain to the hotel about their Help being too loud in the early mornings. The rooms were appointed rather comfortably, however, the large frame beds did make it more difficult to enter the beds, especially if you have small children or older adults who will find it difficult to climb into and out of the beds. Even exiting the beds we were hitting our shins, because the frames came up so high from the floor. Like many hotels, these beds had colorful tropical bed spreads that I would never sit on or lay on and it is obvious these bed spreads are not washed on a daily basis like the sheets are changed. The floors seemed clean and they did provide new slippers, but the slippers were one size fits all and if you wear an 11 shoe like I do then forget it. The bathroom was OK. Only one sink and the water pressure was normal. The bath tub is enclosed with a double glass doors with seals at the bottom of the doors that did not seal and if you took a shower there was more than just a pool of standing water when you exited. We had to use several towels to soak up the water and we also reported this to the hotel, because we thought it would create mold and moisture problems in the walls. The room had other features, like a small refrigerator, microwave, a small wet bar and a big screen TV. There was a hair dryer, a lighted magnifying mirror and ironing equipment. They did provide terrycloth robes that were available for purchase. One feature they did have that was upscale and that my wife enjoyed was the Gilchrist and Soames body bath soaps and cremes. On the other hand, however, what may be a little embarrassing if you are sharing a room with non-intimate guest is using the bathroom. The bath fan was too small and inadequate to ventilate the bathroom odors that penetrated to the entire room immediately. This is a design flaw in the original construction. There is no restaurant in the building, but they do provide a continental breakfast from 6:30 to 10:00 AM. in the exit room to the pool area. There is also Starbucks coffee provided all day that were in dispensors near the pool area. One evening they did have some complimentary inexpensive wines available for tasting in the late afternoon near the pool/patio area. There is a considerable amount of local shopping stores and small fast food local-owned and chain restaurants , but if you want any real fine dining you will need a vehicle to travel up to La Jolla, which is the adjacent city, which is approximately 5 miles north. Our partial ocean view room was $330 and tax was $41.25, parking $20 for a total of $391.25 per night. This price in my opinion is far too much for the accommodations that we had and for that reason and the others mentioned above this hotel is over-rated with Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “not as expected”
Reviews.Author: KenoraMmmm
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of good reviews on this site and expedia. Spent the time to call and book from Canada. Told the front desk we were travelling with friends with children and our child and would like rooms close by. Rooms were not ready when we got there.Also were on different floors. Had asked for 2 beds. Got a room with one bed and a pull out couch. For some strange reason the carpets had been cleaned were VERY wet and a noisy utility fan was running on the floor. To dry it out I guess. The room smelled like a hockey bag. Back to the front desk I went. I should also mention that at check in, the man at the front desk assured me I would be "So happy with our room as the managers had just done a walk through". VERY insincere. Back at the desk the man tells me there aren't any other rooms. So weary were we from travelling and with kids that just wanted to go swimming, we begrudgingly accepted the room (at $400 for that night; our one night in San Diego). That night we tried to sleep...all 3 of us in one bed because the pull out was hard as a rock. We could not open the sliding door to air out the smell of wet dirty socks because we were on the ground floor and were worried about someone breaking into our room in the night. I wrote a letter to the management at about midnight or 1 AM because I couldn't believe how ripped off I felt. It's really too bad that we weren't offered a different room or to even pay for an upgrade. Which we would of accepted. It is a nice little hotel, right on the beach. The boardwalk is right there. The pool is very small. but nice. I'm sure that if our room would have been what we had been expecting we would have been happy. I just couldn't sleep wondering what had happened in that room to make them clean the carpets??? The carpets had not been cleaned in our friends room...so it wasn't like they had done the whole building. (You know that creepy crawly feeling) I'm not sure if I will ever get the chance to go back to San Diego, but I would like to. It is a beautiful city. I would not stay at this hotel again. I feel I was lied to. I would like to note that I was contacted by management after my return home and was credited part of my payment. Unfortunately I expect that at a Hotel of this caliber, the problem should have been dealt with properly and honestly, from the begining.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Happymomma
Reviews.Content: Our family of five, including three kids ages 10, 8, and 6, just returned from four nights' stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. What a gem. The pool is warm (good since we had cooler weather), beach is lovely, view from room (we had a jr. suite with premium ocean view on 3rd floor) is beautiful, breakfasts balanced with something for everyone, plus friendly staff, convenient location... no complaints except that it is indeed expensive. That said, we would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the rating of #1”
Reviews.Author: mcclungp
Reviews.Content: Pacific Terrace lives up to the hype with fantastic service, personal attention, great rooms, and beautiful setting. At checkin, even though I was there late they brought a glass of wine to the room. You can hear the waves outside of the room. I had a "partial view" room, which opened onto the terrace with a huge area terrace for my room that then went into the pool. Beautiful walking all around the hotel, and the restaurants around and recommended were superb.

Reviews.Title: “awesome boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: kansasbird
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Diego area where my family had a reunion at the Pacific Terrace Hotel in Pacific Beach. From the initial reservation to check out, it was overall a terrific experience. The staff is friendly, responsive and competent. The rooms are all a little unique, but each one was very nice- elegant furniture, excellent LG flat screen, great views of the ocean. The concierge was extremely helpful with local restaurants, caterers, attractions, etc. Our entire family of 27 guests in 12 rooms all agreed it was absolutely perfect for our group. The teenagers were able to walk around and have freedom and it felt very safe. There is no on-site restaurant, but plenty in walking distance, and the staff will go get food from area restaurants if you wish. Enjoyed the free breakfast bar of a variety of pastries, fruit, yogurt, juices, coffee, etc. A complimentary wine bar was set up by the pool daily, cookies and fruit at the front desk. Just a very relaxing, beautiful, unpretentious place to chill. We'll definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: welovetravel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week trip to Southern California. After reading the wonderful reviews of the Pacific Terrace Hotel, we decided to spend the first half of our trip here. We were not disappointed. Everything was wonderful from the location to the staff to the beautiful rooms. I have to stay that this is one of the few hotels where I feel the hotel's photos don't do the actual rooms justice. We had booked a oceanfront junior suite. We were offered an upgrade to a master suite for a bit more money. After seeing both rooms, both of which were beautiful, we opted for the master suite because of the separate bedroom which was convenient when our little one went to bed at 8 or 9pm. It was a beautiful room with two oceanfront balconies, 3 flat screen HDTVs (including one above the jacuzzi tub), a small breakfast bar with microwave and fridge and a small dining room table. The attention to detail really made this hotel special. Everything from the bathrobes and slippers to the little stepstool in the washroom so our son could reach the sink to wash his hands and brush his teeth. There were even lovely jars of bath salts left next to the jacuzzi tub which we thoroughly enjoyed. The basket of towels in front of our door in the mornings was a nice surprise. My son loved the little chocolates left on our pillows each night. The rooms were very tastefully done with California shutters instead of the usual nasty hotel drapes. Beds were very very comfortable. My only complaint, and it really is a petty one, is that there was no freezer in the fridge. But it was not a huge deal as the wonderful staff offered to put our frozen foods and ice packs in their hotel freezer for us. Just a minor inconvenience as someone had be sent to fetch our things each day. Again like I said, a petty complaint. The continental breakfast was a nice bonus, and the food was fine - muffins, danishes, bagels and some fruit. We were never around to enjoy the afternoon wine and cookies, but appreciated the ice tea, lemonade and Starbucks coffee available throughout the day. I love boutique style, small and elegant hotels. This one definitely fits the bill. It is easily one of my new favourite places to stay and I would definitely return the next time I am in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: zman-nh
Reviews.Content: The view, the room, the location, the comfortable bed-----all perfect! This is absolutely a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “You SHOULD stay here”
Reviews.Author: hcrMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite and had friends who stayed in a room with 2 queen beds. Both rooms were superb, clean, and equipped with fridges. The front desk staff, anyone with whom we interacted, was pleasant and helpful. The pool was clean and WARM! The hot tub was clean and HOT! Enjoy the wine tastings, advice for local restaurants and places to go. I am happy to be more specific for you via email.

Reviews.Title: “Brief stay, but loved every second!”
Reviews.Author: FlipperGirl
Reviews.Content: While we only stayed here for just one night, my boyfriend and I really enjoyed staying at this lovely hotel in Pacific Beach and would stay here again in a heartbeat. It is one of the nicest rooms I've had in a hotel. I don't know what he paid for the room, but he's a great guy. He reserved us one of the King-suite ocean front rooms. It was pretty much in the center of the hotel (kind of shaped like a horseshoe a bit) and I think we had room 316. The balcony was nice sized and felt fairly private even though it overlooked the pool and deck, which is just off the main beach path running throughout PB. We slept with the door wide open at night to the sound of the crashing waves of the ocean. But, it also came with a price. Staff moving deck chairs around in the morning (6 am?) by the pool dragging the metal legs along the concrete as well as a bunch of Marines on their early morning and loud cadence jog. But, did i mention the waves? ;-) The room had gorgeous furniture (a REAL entertainment unit) a huge wide screen LG HD TV, a comfortable bed, enough tables and sitting areas to be comfortable, and lovely decor. The room is decorated throughout with dark wood working such as the crown molding and plantation shutters covering the slider door (no cheesy curtains!). It's very warm, relaxing, and tropical feeling and was reminiscent of a model home in a new housing community. The bathroom consisted of a large wide area near the door with the closet and a nice sink and countertop. One of my few complaints was the screw for the hot water knob was stripped and kept falling off it's base knob. The toliet and tub/shower are in a closed room. The main room had a huge granite counter/bar near the small kitchen area (honor bar, small fridge, microwave). We didn't need any of that (except for the $6 Amstels). Everything was clean, new, and seemed recently painted. My only major complaints are with the towels, they were not that plush or high-end comparing it to the rest of the room's offerings. Robes were provided, though. Also, the pillows on the bed were not that nice (we grabbed two more from the closet). They could use some plusher, down or feather nicer pillows. -The staff are super friendly. -You have to pay for parking in their private garage underneath the building. -We ordered room service which comes from one of two off-site local restaurants (Hennesey's was one). The food was just ok and not that worthy at all of being 5 star (like typical bar food). Too bad they don't have a better restaurant/room service on site. -Location is great, near lots of restaurants, the beach, convenience stores, etc. Though I've never stayed in PB during the high season, it was nice there mid-week in March. Read my other reviews; i'm stingy with the "5 stars". I think this place is really 4.5 on my typical scale, but I'll bump it up to 5. It was the decor and the ocean front....plus I stay in a lot of hotels and this one is just very unique and nice for not being a national high-end hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: OralRobert33
Reviews.Content: The wife and I found this place on the internet and decided to give it a try. I don't think I've ever stayed at a more enjoyable place. We booked one of the ocean view rooms and the view was fantastic. The room was clean, free wine every afternoon--what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a hotel”
Reviews.Author: TXScott
Reviews.Content: I have to have strong feelings one way or another about something - good or bad- to take the time to write a review. This was possibly the best hotel experience I've ever had! I've stayed in fancier hotels, but the overall experience (value for the money, service, comfort, etc) was fantastic. The staff couldn't have been more pleasant or helpful. We were always greeted with a smile and a hello, and they took care of everything we needed promptly. The wine reception was a nice touch, and the continental breakfast is convenient (nothing spectacular). As for the room - beds were VERY comfortable. I'm a light sleeper and can usually only sleep well in my own bed. The only thing I found less than stellar with the room was the smallish size of the tub / shower. Also, we stayed in a premium ocean view room, and I highly recommend spending the extra $$ for one. Fantastic view. Also, it gives you some distance from the pool. There were a couple of kids that were in the pool all day and were pretty loud. We left our balcony door open so we could hear the ocean, which was great, but we could still hear the kids too as a result. I'm glad we weren't on the pool level! We didn't rent a car, but probably should have. The only cab company that didn't rob us blind getting around town was Silver Cab, so they get a free plug from me. Be sure to stop by Hennessey's up the street for lunch. The bleu cheese & bacon burger was the best one I'd had in a while.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Amazing Experience.”
Reviews.Author: OttawaDevine
Reviews.Content: I also had a wonderful stay at this hotel. I did base my choice on the tripadvisor reviews and was not dissapointed. The hotel staff all very friendly and accomodating. The hotel itself is very clean, which is my number 1 concern in staying at any hotel. The rooms also very clean and our suite was beautifully decorated and spacious. Comfortable beds in the room. Adequate air conditioning and heating as well. The views of the ocean are amazing and equally beautiful are the sunsets. Free Wireless Internet Access. They also have dimmers on the lights in the vanity area which serves as a nice nightlight. The suites include a microwave and fridge and cuttlery, plates, wine glasses. Just enough if you have a quick snack in your room. They also provide a wine list and a mini bar is available. It was a very nice touch to have a happy hour pool side.The pool was also heated and a Jacuzzi is also onsite. It was cleaned daily and they did a great job. The hotel is on the beach, a mere 5 minute walk ( slow walk). There are a number of restaurants in the area. We only had 2 days and therefore tried only a small sample.
