There is a great Thai place about 5 minutes down the main street on the right hand side that is amazing! There is also a Dennys for all of you with children who want a family restaurant that is close by. Filippi's Pizza Grotto is disgusting and I would recommend staying away from this place. The food has no flavour and the service matches the food, simply terrible. The firehouse and eggery are also two other good choices. You can walk to many of the restaurants in the area. There is a preffered car available at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of ocean view family rooms”
Reviews.Author: gwants
Reviews.Content: The family ocean view rooms are very dissapointing ,no view of the ocean .The rooms are situated on the corners of the hotel building on the ground floor,So the view is of shrubs and a public footpath.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: jenny277
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace in San Diego from 2-2-08 through 2-6-08. I have to say that this hotel is the cleanest beach hotel I have every stayed in. We had an ocean view room. It was a little smaller than I expected, but the view was absolutely beautiful. The maid service cleans your room twice a day: once in the morning, and once in the evening for turn down service. They do a great job. We brought our two toddlers and they brought their stuffed animals. The kids were so happy when we came back to our room at night to find our bed turned down, and their little stuffed animals propped up on pillows next to chocolates. The entire staff was very nice. I read reviews about them being so young, which is true, they were all young, but they were all very knowledgable, professional and exceptionally helpful. The continental breakfast was very good, and it was great to have fresh Starbucks coffee, tea, lemonade and iced water available all day long. Overall, our experience with this hotel was great. I only have one thing that I would warn about. The preferred driver service for the hotel. First, I want to say that Carlos was a very nice man. He was very insightful about San Diego, and told us about the best places for food and sight seeing. We spoke with the driver before we booked his service. He said he would have a car seat for us, and we do not need to bring one. When he picked us up from the airport, he came early and was in a very clean, beautiful car, but the car seat was only an infant carrier. Needless to say, I couldnt fit either of my children in it, so I had to buckle them in and pray to God that our ride would be short. Carlos does not use turn signals. Nor does he turn his head to check traffic before switching lanes or come to slow stop at traffic lights. We had planned on using him for all of our excursions, but after the ride from the airport, I was too afraid to use him. We didnt reserve a rental because we had everything planned out with the driver service. We called cab services in San Diego, but none had car seats available. We ended up taking a bus to Sea World. On the bus were a couple of local homeless people. We walked everywhere else. It rained all day on Sunday, and we were stuck inside the hotel with nothing to do but watch tv. It is not entirely Carlos' fault. He said that he had a car seat that we could use during our stay if we used his service, but he didnt know how big our kids were. When we asked him if he had a different car seat, he told us that was all he had. My very strong advice is to rent a car with car seats, or bring your own if you plan on traveling with your small children.

Reviews.Title: “will recommend to everyone”
Reviews.Author: coacheswifeOregon
Reviews.Content: We just returned from seven nights at this hotel. We traveled with our three children and all of us loved our time there. We have told everyone they have to stay here when in San Diego! The hotel is small, yet very nice, and close to everything.; Seaworld, La Jolla, and convenient to get to I-5. The beach is great-and easy to get to. Breakfast was great, wine between 4-5 pm, extra towels and chocolate every evening, and the pool was almost as warm as the hot tub! Our view was great of the beach and boardwalk, I believe every room has a view of either the beach, the pool, or both. Staff was extra friendly and accomodating!! We will stay here again everytime we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Ocean Front Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bruiserjohnson
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel in San Diego right on the beach! I have a 2 year old and it was perfect to walk down to the beach or swim in the heated pool in January. I am not a cold person and even though it was only in the 60's you could definately swim! We were upgraded to a junior suite with a partial ocean view for a small fee (I think like $20). We stayed in room 302 and it had a beautiful view of the coastline. The balcony doors you could leave open and listen to the waves. The hotel has several restaurants that deliver to the hotel. Gringo's is a really good! Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Great stay and we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Pacific Terrace Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sanddunegirl
Reviews.Content: We just got back from this hotel and had a great time! We stayed in a Partial ocean view room with 2 queen beds. They had a 42" plasma tv with HD channels and an ipod adaptable stereo. There were a few things missing though. There was no mirror in the bathroom (there was on with a sink outside the bathroom) and there was no hair dryer. I do agree with other reviews that you can hear people out in the hall. We could also hear the people above us get up at 3 am to feed their baby. Otherwise we had a great expeirence. The view was wonderful (ask for the South side of the hotel) and the breakfast was pretty good as long as you take it back to your room and watch the ocean while eating. The staff treated us well and even recommended we use thier preffered driver to get to the airport. It was 10 dollars cheaper than a cab and we were driven in a black mercedes. I would and have already recommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: kristianjeffrey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in lots of places around the world including the 7 star burj al arab in dubai, they have nothing on this hotel. One word says it all: perfect

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ATravelerMidwest
Reviews.Content: Having read previously posted reviews on Trip Advisor and other travel websites I booked this hotel. The reviews were factual and I loved my stay at this hotel. It was perfect for all of my/our needs. The location is great as it is situated on the Pacific Beach boardwalk. The hotel pool overlooks the Pacific Ocean and you can listen to the sounds of the ocean as you drift to sleep at night and at sunrise you can enjoy the view as well as the surfers. Picture perfect! The hotel is a small boutique hotel with a friendly and helpful staff. It does not have a restaurant on site but there are many casual and more upscale dining within walking distance of the hotel. A short walk (1-2 blocks) on the boardwalk will take you to the surfer community of Pacific Beach with all the restaurants and shops. The hotel offers a free morning breakfast in the breakfast room. It was nice and everyone seemed to enjoy it. If you want a hot breakfast then you can order room service or walk to nearby breakfast restaurants as there are several options. The rooms are clean, well taken care of and the furniture, wall hangings, plantation shutters and other extras make your stay at The Pacific Terrace one to remember. Throughout the day the hotel staff sets out for the guests (without charge) iced tea, lemonade, cold water, hot water, teas, coffees, fruit and cookies. Also, a wine reception at 4:00 and on Friday cheese and crackers. There is a small gift shop, small gym, concierge service and each floor has a computer so that the guests may check e-mails or print boarding passes. For a fee you may park underground of the hotel, park free on the street or you can catch a bus (1 block) or take a bus to a Trolley station. The location is near downtown, Gaslight Distrist, Old Town and La Jolla. The twice daily maid service, nightly turn down service with chocolates, fresh towels waiting outside your door in a basket, terry white robes, pool towels, and other extras makes me want to return to this hotel when I am in the San Diego area again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel! Great for Families.”
Reviews.Author: 2001elan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay (1/1/08-1/3/08) at this great hotel. I traveled with my husband and 6 yr old son. The previous reviews are very accurate. There is just nothing negative to say about this place. I am a perpetual complainer and even I have to zip my lip on this one! The staff are great, the rooms are great. The continental breakfast is great, the pool is great. The location is outstanding. Other things to mention. They have a small work out room in the garage. It has a treadmill, elyptical and weights. All new with 3 flat screen TV's. Small but adequate. The hotel is situated on a bike path. Bring your bike, roller blades or jog. It is wonderful. Lots of bike rental places around. $10 for the day. Good restaurants to walk to (3-6 blocks). We loved Karinya Thai [-]. We sat on pillows on the floor. Great food and fun for the kid. Lots of options to eat on Garnet Ave. Sushi, Fatburger, Denny's, Japanese. Lots of Mexican food places on every corner. Parking off season is easy. There is plenty of free street parking. I assume during the Summer you will need to shell out $20 per day to park in the underground hotel lot. The 4-5pm wine and cookies are great. The heated pool is great even in the middle of the Winter. The beach location is the best in San Diego. The Jr Suite room has a fridge, coffee maker and microwave. Dishes, glasses and silverware too. Trader Joes is a few blocks away. Ralph's Supermarket is also a few blocks away. You can pick up tons of yummy frozen goodies and nuke them as needed. I booked directly through the hotel and obtained a $149 garden view per night rate. I showed them proof of a free oceanview upgrade from another website and they honored it. They have AAA and Gov't employee rates as well. You can't go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Czarmomma
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel room on short notice based on customer reviews and proximity to the ocean. Wanted to be able to walk to the beach with my kids. There is no way I could have been happier with my stay. The hotel looks like it was recently remodeled and everything is beautiful. The room was gorgeous and the balconey had a perfect unobstructed view of the ocean. My kids fell asleep to the sound of the waves. The staff was exceptional, even calling the room to make sure we were settled and everything was to our satisfaction. Turn-down service and chocolates. Huge fresh basket of towels by the door in the morning - without even having to ask for them. Wonderful breakfast selection. Pool right above the beach so you could see and hear the ocean while you swim. Free parking. GREAT GREAT GREAT Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: minottraveler
Reviews.Content: I took my son on a special Mom and son vacation for a week in August. I had fallen in love with San Diego on a short trip there in June and just HAD to go back. (So much to do, not enough time to do it.) Our previous visit, my husband, son, and I had stayed at Paradise Point hotel. Enjoyed it, but wanted something right on the ocean this time. (Our suite there was on the water, but the "water" was the BAY, and I didn't know that at the time of booking. Still a BEAUTIFUL view of the bay though.) After much research, I chose Pacific Terrace hotel for this trip. As far as I can tell, this is about as close to the beach as you can get in San Diego. (if there are any luxury hotels located directly on the beach, I'd sure love to hear about them) Pacific Terrace is up on a bluff, so do be aware that you have to traverse a rather long flight of stairs from the boardwalk down to the beach. And they seem to be twice as long when you have to climb back up them at the end of the day. That did hamper us a tiny bit as we found ourselves to be quite lazy, but it probably saved us from a worse sunburn than we already got. We spent a lot of time body boarding and just playing in the water. GREAT waves, and very attentive lifeguards. Nice beach with a great view in both directions. A cool pier just to the south and La Jolla to the north. Planes flying overhead with advertisments streaming behind them. Very much the California beach scene. I do have to say though, I liked the Mission Beach area of the boardwalk better than this area, probably because there were no bluffs separating the beach from the boardwalk and all the action. We stayed in a junior suite with a king bed. My son stayed on the sofa (which had a pullout bed he never used) and I had a huge, very comfortable bed all to myself. Loved the room. Beautiful, classy, dark wood furniture, and a very large kitchenette with a breakfast bar. Very clean and comfortable. Our suite was on the ground/pool level. I had asked for a suite as close to beach access as possible, but ended up right in the middle of the hotel with the pool between us and the boardwalk. Turns out, being on the ground floor was not a plus, given the fact that we had to take so many stairs down to the beach anyway, what's a few more inside the hotel? My view of the ocean was minimal so I was a bit disappointed with that. Next time I will request a suite on either the far north or south side of the hotel - still poolside- and probably the top floor so I can see the beach and enjoy ocean more. Good news is, our patio was fairly private, and I could still hear the ocean. I spent a LOT of time out there with my laptop using the wireless internet e-mailing my husband back home. And made friends with the mourning doves who had built a nest nearby. We used the underground parking -very convenient. We fould ourselves driving around to explore every day. The hotel seems to be close to everything and I found San Diego to be a very good city for driving. We walked around the neighborhood a lot, too and felt quite safe. Lots of tourists, a few homeless and wierdos on the boardwalk, but not anything we didn't already expect. Just be aware there are always going to be people targeting tourists in a place like this, so keep your wallet safely tucked in your front pocket, or your purse zipped and always close. I saw one guy that seemed to be scoping us out, probably to pick-pocket. He followed us around for a while, so I finally put my hands on my hips, spun around and glared at him straight in the eye, and I never saw him again. I wouldn't go walking at night though without my husband. Having a restaurant on site would have been nice, but it wasn't the end of the world. Would have liked to have seen the hotel provide a more detailed guide of area restaurants and attractions. It was difficult for us to decide where to go since we were never sure what was really in our neighborhood and what was several miles away. In all though, Pacific Terrace is a very nice hotel. GREAT rooms with plenty of space, plenty of towels outside our door every morning, good maid service, nice staff, continental breakfast, wine in the evening, but still left me wishing for an on-site restaurant and slightly easier access to the beach. But again, I still haven't heard of any luxury hotel in the San Diego area that's closer to the beach than this one, so until I do, I still rate this one as a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel romantic Location”
Reviews.Author: cynbyn
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great beachfront location. perfect for romantic getaways. Balcony was practically on the beach. lovely breakfast on the terrace early mornings overlooking the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Venturagal
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel. This hotel is right on the beach in San Diego. You can literally walk out the hotel room and be steps away from the ocean. The rooms are all updated in a "tommy bahama" theme. They are tasteful, well decorated and have wonderful bed linens. I slept great. The nightly free wine and appetizers is a special treat and the contintential breakast is better than most. The service is wonderful and i did not meet one staff person that was rude or not helpful. We really enjoyed the location and there is many, many restaurants and shops within walking distance about 1-2 blocks away. We used the pool and jacuzzi, both of which were nicely heated. This hotel does not have a restaurant on site, but they have a deal with two local restaurants that will deliver food to your room. I ordered dinner one night and it was the same as hotel room service, except a bit limited. The patios are great and large and i highly recommend room 111 which is close to the front door and your patio is steps to the pool and beach. They really pay attention to small detail such as fresh coffee, tea and lemonade all by the pool for hotel guests to self serve. They also have fresh cookies ready at 4:00 prompt and fresh apples ready to eat at the front desk. I was very pleasantly surprised with this this lovely hotel and will be back of course.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: dinko
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from San Diego and we love the Pacific Terrace Hotel. Everything was perfect and we will definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect end to our Californian trip”
Reviews.Author: trek-the-globe
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th and final hotel on our Californian trip and was the best of the lot, we loved it! Although our room (327) was the furthest back, we still had a good view of the ocean. The hotel was very clean and the staff went out of their way to help everyone. The breakfast, although the same every day, had a lot of selection. The pastries were very tasty and there was lots of fresh fruit. Pool area very well maintained and a nice water temperature. A good few restaurants within walking distance, but, beware, the restaurant list in the rooms is a bit out of date! Nearby dining option: JRDN was a good restaurant based in the Tower 23 hotel with views over ocean. For the price we paid, we would have expected slightly higher service, however food was of exceptional quality.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Pacific terrace”
Reviews.Author: suziebUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in October with our two children aged 4 and 9. Whilst the saff were very friendly we found the standard of the accomodation disappointing.We paid a high rate for a family room and the first one on the ground floor was quite shabby, fridge on mini bar did not lock. To be fair we complained and were moved to a second floor executive room which was much better. Breakfast was disapponting. Small area to sit in(better to take to your room.) Communal areas in stairs needed refurbishing and according to the children smelt( altho I do not have good sense of smell). As I say staff friendly, location good, hotel expensive for level of accomodation offered in the experience of our trip (four differnet locations)

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up to Hype”
Reviews.Author: ChrisFromOz
Reviews.Content: Found this property through Trip Advisor and stayed 5 nights with wife, mother and three kids aged 9 months, 3 years and 4 years. Yes we all fit within a room which was on the ground floor right at the end with a beachside view but not pool side. The service from the hotel was exceptional. Friendly, helpful and likeable.. The rooms were very well appointed. The TVs were huge and included HBO movies. There was a kitchenette and even steps to help our kids reach the sinks - overall one of the best hotels for kids I've come across. Our kids loved the easy access to the beach, although stairs had to be taken, and adored the pool. Afternoon cookies and wine suited various members of our party. Breakfasts were included and this was well worth it. Free Internet access in the hallway, good laundry facilities - overall we could have stayed here a lot longer. i loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Its Number One for a reason...........”
Reviews.Author: enk56
Reviews.Content: The reason its voted number one........... Great location - right on the beach, close to restaurants, bars etc but quiet at night. Rooms - Excellent furnishings, quality fittings & tv Pool - Great - plus jacuzzi - no bar service - doesnt exactly detract from the overall stay. Breakfast - adequate continental breakfast thrown in Staff - everyone is helpful & courteous; you are made to feel special. If possible - book a premium sea view room - expensive but worth it when youre sat on you're balcony overlooking the board walk and ocean as the sun sets - it don't get much better than that. Highly recommended - book it.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: pvavarou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel for 5 nights October 11-15. We traveled with our 2 1/2 year old and all had a wonderful time. The best part of this hotel is the location right on the beach. The location is also great for visiting other attractions - we were a half hour from Legoland in Carlsbad (a must do if you have kids) and only a 15 minute drive downtown, to the zoo and Coronado. La Jolla was only 10 minutes away. Second best are the rooms - just gorgeous and very comfortable. The plasma TV was a nice luxury. The neighborhood around the hotel (Pacific Beach) caters to 20 somethings with lots of surf shops, bars, restaurants and boutiques. It wasn't our scene but we felt safe to walk around and enjoyed eating at the various restaurants. The Broken Yolk for breakfast was great. The hotel's continental breakfast is nice, but simple. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. All in all, this is a great hotel and we will definitely be back again. To whomever gave me the referral for Amanda Prince photography - thank you! Our family pictures on the beach turned out beautifully. My only disappointment was the weather. It was cloudy, cold, windy and rainy for 3 out of the 5 days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: jimmy_sportingstar
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from the reviews that we saw on Trip Advisor and we wern't disappointed. The hotel is in a brilliant location, seconds away from the beach. It is also in a very nice neighborhood, where people are very friendly. We did have one problem on the first night, but this was dealt with very fast and we were sorted out straight away. We also got a upgrade, whitch made it very good for us. The Hotel is near to bars and restaurants, whitch made it nice and easy to go out for food in the evenings. The breakfast in the mornings was very good too. The Swimming Pool and Spa were excellent along with the staff, we had a very good time there and will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Bum Location”
Reviews.Author: Wellsdesigned
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a romantic weekend away from the kids. We had free airline tickets so we put the money we would have spent on airfare into getting a suite at the Pacific Terrace. It was well worth it. The hotel in general is nice, but the suites are awesome. You get a separate living room and bedroom, a real dining area and a decent kitchenette and two real balconies. The balconies were the most important since this hotel is as right on the beach as you can get in Pacific Beach. The sunset views over the ocean cannot be beat. From the 3rd floor balcony, we were able to just relax and watch the surfers, para-surfers, wind-surfers and all other beach activities. We were able to walk out onto the beach on a moment's whim and return to a warm outdoor shower on the hotel grounds afterwards. There is plenty of shopping and dining within walking distance. We never bothered to rent a car, we just taxied in from the airport and the Hotel sent us back to the airport in their own contract car. I would return again with the family and definitely want to go back for another romantic get away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: MisShelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel for 5 nights and plan to stay there again on our next visit. We traveled with our 4 yr.old and did not feel the least bit uncomfortable. There were many families with small children. I loved the hotel and its location. We paid to park our car in the underground parking and only used our car a couple of times. We could walk right out the door to the beach, the boardwalk, the pier, and many restaurants. The hotel staff was always friendly and accomodating but keep in mind this is not a "resort". I read other reviews where some were disappointed and perhaps they expected a resort. We were not disappointed about anything. It is a very unique hotel with a great location and great views. We felt it was worth the money and cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eek_19
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT hotel - and I'm not a fan of hotels. It has a REAL thermostat, and they don't turn the A/C off at night like so many hotels seem to. You can get the room as cool as you want at night, and even keep the fan going so you don't hear it go on and off. The bathroom (at least in our room) is separated from the sleeping area by a wall, so one person getting up in the night doesn't wake up the other. Lighted switches and dimmers, a refrigerator, a big HD TV and other in-room touches make it clear that someone was actually thinking about guests' comfort when they planned the rooms. And the beds were EXTEREMLY comfortable, as were the sheets and pillows. The hotel has great extras - a basket of towels outside each room every morning in case you need extras (though I can't imagine why you would), free wine in the afternoons, full breakfast in the morning, cookies at the desk and candy on our pillows every night. Plus, it's right on the beach, and the staff is very helpful. When we asked for a restaurant recommendation, they gave us a card that cut the wait time in half. There was a limited amount of free parking, but we got a space every day. If all hotels were even close to this good, traveling would be much improved. I'll stay here any time.

Reviews.Title: “Got Small Kids....Read This”
Reviews.Author: max-sun
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the one bedroom Family suite with our two small children and it worked out perfectly. The beds are very large and cannot be moved against the wall so we did not let our toddler sleep on the bed however we were able to get an airbed for $15/day and a crib free (graco pack n play) from the front desk. There is plenty of room for both in the bedroom and allows you to stay up and watch tv on the huge hdtv in the living area. Beautiful hotel, awesome beach location, adequate breakfast of fruit, pastries, yogurt, juice, etc. and the most freindly and helpful staff. Once you stay you will be emailed a survey and they must take the results seriously because the staff are so happy to help. Fresh baked cookies every afternoon and lemonade and wine. The room service was fast and tasty. We had a great view of the ocean and the tiki torches surrounding the property from our first floor accomodation. The pool was warm and not over crowded. We would definately stay again and recommend for all travellers including families with small children.

Reviews.Title: “this is a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvbug42
Reviews.Content: our room was gorgeous. the beds were very comfortable. the rooms were decorated beautifully with a patio that had a lovely view of the ocean. the staff was friendly and helpful. the hotel offered a continental breakfast to die for and wine tasting by the pool at night. never mind the chocolates on your pillows at night and the robes and slippers! stay here if you can!! you won't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ukTraveller54
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. All staff very pleasant and welcoming. Very clean and well maintained. Complimentary breakfast and wine hour was great with plenty of choice. Very good location on Pacific Beach, it is near to restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again (can I give it 4.5?)”
Reviews.Author: Dartmouth91
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at Pacific Terrace and are still smiling from a wonderful stay. We booked the hotel last November based on Trip Advisor reviews...Recent reviews, with focus on the surrounding neighborhood, made us a little nervous, so we went in to the trip with low expectations. With a few minor exceptions, PT met or exceeded our expectations. What we liked: THE BEACH: It's right there, right out your window, and it's beautiful. The first couple of days, there was a lot of seaweed, but then the huge raking tractors and dump trucks came and took all that away. The surf is wonderfully noisy at night and the water is shallow for some great wading and wave jumping. We took surf lessons with Rusty Farrell (you can get his number from the hotel) and the kids (and my husband) had a blast learning to surf. THE LOCATION: Pacific Beach (PB to the locals) is a hoot. It is young, hip, laid back and great for people-watching. We loved watching all the cyclists go by on funky bikes with surf boards tucked under their arms or tiny dogs tucked into baskets on handle-bars. There are great swim shops, tattoo parlors, taco joints and bar and grills. You WILL see homeless people, but we were never panhandled to or felt unsafe. THE ROOMS: Now, we were spoiled with a premium ocean front junior suite, so I can't speak to some of the other reviews that complain about the rooms. Ours was perfect - nice balcony looking straight out to the ocean, eat-in bar, refrigerator, microwave, sink, dishes and silverware...The TV was fine - we rarely turned it on. The IPOD docking station was great...Our bathroom was well-appointed and always stocked with towels of all sizes. There was a minibar that we didn't touch...In room safe - yes, it was small - but it held our small valuables just fine. Nightly turn-down service with chocolates and light music playing on the radio was fun to come home to. We were nervous at first because our room faced the elevator, and previous reviews complained about noise, but we never noticed a thing. THE STAFF: The staff go out of their way to accommodate all requests. Nicole at the pool did an incredible job of keeping wine glasses overflowing during the 4-5 p.m. wine hour (she even offered to send someone out for my Diet Coke when we discovered the soda machine only carried Pepsi products). She also was quick with freshly baked cookies for the kids and would slice up an apple for the kids almost without having to ask. The front desk staff remembered our names, had our car brought out promptly when we needed it and were genuinely always happy to see us. Housekeeping staff were unobtrusive but also always smiling and saying hello when you passed them in the halls. One of our daughters liked sleeping on the floor in the adjacent kids' room. She made a nest of blankets and pillows and was quite happy there, preferring that over the aerobed we had rented. At night, when we returned to our rooms, the housekeepers would have arranged her nest with cozy pillows, propping up my daughter's doll and stuffed animal and making a canopy with the doll blanket. Too cute. Things to Consider: BREAKFAST: As other reviewers have mentioned, there is no restaurant on site so breakfast in the morning is a continental buffet. Given the space available to them, I think the hotel does a great job. There were muffins, pastries, croissants, bagels, and English muffins (with jams, honey, butter and peanut butter to top). Cold and hot cereal, fresh fruit (apples, orange slices, bananas, melon), orange, grape, and apple juices, milk, coffee and tea. We tend to like a lot of protein for breakfast, so after a couple of days we ventured out to Kono's (highly recommend) for their breakfast burritos. All in all, the breakfast worked for us most days and, again, the staff were so friendly and willing to help, it was a really pleasant way to start the day. Be prepared for the flies, though. The hallway along the breakfast area is "open" to the outside and most of the seating is outside on the patio, and flies, as we've experienced in other tropical locations, are happy to join you for your every meal. DINING: As there is no on-site restaurant, you need to venture off-site for lunch and dinner. The hotel provides a list of recommended restaurants, and there are many close by that are actually pretty good. It would have been nice to have had a restaurant in the hotel - it did get a bit tedious trying to figure out each day where to get the next meal - but it was also a great way to see the surrounding area and get out. We did end up bringing food to the pool one night which turned out to be one of the best memories of the trip... FOLLOW UP: We had a couple of glitches with the front desk and concierge that just proves the point you can never follow up enough. We learned the first night that many of the reservations I'd requested via email weeks before with the concierge just hadn't been made...Also, a couple of requests to the front desk required a follow up call. Nothing major, but worth noting. FAMILY OR LUXURY?: With the price tag, you might be tempted to think of PT as luxury. But, in our experience, while close, PT is much more a place where families can spend a relaxing vacation, on a beautiful beach location, enjoy the pool and be close to all that San Diego has to offer. We were so pleased that there were other families with children - and we met some great people we hope to keep in touch with - but could understand that those without children, who may have been expecting a quiet, romantic, luxurious hotel stay may not have gotten what they paid for. Know that the pool is open until 10 p.m. and it's mostly families - with boisterous, young children who are in it until then. If we ever find ourselves again in the San Diego area, we will definitely stay at the Pacific Terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace is terrific!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Poet
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace Hotel is a terrific place to stay. Located between Pacific Beach and Palisades Beach, the hotel is right on the ocean. Every morning the ocean is filled with wet suited surfers. Every evening the sunset was dazzling. The pool has is wonderfully situated with a view of the ocean and we spent many an evening in the hot tub, chatting with other guests from up the Pacific Coast. Breakfast is popular with a great selection of pastries, bagels, juices cereal and hot coffee. Everyone who worked at the hotel was extremely helpful and the front desk was extremely helpful making dinner reservations for us. The room was immaculate, spacious and luxurious. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: taffy87
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister, and I came to San Diego for my sister's 40th birthday. I chose the Pacific Terrace specifically because of positive user reviews. We were not disappointed! The hotel was beautiful and everyone was helpful and friendly. Our room was upgraded at check-in, and the view we had from our balcony was unbelievable. We all loved the robes and slippers that were provided. The bathroom was exceptionally large and it was very easy for the 3 of us to get ready in the mornings. We asked for a taxi and we were provided with a driver that worked for the hotel. Carlos made our trip even more enjoyable and gave us first rate service with a smile! The Pacific Terrace is a very special place. We all plan to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Paul017
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to the Pacific Terrace Hotel. I had booked the hotel as the reviews were positive and it described itself as luxury. We were disappointed as it is certainly not luxury. On the positive side the staff were friendly and helpful and the location in terms of access to a wonderful beach great. However, there were a number of factors that seriously detract from the experience. Probably the major one is the very poor â€˜Continentalâ€™ breakfast. It is described in their in-room video as Gourmet; it certainly was not. A luxury hotel does not serve up a selection of pastries and packets of cereals in a school tuck-shop setting using cheap plastic cups and plates, surrounded by flies and expect to call that a luxurious experience. The lack of dining facilities, or indeed what appeared to be any form of cooking facilities, meant that we dined out each evening. The local area is really geared toward the younger generation, i.e. teens/early twenties and not forty-two with a wife and two children. Hence, the dining alternatives tended to be Grilles attached to Bars and were not really suitable for a family. Note that the area was not threatening, itâ€™s just that the options were not really places you would take your family. The next aspect was the bathroom. In fact the shower (above a small bath) and toilet were in an en-suite that is best described as being close to a downstairs utility room. It was not a luxurious bathing experience. I have noticed in the photos posted by other reviewers that other bathrooms looked larger. We stayed in a Partial Ocean View room; maybe other types of rooms are better. We also had problems with our air conditioning, it worked very rarely and the room window could not be locked. Also, the in-room safe was small, so that you couldnâ€™t fit in anything bigger than a mid-sized camera. Although the furniture was OK, the general appearance of the hotel was of being in need of a renovation, for example, the carpets were dated and the balcony floor covering was pealing. We didnâ€™t use the pool, as we preferred the beach. However, it did not look particularly inviting and there was no pool-side bar, as far as I could gather. Would I stay there again. Probably not. The prices charged do not justify what is offered

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Mo19
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel go out of their way to meet the customer's needs. If ever there was a hotel which really looks after you then it's this one. We very brought free soft drinks round the pool, breakfast is included in the price as are cookies at 4pm and wine which is served between 4-5pm. If you are too relaxed to get off your poolside lounger then the wine is brought to you! It wasn't the cheapest of the 5 hotels we stayed in during our tour of California and Las Vegas but it was the most relaxing and worth every penny! I was a bit worried about the location having read previous reviews but saw less homeless people hanging aroung this hotel than we did in the others we stayed in. The cost of parking our hire car in the secure underground garage was comparable or less than other hotels. Our teenagers also felt welcome and relaxed here. We couldn't fault this hotel in any way and will always remember our time here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay midweek for the right price”
Reviews.Author: psdabj
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel on Wed. July 11th. I had reserved a garden view room that morning for $175.00 on their website and when we checked in, we were upgraded to a ocean view family suite. This is a good sized one bedroom with a outside area with table and chairs. We were on the first floor corner room that has obstructed views, I would not pay premium for 1st floor ocean front, I would want to be on one of the upper floors. However, for an upgrade, it was great for us!! The free wine reception is really nice and was great after a drive from Arizona. We also enjoyed the continental breakfast in the morning and the ice tea and lemonade all day. The staff was very friendly and helped with everything we needed. There was no noise, but we were there on a Wed. night and the hotel was not full. I don't think I would pay $400 or $500 for this hotel unless you absolutely have to be right on the water. I would prefer Coronado Island to this area for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated and not kid friendly for price”
Reviews.Author: chmaloduma
Reviews.Content: After reading several high recommendations, we decided to stay 4-nights @ Pacific Terrace in between LaCosta (Carlsbad) and Disneyland. We have two boys - 4 1/2 and almost 3 - and the hotel was not really kid friendly nor was the neighborhood desirable, especially in comparison to LaCosta. I'm under 40 so I'm in no way a prude, but the area consisted mostly of young surfers, people with multiple tattoos, etc. One set of washer/dryers were not in working order and the front desk didn't have quarters readily available for those wanting to do laundry (they did quickly run out and pick some up); room service (which is ordered from two local restaurants) left off one of our children's meals. The staff did offer to go back and get it, but 30-40 minutes with hungry child was not worth it so we just shared our meal with him. We also asked to checkout one day early but were told we'd be charged the full rate ($400+) anyway so we stayed. Parking under the hotel was also not fun but looking for street parking wasn't appealing either. On the positive side, each room did have a small refrigerator, microwave and hairdryer, and proximity to beach was nice. Continental breakfast in morning was nice and wait staff did stop by pool once to offer complimentary lemonade. We would definitely NOT stay there again mainly b/c of neighborhood and the need for more kid-friendly activities.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rubberducky
Reviews.Content: Well I don't know how you get a "deal" on this place but I couldn't manage it for the life of me... and I worked hard... lol We are a family of four - we are in the mid to late 30's and our children are 2 and 4. We have stayed in San Diego twice before, once at the Welk Estates in Escondito (love it, but only if you're staying for a week or so) and at the Bahia Resort Hotel at Mission Beach - before the reno's. I really wanted to stay here but the price US$450 scared the bejeezers out of me. This trip I was on business and could write off our hotel stay so I jumped at the opportunity. I read lots of reviews that complimented the hotel and since it's #1 in San Diego how could we go wrong. Just after I booked I read the latest review about the area being a dump and I got scared... however there was no going back... We arrived on July 6th at about 4pm... check in was quick and fast thanks to Humberto (Tito), they have parking underneath the hotel for $18 a night which was great because then it's a quick elevator ride to your hotel room. We stayed in a oceanview room on the second floor middle of the hotel. The room was huge, beautifully appointed and comfortable. The balcony was great with an amazing view. The beds are about four and a half feet high with a little step stool to climb up... There is a bar fridge and a mini bar. Never tried the internet but apparently there is wireless... We got changed quickly and ran for the pool (we had just driven up from Ensenada). There was free wine hour from 4 to 5 and lemonade for the kids. The wine was excellent, white, red and blush and the service was great. We had a quick glass on the patio and then changed over to plastic glasses and went for a dip. The pool isn't huge but is adequate for the most part, only occasionally crowded. The hot tub was great and the view of the surfers was fun to watch. The area around the hotel is funky and fun. We walked all over... ate at World Famous the first night and Gringo's the second night. I lost my nose ring and bought one around the corner at the tatoo parlour. We felt completely safe and happy in the area and after eating dinner at World Famous walked back along the beach skipping the surf with the kids at 11pm a night. There were a few homeless people sipping beers, etc. but no one was violent or scary. The beach is beautiful and clean and we met lots of the vendors along the way in their little shops who were so nice and helpful. We ate breakfast at The Broken Yolk on Garnet both mornings... mmm best omelets ever!! Dinner at World Famous was ok, the appy's were great but the main courses were hit and miss, the prime rib was good, the steak not all that interesting. Dinner at Gringo's was ok too.. the appy's were fabulous, however the traditional Mexican food we ordered was not our favorite and we wish we had ordered fajita's instead. At about 11pm on Saturday night there was a little yahoo going on in the pool, it lasted about 15 minutes before hotel staff cleared them out without incident, however it was very loud for a few minutes. We had a problem with dripping water over our vanity. I called the front desk and they sent the repair man, who looked at it and told me he would resolve it while we were out. When we came back it seemed to have be fixed, however overnight the drip came back and our whole vanity was flooded including all our bathroom stuff, it was a big mess. I complained when we checked out and they comp'd our parking so $36 credit, which was nice. So here's our list of pros: - amazing location, fun, hip and interesting - beautiful hotel - fabulous service - great pool area, fun to hang out at - wonderful sandy beach - entertaining watching the surfers - fun boardwalk to walk along - comfy beds/linens - tv was huge and lots of options - small bar fridge (good for leftovers and cold drinks, etc.) - lots of good restaurants/shopping near by (walking distance) List of cons: - very expensive - have to pay for parking - noisy - we didn't mind at all (in fact we like it) but if you're looking for peace and quiet you probably won't find it here between the surf crashing and the people around the pool We never even went into San Diego proper this trip, we loved the Pacific Beach area so much... we visited Sea World on Saturday and that was excellent, however it's a two day excursion with little people and we didn't get to see everything in one day... We would stay at this hotel again in a second as long as their prices don't get much higher!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place on the Ocean - definitely pricey”
Reviews.Author: maryrosevan
Reviews.Content: My husbands company was footing the bill, so it's easy for me to say this place was great! It absolutely was superb! The pool and ocean were gorgeous! The room was perfect. Even the garden view room had a slight ocean view! We wouldn't have been able to stay here on our own so this was definitely a privilege for us. Our kids are now spoiled!!! I ordered a smoothy one night and asked they bill our room and the server took it upon herself to add a generous tip to the bill. I did complain and get that back! Otherwise, a wonderful experience with alll the little details, warm chocolate chip cookies served nightly! Yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else in San Diego but here”
Reviews.Author: bg312
Reviews.Content: We spent a night in the Pacific Terrace Hotel in June and wish we had spent every night of our vacation there. Unfortunately we had booked several other nights and paid for them before we found out about this hotel. The Pacific Terrace is one of the few beachfront hotels on the California coast. The hotel rooms were beautiful and made us feel like we had stepped into a tropical paradise. The furniture was beautiful and classy and the rooms were exceptionally clean. The continental breakfast was wonderful with a larger variety of food than most hotels. The staff was amazing. We never saw a staff member that we weren't greeted with a smile and a question about our comfort and an offer of help if we needed it. The concierge was very helpful in assisting us in finding our way around Pacific Beach. The location was excellent - on the beach and right in the middle of all the activity, yet quiet and relaxing. The pool was beautiful and overlooked the ocean. We booked a partial oceanview room and were upgraded to a full ocean view without even asking and for no extra charge. From now on we will only stay in the Pacific Terrace Hotel when we visit San Diego. This hotel was only $185 a night including all taxes and fees. A great bargain for the quality. Also a much higher quality hotel than its stars indicate.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, but wouldn't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Beachbabe31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights early June. Arrived early from Anaheim Doubletree (fantastic hotel) and were checked in straight away. Room was very spacious, full ocean view. Kids liked the pool although the pool area is quite small and they offer lemonade by the poolside which is very nice. Not sure how everybody seems to get such a good rate, but we booked through hotel website at $420 a night! This was our most expensive hotel during a 3 week stay, but certainly not the best. You are paying for the view. The hotel does not have a restaurant, so any room service is brought in from outside restaurants. The breakfast is served in a very small room downstairs. You can have cereals, small selection of fruit and toasted bagels, It's the same every day and there were never enough bowls etc, so you had to have polystyrene bowls which you are supposed to use if you want to take breakfast to your room. The most disappointing thing is the surrounding area, it's a dump!! The hotel said they had restaurants that you could sign a tab and they would bill the hotel, so that you did not have to carry your wallet around at night, this seems to me its because the area is so dreadful. We were recommended one restaurant by a local chap who got chatting to us outside the hotel, its called Nicks by the beach, very nice food and good service, its about a five block walk. All other nights we drove into the city and went to Seaport Village, about a 15 min drive. It's on the waterfront and has some good restaurants. We also went to La Jolla which is lovely. Wonderful area, great restaurants. Very easy to get to Seaworld and San Diego Zoo, both about 10 - 20mins drive. If we stayed here again, we would stay in La Jolla and certainly not Pacific Beach, the other reviews have said this is a dump, but I didn't quite believe it until I saw it. Unless you are really into surfing and under 25, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: mom2three70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last fall. My review is a bit late, but it was such a great hotel that I wanted to chime in. We stayed here in Sept. 06. We were there with 3 young kids 5 and under. We all had such a great time. The room was spacious, clean and beautiful. We had a 1st floor patio room, which was very nice with the kids to be able to access the pool so easily. Also, it was a great place to sit and drink free wine/lemonade while the sunset. Nice for eating breakfast and even dinner. One night we brought home a pizza from a joint just down the street and ate it on the patio. The staff was amazing. The free breakfast was really good. So good that we never even made it to Kona's for breakfast, and that is our favorite breakfast place in the world! It was very convenient to the beach, and great people watching. the kids loved the free cookies and chocolates. I can't begin to say how wonderful our experience was here! We walked down PB at night to go eat and we never felt the least bit unsafe, even with 3 small kids. Frankly, I'm dumbfounded about the few bad reviews about this hotel. I can't imagine what those people would like. My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons Maui and Four Seasons on the Big Island just a couple of months before our SD trip, and it was on par with that experience. Mind you, no one is coming around spritzing you with Evian at the Pacific Terrace like they did at the Four Seasons Maui, but that's a bit much anyway, even for the Four Seasons. And, I'm not saying that the facilities and amenities are equal to the Four Seasons, but the experience was just as good, and it was a fraction of the cost. As for the complaints about the work out facility--who in their right mind would want to work out in a gym when you have miles of paths along the ocean (not to mention the ocean and the beach) literally right out the back door? I just don't get it, I guess. We will definitely stay here again. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dclcbc4
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home a couple of days ago after staying at this hotel. I had read a lot of positive reviews about it, and it totally met all my expectations. The staff are very friendly and helpful. It is a very pretty property. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view. The room was very nicely decorated and very clean. The breakfast buffet was so very plentiful and convenient, esp. when traveling with small kids and it was great that you could have breakfast poolside or in your room. We sat on our patio and had breakfast while we watched the surfers. We opted to scrounge for parking instead of paying to use the garage each day. The hotel has only a limited number of spaces...first come first serve. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing and friendly hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: ladymissk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel in San Diego for 5 nights at the beginning of June 2007. We had a great time, would recommend the hotel to friends and hope to return soon. The rooms were comfortable, clean and tastefully decorated. An oceanview made our stay! It was great to watch surfers and the activity of the beach at any time of day. We were traveling with a three year old and felt comfortable letting our hair down while enjoying the upscale qualities of this hotel. We were pleasantly surprised to find a step stool for the little one already placed in the room. The swimming pool was warm. We enjoyed the complimentary wine bar from 4-5 every evening. Breakfast was very nice, too, with a variety to choose from. Turn down service includes lovely chocolates left on the pillow. Even the coffee packets for the pot in the room were good. We rented a car to get around San Diego, which was very helpful. The location of Pacific Terrace was perfect, on the beach and relatively close to all the cultural sites we wanted to visit. The hotel also has a car that can be hired out for a fee. This was a help getting to the airport and cost just a little less than taking a cab. If you enjoy museums, plan for a day or two at Balboa Park where there are so many museums and gardens to see, along with the Zoo. Stay at Pacific Terrace Hotel if you're looking for something on the beach, comfortable, upscale and friendly. P.S. Bring a sweater for breakfast, as the breakfast room is open to outside and is a little chilly in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Views, Staff, Rooms, Everything”
Reviews.Author: County95
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel on the beach. The views from our room were amazing. Watching people out there at 6 am surfing, that's the life. The rooms were nice and big with a nice kitchen area and great balconys. Very helpful staff and I love the free slippers we got.....Only thing I agree with some others is the neighborhood around the hotel, not much going on...I was there a few years ago, so maybe it has changed....But if you want a nice relaxing stay in San Diego, this is definetly the place.........

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: john1948
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in may 2007, There is a reason it's rated #1 ,the staff, it's clean, well kept, and a feeling of being taken care of, contribute to a great stay. Bethlehem ,Pa, USA

Reviews.Title: “Not Fair!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie C
Reviews.Content: This place is the best hotel ever! My family & I stayed here in Feb. of 05 and had a completely excellent time. From the moment we stepped into the foyer, there were nothing but smiles and helpful staff. Even though there was some renovation going on, they were courteous and very dilligent regarding warning us about areas that were unsafe. We were upgraded to a beautiful room on the 3rd floor, great breakfast, gorgeous views of the morning sunrise, surfers, and dolphins frolicking. The pool was very clean and large enough for everyone to enjoy, especially with the complimentary wine service! How can you put a price on someone bringing you free wine while you watch the kids play in the pool , it's fun to watch all people walking by on the boardwalk....it's so easy to stay here that it's not fair to have a vacation like that and hold all others to it's standard. We rented a car, went to SeaWorld and the Zoo, spent the rest of the days by the pool & the beach. I can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Live4DaysOff
Reviews.Content: This hotel was even better than the reviews I read on Tripadvisor. The hotel told us the checkin was at 4pm. We got there at 1130am from Anaheim (oops! wanted to get out of there alive- ha ha) and decided to at least advise the hotel were we there. The were WONDERFUL! They prechecked us in, gave us a garage key and told us we were welcome to use the pool and facilities all day. Then they advised us that they upgraded us to a premium ocean view from a partial ocean view! They then asked for my cell number and told me he would call me as soon as my room was ready and they did. When we got to our room, it was amazing! Plasma tv, fridge, nice bathroom, remote control fan, oversized comfy beds, IPOD docking station clock and a huge patio with table/chairs and a big seashell. The kids were so excited and my husband was surprised at how nice the hotel was for the price we paid ($199/night). The wine reception (4-5pm)was great and the staff was so helpful and got towels for the kids and offered to go get them fresh cookies in the lobby. They have apples and cookies at 4pm in the lobby and all day they have tea/lemonade and coffee in a room by the pool. While sitting by the warm pool we met several guests who have stayed there for years and called it a "secret gem". The ocean was so close and great for the kids. They had a warm shower to use before going back to the pool. The towels were fluffy and warm and they even offered poolside massages (not sure price). There were some women there for a girls weekend and they were lined up and ready to get a massage in the tent. A lot of people walk around in the white robes they provide in the room. The breakfast was great too and they even have highchairs. The staff was so helpful and nice. We ate outside and could see the ocean while eating. The only negative is the noise on the boardwalk if you sleep with your patio door open so we left it open half the night and then closed it when the surfers came at 5am. The AC worked great and drowned out the noise. They also have a computer for anyone to use in the hallway so we got to check our email daily which was nice. They offer a few restaurants for room service but it is pricey so we went down the boardwalk to the Green Flash and ate outside with an ocean view (it was delicious!). Also, the Ralphs grocery store is in walking distance so you can get some snacks/ beverages for your room. We DID NOT use our car the entire time we were there. Everything is close and easy to walk to! Our 4 yr old begged to go back to the hotel room because he liked it so much. We all loved it and ALL slept so well. The beds are great. The TV was great. My kids accidentally watched a pay per view movie for 3 minutes but the hotel removed that charge at checkout. The movies are only 9.99 though which is reasonable for a hotel. Our stay was so relaxing and positive. We will be back every year for now on!! We LOVE the Pacific Terrace and finally found a tradition for our little family. Thank you Pacific Terrace for a great stay and making us feel so welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel, Loved Our Jr. Suite, Not So Good Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: OCMommyof2
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this small boutique hotel, except the location. If I could put this wonderful hotel in a better neighborhood, I would give it a perfect score. It is located next to a public restroom where homeless people hang out. The beach in front of the hotel is one of two beaches, that I know of, that allows alcohol on the beach, so that seems to attract more of a mixed crowd. The service at the hotel was outstanding and we loved our beautiful room. The moment we walked in, we felt as if we were in Hawaii as there were many Palms outside our window with a beautiful ocean view. The pool is in the center of the hotel, along the main boardwalk, but it is fully enclosed with glass fence and has a gate that can only be accessed with a room key. I felt very safe on the Hotel grounds and on the beach during the day. I do not think I would want to go out there at night, though. If I was still single, in my twenties, this town would be the place for me as it attracts the college crowds, as well. It has many casual restaurants and bars, but it would be nice to have some upscale shops and restaurants as well. I hope this helps you all trying to decide where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Justtina
Reviews.Content: We had to move out of our house for a quick remodel, and found this on Tripadvisor. We are a family of 5, got two rooms, and stayed two nights. Good value for the money! Great views of the ocean! The front desk people were very polite. The place is immaculate, and the decor is very relaxing and beautiful. The rooms are comfy, clean, and the TVs in the rooms are perfect! The parking garage, although it costs extra, is worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: dmsmgl24
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Pacific Terrace last weekend and we loved every minute of it! From the smiling and courteous staff to the beautifully clean rooms to the poolside patio and fabulous breakfast & wine, it was everything we could ask for in a weekend getaway preceeding a business trip! At first, I was a little nervous to hear we were getting a first floor room near the pool. When I saw it, I fell in love. We were only steps away from the hot tub area and an exit door directly to the boardwalk yet tucked away behind beautiful foliage. Now, I would request this- who wants to sit on a balcony where everyone can see you from the pool area??!!! My one complaint is that we arrived on an early flight from the East Coast and got to the hotel around 11:30am. Although early check in isn't guaranteed, I had hoped a hotel of this nature for $400/night would have made an extra effort to allow us into our room a little early. The front desk clerk suggested we get lunch then come back which we did. However, by 3:30pm our room was still not ready (check in is at 4pm). Had I known we would only have been able to check in 15 minutes early, we would have planned something for the afternoon and/or not stayed in such close proximity to the hotel waiting to check in early. My mistake but slightly disappointing. The beds are extremely comfortable. The bathrobes and turn-down service are a pleasant touch. Even the continental breakfast was above & beyond. The front desk staff and concierge were very helpful and always addressed me by name. This is small, intimate hotel and is not for someone expecting a huge facility with lots of amenities and activities. However, if you're looking for something on the beach and within walking distance to great restaurants and the beach- this is a winner! We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreatTravelsLFH
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace Hotel is a great hotel with a wonderful staff! This hotel had very nice accommodations and amenities and is close to everything (La Jolla, San Diego etc). We traveled with our small children and the location actually worked out nice because we could get to everything quickly, yet we weren't in the middle of the city. We originally booked a partial ocean room and were upgraded to a family suite upon arrival, which was a great blessing as our 2 young children could go to bed at a normal hour and my husband and I could watch TV in the living area. Breakfast was wonderful and was included in the price. In addition, they served wine at the pool from 4-5 and the staff would walk around the pool offering cold drinks for the patrons. The pool area was on the small side but very clean and the water was nice and warm...a good thing seeing as it was only in the low 60's when we were there. Overall, I really liked this hotel and would recommend it. Everyone that was staying there had nice things to say and really seemed to be enjoying themselves. Thank you for a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great as before, yet better with remodel”
Reviews.Author: noryglory71
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Pacific Terrace. Last time was in '04 before their "Tahitian" remodel from their peachy and dated "Miami Vice" look. Although we loved the hotel before the upgrade, and it was the same hotel in all other regard, it really is classed up with the granite, flat panel HDTV, gorgeous beds and other decor. We ended up with a room on the first floor to the side of the pool, and although I was hesitant to take it (we've always had a second or third story room) it was FANTASTIC. I will request a pool-facing ground floor room in the future. You get a huge patio area, and lots of foliage provide ample privacy (frankly more private than the balconies IMO). Plus, the ocean view is better from the ground floor as you can actually see it from your room versus going out onto the balcony since you aren't above it only seeing sky. The bed was SO comfy. Really fantastic. The other guests that stay here are always so nice. We buddied up with another family and my kids went swimming every night with their new friends. I noticed this time the hotel was full of families. Last times we stayed here there were many, many, many more people on business. I am not sure why there was a change but it was better for us (more kids and racket at breakfast versus stuffed shirts reading the paper)... Breakfast was great as always and the staff is super friendly and accommodating. Don't miss Kono's down the boardwalk for breakfast one day though. The line is like an hour long at breakfast but if you go for lunch (can eat breakfast then too!) you will have a minimal wait and a great table overlooking the beach across the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: oceanpj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace from 4/9 - 4/13. We booked a garden view room at a great rate through their website ($179!) and could not tell you how happy we were when we arrived and they had upgraded us to their premium ovean view room. What a wonderful surprise!! I had asked what prompts such an upgrade, and the staff said that if they have it available, then they upgrade! The room was beautiful. Very tropical feeling with a huge plasma t.v. and extremely comfortable beds. Chocolates left on our beds every night too. The view could not be beat. We were on the 2nd floor and had 180 degree view with only the bluff and the small boardwalk between us and the sand. To get down to the beach you take a stairs down, but we didn't mind that at all. One of the days was quite windy and the bluff actually helped block the wind. The complimentary breakfast was perfect for us with 2 small kids and we brought it to our room a few times. Coffee, lemonade and ice tea were almost always available through the day. The staff was so friendly and could not have said or done any more to make us feel welcome and cared for. The ONLY thing I would've changed was the shower doors in the bathroom. They did leak water pretty badly. The surrounding area is o.k. There is homeless around, but we never felt unsafe. I wish there were more restaurants available within walking distance, but we did have some choices. The Pita Pit was our favorite for a quick bite to eat. We had a great vacation and would return to this hotel in a second. We enjoy the smaller feel with the amazing views from the room. Once again, the staff were amazing. Housekeeping, front desk, maintenance (needed it one time for the tv), breakfast service....could not have been better!!

Reviews.Title: “Too Pricey and SMALL!!”
Reviews.Author: HeartlandTraveler
Reviews.Content: I could not agree more with the April 12th reviewer. My wife and kids (ages 9-15) visited 4/10 thru 4/14. VERY nice staff, everything seemed clean, but it's a small property with a small pool and small family suites. We were on the 1st floor, (family suites are only first floor) and it was tiny. The patio area is behind plexiglass walls, (either a security issue or to shield you from the wind, or both). You feel like you're in a compound. This hotel is on a cliff and the beach is 30-40 feet drop down some steps. There is a beachwalk that is nice and very long with plenty of restaurants to choose from but the surrounding area looks a little seedy. Some of the homeless hang out near the public bathroom next to the property.. (It was and education for our kids.) Fitness center is a room off the underground garage with no windows...they should have just skipped the investment. No restaurant or bar on site. I too booked based on tripadvisor and the reviews are way off on this one. At $539/night it was smaller than Embassy Suites and not any nicer. I could not help but sit there the entire vacation and think about how I was not getting a good value for my money. Our room was worth maybe $275/night tops!!

Reviews.Title: “Superbly by the Sea!”
Reviews.Author: russparks
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace Hotel provided us with a thoroughly wonderful two-week visit. We had a full-ocean-view room on the third (top) floor. The beds were amazingly comfortable, the decor was well-coordinated, and a big plus was the excellent quality 42-inch plasma TV (in all the rooms). We hugely enjoyed the generous-sized balcony, from which we watched surfers, kite-boarders, dolphins, sea birds, etc. As the saying goes, people can either make or break an experience, and the staff here most definitely "made" our exerience. They were extremely welcoming, helpful, professional and pleasant throughout our stay--notably the front desk and concierge personnel. Since parking in the Pacific Beach part of San Diego can be a challenge, especially during spring break, it was really great to be able to park in the underground garage (a daily fee was well worth every penny!). The hotel is located adjacent to the paved "Boardwalk," which extends a couple of miles to the south and on which we walked to convenient nearby restaurants, such as The Green Flash, World Famous, and Nick's. We definitely look forward to returning to this attractive, well-managed boutique-style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ncmd
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring the region and on the coast to boot. The staff are excellent in all respects. The rooms are well appointed. We will stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace for 2 nights as part of our trip to LA and San Diego. Our only regret is that we did not stay there longer. The hotel was fantastic in every way. The service was excellent, every single employee was friendly and helpful and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. Our partial ocean view room was upgraded to a fabulous suite, and even the partial view was excellent. The beach was really fun for our kids. The breakfast was really good, the afternoon wine by the pool was very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, and if we return to the San Diego area, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: MillyEssex
Reviews.Content: Blooms. Essex. UK. Visited April 2007 We booked this hotel based on trip advisor reviews and some travel books. To say we were disappointed is an understatement. Our ocean view room was hugely expensive at $400 but because of the price and reviews we were expecting something luxurious. It certainly wasn't. The view was great but the room and the hotel was very tired and needs updating. Our room was musty and the bathroom was tiny with the shower being something from the 70's. We had previously stayed in Las Vegas at $100 per night in a room bigger and better. The breakfast was fine but what a small and dingy room. The fitness centre was a joke. Not big enough to swing a cat in. Outside of the hotel is a toilet block so don't have a room on the left of the hotel as you will look out over it and the surrounding area is full of wooden shacks with quite a few homeless and young people partying. The staff were very pleasant but our stay was ruined as we felt the room was only worth max. $200. If you go here do not spend any more. I can't stress enough how it didn't meet our expectations. In fact we left early as we were so disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Nick_From_Manchester
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. On arrival we where greeted by friendly, efficient staff; including a very helpful concierge desk. The rooms were exceptionally clean and all had full or partial ocean views. Rooms were fully equipped with Ipod docking station (nice touch), large LCD TV, safe, separate sink from the bathroom to make dressing easier and clean comfortable beds. Large bathrooms, with an abundance of clean fluffy towels and toiletries made for a comfortable start to the day. Fresh fruit and water were left in the room each day and there was a fully loaded mini-bar, if needed. They offer free wine by the pool for one hour each day (mid-afternoon), which is a great opportunity to meet your fellow guests. The small pool is clean, with sun loungers available and the view overlooking the Pacific Ocean is gorgeous. Would not hesitate to return if in San Diego. Top tip: Take the tram (train) to the border for a day and visit Mexico. The journey is only 40 mins and the trains are very frequent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigelowfamily
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site, we changed our reservation from the Dell to the Pacific Terrace. The hotel was as wonderful as the reviews say, and we highly recommend staying there. The hotel is right on the beach with lots of good people watching opportunities on the jogging path right next to the property. The pool was the perfect temperature and the hot tub was hoooooot!! Go and stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a King, Queen, and Princesses.”
Reviews.Author: thomrho
Reviews.Content: Great Value for a King, Queen, and Princesses. We stayed at the Pacific Terrace with our two daughters (3.5 and 8 months old) for five nights in early March. The hotel was beautiful, clean, and comfortable. It looked even better in person than on the hotel website. Everyone was friendly. We really enjoyed our patio and even the view was great from our "partial-oceanview." The room was roomy. I wish the beds weren't so high off the ground since I have two young children, but the rooms were beautiful. There was a big flat screen T.V. The sink and mirror were separate from the tub and toilet which made it easier for us to all get ready. There was always a fresh basket of linens outside the door the next morning in case we needed an extra towel. The included breakfast was very good with fresh fruit, cereal, pastries, juice, coffee, water, and yogurt. The afternoon wine reception was very relaxing. We sipped our wine by the pool. The pool area was beautiful and comfortable. Our 3.5 year old daughter loved the fresh baked cookies in the afternoon and adored the turn down service because she got chocolate on her bed at night! I enjoyed the free internet access in the lobby. We walked to dinner many nights. The hotel did a fantastic job of referring us to different dining spots. We really liked being able to push a stroller all along the beach on the sidewalk above. The area is difficult to pinpoint exactly. It is a 50s beach bungalow type location. There are alot of college kids that live in the area. As with any busy/large town, there were occassional homeless people along the Pacific Beach boardwalk. That being said, we were never uncomfortable. Right across from the hotel are condos that are starting at $750,000!!! The hotel was really convenient to La Jolla and to Seaworld. We loved that we stayed right on the beach and could hear the ocean. We paid $15 day to park in their garage under the hotel. They even had music playing in the garage that was relaxing. I found the convenience of the parking well worth the $15. This was such a great value. We would definitely go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: jfath
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel 3/11/07 - 3/16/07. I only wish we had been able to stay longer. We'll certainly be going back soon. Our room was a 'deluxe ocean view'. Two queen size beds with lots of space for the entire family. We were rarely in the room, however, as the view from the balcony was magnificent and its location only feet from the boardwalk made for lively people watching while enjoying a beverage. The staff is friendly and helpful, the included continental breakfast is quite good and the reasonably priced self-park facility is extremely convenient. In short, I've simply never had a better experience at any hotel in my (too many) years of traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: lvjen
Reviews.Content: Drove to San Diego from Vegas, stayed for 3 nights based on all the great reviews on this site. We did a lot of research to find a nice beach-front hotel & so glad we chose this one, we won't stay anywhere else in San Diego! Everything these other reviewers say were true for us too.. Helpful & friendly staff, great service, good location. Hotel decor was great, no complaints with the room at all. Loved coming back from dinner to find our beds turned down, chocolates on the nightstand & the radio playing some nice 'ambiance' music... Nice touches like that make this hotel unique. I couldn't get enough of the beautiful view from the room. Also the Continental Breakfast room opens up to the pool/patio area , so we ate breakfast outside looking out over the ocean every morning, it was a lovely way to start every day! Wasn't sure at first about paying extra for the parking garage, but glad we did. Parking seemed kind of limited & we were driving a larger-sized truck that was much easier to park in the garage, since it was never more than 2/3 full, and it felt very safe & secure.. Loved our visit, will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong here!”
Reviews.Author: JohnnySox
Reviews.Content: We chose the Pacific Terrace based upon the reviews and were not dissapointed. We stayed for a week and had a great experience. The room was ample size and clean with one of the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in. The room was "ocean view" and we could sit on the deck and watch the surfers and the sunsets. The 41" HDTV was an added bonus.
