Nice bathrobes were suppled, morning paper, nightly cleaning and turndown service, fresh towels at the door every morning, a nice breakfast included with bagels, pastries, fresh fruit, yogurt, juices, cereal and coffee. Every afternoon at 4pm there was a wine reception included, this was a great chance to meet others at the hotel. The pool was heated and the hot tub was clean. There were many restaurants we could walk to in a 10-15 minute walk. We could drive to most attractions in only 20 minutes, an excellent location. Pacific Beach is full of the boistrous twenty something crowd but that does create any problems. This is a great choice and great value for the quality of the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and views”
Reviews.Author: susieq35
Reviews.Content: Went to the Pacific Terrace for the weekend before Valentine's day. The weather was terrible, cold and rainy (not the hotel's fault) We stayed in the Presedential suite and it was worth the extra $$. Beautifully appointed room, jacuzzi tub, Tommy Bahama like furnishings, flat screen T.V. ipod docking station. The only draw back is that this is supposed to be a non-smoking room/hotel but they allow smoking on the balcony and there were cigarette butts left there along with the aroma of cigarettes. This caused my husband's allergies to flare up making him sicker than a dog and as you can imagine ruining the romance of the weekend. We had to cancel our dinner reservation. We ordered room service and waited for well over 1 hour 30 minutes when the food arrived it was cold. This is probably due to the fact that there is not a restaurant at the facility and they order out from another restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jaybo1
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel at the beach, just north of the main drag hustle and bustle of Pacific Beach. The room was elegant and the view of the Pacific was magnificant. Friendly staff and great amenities made our stay a most memorable one. We will definately stay again at this awesome hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: traveler304
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler, I'd all but given up on a decent level of customer service provided by a hotel. The Pacific Terrace blew me away. We'd made use of the mini-bar fridge to store some personal items. On our 2nd day of four, we came back to our room to find that they'd brought us our own mini-fridge and placed our personal items in there. It was a very proactive, service-oriented action. On our last night, we tried to use the hotel computer to print boarding passes, but the printer wasn't working. The front desk person tried to fix the printer, with no luck. She immediately offered to check me in for my flight and print my boarding passess. I don't know about you, but there are times when I've run out of towels and called housekeeping to bring a few more the next morning. Every morning there was a basket of towels placed outside of our door just in case we needed some. We did have a problem with our AC functioning intermittenly. It wasn't a big deal because the outside temperature was mild. We came back to the room in the evening to find a cute hammer made of chocolate with a note from the maintenance person thank us for our patience while they fixed the AC. There will always be issues with rooms - but what matters most is how the hotel staff approaches it. In this case, they did a wonderful job. I personally loved the area that the hotel is located in. It's very low key and relaxing. Lots of local restaurants. The room was incredibly comfortable. A couple of nights we sank into the comfy bed with our down pillows and watched movies on the plasma TV, with the sliding door open so we could hear the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you trip advisors for the recommendation”
Reviews.Author: SuccessJoy
Reviews.Content: I just checked out this morning from a 3 day holiday weekend stay. I reserved 2 superior rooms with ocean view. They upgraded one to their top suite but both were great rooms with large balconies and great viewes - dead center over the pool and on their top floor of 3 floors (313 & 314). The rooms come with about a 40 inch HD LCD TV and a iHome radio alarm clock for my IPOD. They both have a refrigerator and more on the jacuzzi suite. Great looking, heavy furniture. The staff were ALL great. The cleaning crew to a person were so friendly and helpful. The front desk staff are young and hip, in keeping with the area. They almost pleaeded to me at check out if there was anything that could have made the hotel visit better. The hotel location is relatively quiet and has a great "boardwalk" just outside the property with fantastic views of the water. I really liked the small size of the place. Oh yeah, we listened to the roar of the ocean all night long. The breakfast is continental but was great. Again very friendly staff. There is a late afternoon happy hour with California wines. There are a number of good places to eat within a couple of blocks. Gringos was the best of the lot. We were always able to find a free parking spot but that may be becuase we parked the car around 5 PM for the night. Thank you trip advisor users for helping me find a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it !!”
Reviews.Author: thehudspeths
Reviews.Content: Pacific Terrace is just "perfect" the location is wonderful, waking distance from a lively part of town, shops and restaurantes. Right at the beach, fantastic views, the hotel is lovely. We will go back

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: bugster
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful small hotel perfectly situated at Pacific Beach. Location-wise you are close to everything - in particular, the beach. We stayed in a premium ocean view room - and, it was worth it. The Hotel itself is very nice, rooms are clean and very tasteful. Staff is friendly and helpful. I was in town for a business meeting, and my wife came along for a mini-vacation. Rather than stay at the big box hotel where the conference was held, we stayed at PT and it definitely made the whole trip that much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Not Quantity”
Reviews.Author: sweetman47
Reviews.Content: A recent remodel of this hotel has made this a great botique property at an already great location. Pulaski furniture you'd want in your home, quiet rooms and friendly staff set this hotel apart. There are only 73 rooms but at least that many staff members to provide what ever you need. Yet, the atmosphere is tranquil. And when you step out onto your balcony and see the beauty of the ocean's crashing waves and the setting sun--breathtaking! VALUE: We booked through Expedia and got a great deal on a flight, hotel package. We didn't book a room with a view, but when we arrived they "upgraded" us to a Junior Suite with a view. We took a chance here because there are a few rooms that don't have views of the ocean. Our view was partial. But even what we could see of the ocean was gorgeous. Subtracting the price of our flights, we paid about $175 a night and it was worth it. The Junior Suite was a king sized bed, a sitting area and a kitchenette with a bar that seated four. LUXURY: Travertine tile, wood molding and granite was not just in the lobby but also in the kitchenette and bathroom of the Jr. Suite. The widescreen LCD TV was sharp. It was housed in an entertainment center with display cabinets. The waffle weave bathrobes were heavy. Each night, the turn down service left chocolates in a velvet bag or a small box like Godiva's. They cleaned the room morning and evening. Even the balcony was spotless. Each morning there was a basket outside your room with extra towels, if you needed them, and the local paper. The continental breakfast each morning (pastries, juices, coffee, milk, cereals, fresh fruit, yogurt, etc.) and the wine reception each evening were complementary. The bath soap was shaped like a sea shell. The shower head was a massager. The sink soap was large. The soaps and lotions were on a copper tray and were of high quality. The balcony had a cafe table and four chairs. LOCATION: Pacific Beach is a surfer community. But even the little bungalows blocks from the beach were over a million dollars or more. The hotel is on the boardwalk above the beach. To the north is a large condo building, then mansions. To the south, condos shops and restaurants. A grocery store and drug store were within walking distance at Grand and Mission Bay. We ate at Gringo's Mexican food and The Green Flash for breakfast served till 3 and fresh sea food. We also ate at Nick's but wouldn't recommend that restaurant. (See my reviews of those restaurants.) Fat Burgers was good too. You could enjoy the room, beach, boardwalk and neighborhood (some interesting shops up Garnet) for a day or two and not have to venture elsewhere, if you didn't want to. PARKING: We took at taxi from the airport (about $23, plus tip) instead of renting a car at first, because they charged for parking at the hotel. But our last day there I rented a car from Enterprise, who came to pick me up and allowed me to return it to a location near the airport when we left. Enterprise gave us a free shuttle ride to the airport. I got the car for less than $30 for a day and was again "upgraded" to a midsize car. I was able to park the rental car on the street within a block, sometimes two, of the hotel. The atmosphere of San Diego was very laid back (even the homeless people were more laid back!) In January it was comfortable to be outside near the beach with long sleeves during the day (60s) and a light jacket at night (50s). It was truly a relaxing experience. If I could afford the housing there, I would consider moving there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: gfdeb
Reviews.Content: Based on Trip Advisor reviews, we selected the Pacific Terrace for a recent short stay in San Diego out of hundreds of hotels. Were we ever happy that we did! We spent the front end of our trip at the Wyndham Downtown which was "ok" until we compared the value, location and amenities with the Pacific Terrace. The service was outstanding from the minute we arrived. Very solicitious, courteous, friendly, helpful but never too much. Our room was a delight as we booked a garden view but were rewarded with a partial ocean view and a room that looked just like the one featured on their hotel website (how often does THAT happen to anyone?) And, I know there is a time for downtown hotels- like the Wyndham- but it was expensive, the service was mediocre, the room was poor (and not what we had booked)....If you want to have an ocean beach at your door, with a small hotel feel/experience and still be near to what is happening, you will love the Pacific Terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoScootman
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! After our 3 night stay here, we traveled to Las Vegas and stayed at the Bellagio - The Pacific Terrace was every bit as comfortable as the Bellagio. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Very clean. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable - flat screen tv's too. Cool location with easy access onto the beach or to decent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “dreamlike views”
Reviews.Author: newby5
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, couldn't have asked for more! We stayed here at the end of november for 4 nights. We are a family of 5, so it was hard to find a hotel room anywhere big enough for our needs. We find with having kids we need a suite situation, when we stay places and the Pacific Terraces' executive suite was magnificent. It was such a magical stay. We were greeted by the friendly staff, and checked in just in time to catch the sunset. The views are what this place is all about! I chose to stay here after reading all the positive reviews on this sight. So thank-you to everyone for your opinions, and time to share your experiences with others. We only had one glitch, which was rectified quickly. The breakfast was good, the pool and hot tub were very clean and well kept. The service was excellent. A quick tip. We booked directly and got a very good deal as the hotel was running specials this time of year. We also didn't go for the pay parking garage. We found parking in the street (for free) and it really seems like a quiet, safe neighborhood. There are lots of surfers around and they gave us much joy as we watched them surf out in the waves. I really don't think you could find better views anywhere else. I would definately book a waterview suite, if you can! It was worth the money. We have no complaints and would love to return someday. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for something special! We have great memories and like I said earlier "what else could we ask for?".

Reviews.Title: “Nice beachside botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bevanderson98
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night but it was lovely. Our room looked out over the pool and the ocean. The room decor was warm and inviting. The complimentary breakfast was nicer than you typically get. This place has a botique hotel feel to it. One thing to note is that parking might be hard to get on the street which means you have to pay for the garage.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and running by the beach”
Reviews.Author: Lynn_Lyon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Pacific Terrace for a one week business trip based on the tripadvisor ratings when the hotel where my conference was scheduled was not available. I agree with the other posts and only wish that the conference had been held at this hotel. The differences between this and the one hosting the conference were very noticable. I was fortunate to have landed here. I was upgraded to an ocean-front suite and had a beautiful balcony overlooking the ocean. The room, amenities and overall experience were much better than expected for the price (Expedia had a better pre-pay rate than calling the hotel directly). My favorite perk was easy access to running on a well-lit sidewalk that runs parallel to the ocean (so much better than running on the sand). I was able to have a quick run every morning, enjoy the sunrise and see the surfers starting their day. The run gave me a chance for people-watching (there were some characters singing, playing instruments, hanging out) as well as the diverse group of homes on the water (everything from $6M custom homes to quaint little beach homes). The breakfast was very nice and convenient on my way out every morning. The only challenge (which appears to be everywhere in this area) wa the lack of quick cab service. There are not cabs lined up in front of the hotel and it can take up to 20 minutes to have a cab show up. When I could walk I did because the weather was so nice but it was challenging to get anywhere in a hurry. I wish I had more time at the hotel and in San Diego to enjoy it more. I look forward to returning and bringing the family.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: TravlinGuy
Reviews.Content: Awesome view; clean, nicely decorated rooms; balcony overlooking the Pacific Ocean; the sound of the surf at night; a staff who genuinely seems to care about making your stay enjoyable (Claire at the front desk is a real gem); a good continental breakfast; excellent location with lots of good, reasonably priced restaurants within walking distance (try Taco Surf across Mission Blvd). I was there for a conference, and my conference hotel was full, so I happened across the Pacific Terrace. I had a much nicer stay here than I would have at the larger conference hotel nearby. I will definitely be back here again. One minor beef: I checked the price through an online reservation service and called the hotel direct to see if they would match it. The reservation clerk said no. When I arrived, a different desk clerk informed me that not only do they match online rates, but they beat them by 10%.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace, OH Yeah!”
Reviews.Author: allotti
Reviews.Content: We Absolutely loved our stay at Pacific Terrace this month. Everyone was great. The whole staff deserves a raise. Our premium veiw room was perfection...My 16 year old daughter loved the view also..lol And my 11 year old daughter loved the pool and we all enjoyed the beach , We all loved the chocolates!Ocean and friendly neighborhood. The best on the beach. Our driver Carlos from Elite Transportation was very enjoyable and professional. I highly recomend his services. Oh and the ladies at the front desk very nice...:) The wine hour was enjoyable as well as the breakfast. The ladies working the breakfast are very nice and pleasant. I have been around the world a bit and I know quality when I see it. The Pacific Terrace is a gem..shhhhh lets keep it our secret. A very Big Thank You and happy holidays to everyone at Pacific Terrace as well as to you Carlos B. from Errol, Sydney and Kennedy B. we'll be back......

Reviews.Title: “Great Everything”
Reviews.Author: mashdm
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The location is great, the rooms are spacious and the service was prompt. The breakfast in the morning was so nice, especially having two kids with us. We loved this hotel and would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “A Thanksgiving to remember”
Reviews.Author: Spirerock
Reviews.Content: We (my wife and I and our daughter and son-in-law) just returned from a great getaway over Thanksgiving at the Pacific Terrace. Our experience parallels the reviews of many of the prior guests. it is a great place to stay!! Let's get this one out of the way right off ... Yes, our shower leaked a bit, but only if we weren't observant. The doors swing from the walls, meeting in the middle of the tub opening. It is great for getting in and out of the tub, but can leak if you don't get the doors closed in the correct sequence over the side of the tub. This did not ruin our stay. The staff is indeed friendly. We arrived early and were given access to the pool area and general facilities while we waited. Being a holiday week, we did not get an upgrade, but were pleasantly surprised by the view from our 'partial ocean view' room. (see photos) It may be that since we arrived early, we may have gotten the two prime POV rooms that were available. Our room was larger than the room that our kids had because theirs lost some of the footprint to the stairwell. This is something you may want to watch for even in the second floor Ocean View rooms. The breakfast was sufficient and ample, but lacked any form of protein other than yogurt. The selection of scones, muffins, pastries, cereal and fresh fruit should keep most appetites at bay for the morning. It was very nice to not have to get up, get dressed and go find breakfast. There is an interesting, reasonalby priced breakfast stand just down the walkway from the hotel that had people lined up out the door each day. The grounds are very well kept and groomed. The pool and spa are very well maintained and their are plenty of towels by the pool and in baskets by the rooms that can be used from until the rooms are serviced. Our only complaints regard a few details in the room ... a noisy AC system fan that was irritating, plantation shutters that were not properly installed and didn't slide well and a few needed paint touch ups. It appeared that the room had recently had some rennovations that just weren't well finished. It was obvious that new carpet had just been installed in the stairway, so upgrades are in process. Also, the bell on the elevator door is really annoying! The 42" plasma TV was so good that even my wife enjoyed watching it. You do get a bit of price break on tickets to major attractions by booking through the concierge. When we go back, and we will go back, we will upgrade to an Ocean View room. This is a great facility in a prime ocean front location.

Reviews.Title: “Coastal Gem”
Reviews.Author: MariMouse
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel that exceeded my high expectations. It is the type of place I would return year after year. Pros: Helpful staff, immaculately clean and updated, nice sized balconies (worth the $$ for ocean view; you will regret not having it), excellent beds and linens, robes provided, clean, beautiful pool area. Turn down service is nice, if you like that. Beautiful sunset view. Nice warm outdoor shower for those returning from the beach. Good spa services available. Fun to watch surfers from balcony. Cons: Surrounding neighborhood is rundown and sketchy for walking at night -- safe, but not nice (ex. young men sharing a joint on the sidewalk, many vagrants). Very urban. Not a lot of familes walking around at night. (Boardwalk area OK during the day. Lots of joggers. ) Housekeeping was pleasant but not thorough; did not remove our trash every day even when full. Parking is $15/day billed automatically. Your responsibility to ask them to remove the charges if you don't use garage. We used the free parking in the alley. My strongest dislike was having to go to the garage to use guest laundry. Very isolated area. Neutral: Breakfast is OK, all carbs (cereals, pastries, fruit). Wine hour is nice but wine is low end (you get what you pay for when it's free). No snacks available; bring your own. Jr suites are significantly larger than 2 bedded rooms. Beach chairs available for $5/day. They are extremely heavy and awkward. Supply own lightweight chair, if possible. Beach can be very windy. Some good restaurants but not a large number of family oriented places. Definitely the surfer bar part of town. Try Kafe' Zen for great Thai food. Many restaurants deliver to hotel. This hotel could use its own restaurant. Overall, I just loved it and would love to return. I know I listed some cons, but I wanted to be thorough. It's a great destination hotel if you want to hang out and enjoy the amenties. It's beautifully maintained. I just wish it was in a more upscale neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “This is a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: myanke2000
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed in this hotel. This was our first visit to California and will not be our last. We were overwelmed with how beautiful our room was and the view was fantastic. The beds were fantastic and the turn down service was nice. I usually have trouble sleeping in hotel beds but not here. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The breakfast was okay but nothing fantastic. We were able to use the free parking every night. Sometimes we would have to park by the boardwalk and then wait until about 9 or 10pm and then park in the free spots. The boardwalk parking is free but you will be towed or ticketed after midnight because of the street cleaners. The beach is right outside the gate of the hotel. We enjoyed watching the surfers early in the morning and staying up late and watching the waves crash the beach. The gift shop is reasonable and has many gifts available to take home to remember your trip. Again, you will not be disappointed in your visit to the Pacific Terrace Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A breathtaking view......Denver, CO”
Reviews.Author: Travelnurse6156
Reviews.Content: As a travel nurse finishing an assignment in San Diego, my husband and I decided to spend 3 nights enjoying this lovely city. We both love the water and I wanted to choose a location that would give us a nice view. I could not have imagined what lay in store for us. The hotel was a mere 13 minutes from the apartment where I had been staying and it was very easy to find. We were thrilled as we pulled up to the hotel. Checking in was a breeze and the entire staff from the front desk to housekeeping was pleasant and very accommodating. Upon walking into the room, we immediately walked onto the ocean front balcony and could not take our eyes off of the beautiful view. We had a premium ocean view junior suite, which was not cheap, but well worth every penny. The room itself was very large and spotlessly clean. Wonderful amenities, a great large screen TV and the most comfortable linens we ever slept on! Not to mention the turndown service, chocolates and superb robe and slippers! We immediately decided that we would forego some of the activites we had planned, and instead, just enjoy the beauty and romance of this ocean front jewel.....and we did just that. We walked on the beach during the day and at night, with some of the most gorgeous sunsets. This hotel is right up the boardwalk from Mission Beach, but much quieter with an interesting array of people, as we both love to people watch. As another reviewer wrote, do not let the surrounding buildings make you hesitate. This is a very sweet community that is peaceful, relaxed and ultra convenient. A real taste of the beach/surfer life. We were able to walk to restaurants (we ate twice at Hennessey's....try the Shepherds Pie!). The afternoon wine by the pool was a nice treat. Lovely landscaping compliments this tropical oasis. We never imagined ourselves being able to fall asleep with a patio door open listening to the crashing of the waves. What a great ending to my short assignment in San Diego. We are already looking to return!

Reviews.Title: “Special view”
Reviews.Author: John&Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Right on the front overlooking the beach and sea, top quality hotel, superb staff, very clean and well maintained. Stayed 3 nights late October and apart from a little noise from the room above and an early checkout in an adjoining room, which disrupted our last nights sleep, this hotel was exellent. After exploring, La Jolla just up the coast was a better area, but as this is only a few minutes by car, the hotel is still an ideal base. San Diego, Seaworld ect are 10-15 minutes by car also, but make sure you get a local area map before setting off so as not to get lost. If visiting San Diego use the public parking down the side of the USS Medway aircraft carrier, $10 for all day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: guacomole
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pacific Terrace with my two teenage daughters for three nights in October. We'd booked a partial ocean view, but our room wasn't ready when we arrived, so the hotel upgraded us to a suite. It was lovely! A beautiful view from our balcony, soft beds, lots of room, quite clean, fresh cookies every afternoon at the front desk. The continental breakfast was nothing memorable, but it was fine. The service was excellent. Everyone from the front desk to the housekeeping staff was friendly and polite. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: raella
Reviews.Content: I have been there for four nights with my husband during our honeymoon and everything was just perfect. We booked a simple garden room and we were upgraded to a junior suite which is really amazing. The room was clean, nicely furnished and very comfortable, the staff was really friendly, always smiling and trying to do their best. Complimentary breakfast was rich and yummy and from 4pm to 5pm they served free wine in the pool which has a stunning ocean view. Moreover the hotel is located in PB close to shops and restaurants. This hotel deserves far more than three stars!!! We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional view, nice breakfast, gorgeous pool, professional staff”
Reviews.Author: PickyPacker
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to San Diego and really wanted to be where we could see the ocean. Not only was the view breathtaking, but the sound of the crashing surf lulled us to sleep each night. It's hard to imagine a finer location in all of California. On check-in we were generously upgraded from a partial ocean view to a full ocean view room. (#214, located nearly in the center of the hotel facing the ocean). The room was lavishly decorated and spotlessly clean. Throughout our 4 night stay (Oct 17-20, 2006) the maid service was fantastic and the evening turn-down and chocolates left on the pillows were such a nice touch. The beds were incredibly comfy. The giant flat screen TV had my husband in awe as he watched a baseball game. Now he wants one at home! The continental breakfast was quite generous and very good: about a dozen dry cereals to choose from, milk, assorted juices, tea and fresh brewed coffee, better-quality pastries, a variety of fresh fruit including cut melons, bagels, muffins, bread, and even peanut butter and cream cheese to use as spreads. The pool and hot tub were cleaned and serviced every morning and just the right temperature. There were always clean towels, including long lounge chair towels, right beside the pool. It was such fun to sit in the hot tub and watch the skaters on the path and the surfers on the beach. The staff was very attentive about keeping the pool area clean and tidy. During the 4-5pm wine reception you could even take a glass of wine (served in a special plastic glass) with you to the pool or hot tub. Don't be alarmed by the older apartment complexes sandwiched between the hotel and the main drag of Mission Blvd. They look a little seedy compared to the sparkling Pacific Terrace Hotel, but seem to be inhabited by mostly laid-back surfer types. I thought the Pacific Beach area would be more upscale, but it is a colorful mixture of old and funky with new and trendy. Our stay at Pacific Terrace was fantastic and I can't wait to return. My only regret is that we had so many plans for our time in San Diego, but the Pacific Terrace was so delightful that we hated to leave and ended up spending hours each day just relaxing by the pool, enjoying the complimentary breakfast and wine, and watching the sunset. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates the natural beauty of the ocean, clean rooms, comfortable beds, a good breakfast, and cheerful, professional staff. Also I have to mention that we ate at Gringo's mexican restaurant 3 out of the 4 nights we were at the Pacific Terrace. It's a short stroll down the path from the hotel, located on the corner of Garnet and Mission Blvd. The food was very fresh and tasty. My daughters loved watching the tortillas being hand made as they have a window between the dining area and the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “The Review were true”
Reviews.Author: Burn1911
Reviews.Content: We were on a road trip down the coast and didn't book until a few days before and so with limited internet acess were relying on the reviews on Trip Advisor being correct and OMG they were spot on with this one, it was FANTASTIC...... We were blown away when we walked in the room and felt we had been transported somewhere remote and tropical, what a treat and such a shame we were only there for 1 night. It was expensive, and it is a shame they charge for parking when you really have very few other choices, but the price was worth it for the room and the view and the facilities, they let us use the pool for the full day the day we checked out, which in my mind is a big PRO for them!!! The staff were lovely all around, the breakfast ladies were really nice!! Very friendly! And the chocolates left on our bed after the turndown (which we weren't expecting!) were YUMMY!!! none of that cheap rubbish!! So yep we loved it, big thumbs up from us, Well Done!!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: USANorway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first trip to CA and despite the gloomy weather this hotel was wonderful. The staff were very helpful and efficient. The hotel is located a block from the main drag so the noise level is reduced. The breakfast was delicious, always fresh fruit. We had an oceanview room and were able to eat our breakfast on the balcony and take in the beautiful view. If we are to return to CA again in the future we would definitely stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. Even our Californian friends were impressed with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Alabaster_Angel
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace Hotel is nothing short of outstanding! My husband and I stayed here for four days in late September, and were absolutely blown away by the incredible accommodations and service. When we arrived at the hotel after an exhausting day travelling by car from Los Angeles, we were greeted warmly by Kimberly, who promptly informed us that the garden view room we booked had been upgraded to a premier ocean view junior suite. What a delightful surprise! The suite was amazing, with beautiful new furnishings, a 42" plasma TV, marble bathroom, a huge and comfortable king size bed, and the most spectacular view of the pool, beach, and ocean. The hotel served a wonderful complimentary continental breakfast each morning and wine between 4 and 5 each evening. Cookies were also available at the front desk and let me tell you, they were yummy! The pool and jacuzzi area was small but perfect for the size of the hotel. We even managed to sneak in an evening swim all to ourselves, just after 9 (the pool closes at 10). The beach was clean and fairly quiet, though that could be attributed to the time of year (being off-season). The hotel also offered a turn-down service at night, with high quality chocolates left on the pillows. The entire staff was extremely helpful and friendly. We have stayed at a number of hotels over the years, but the service at Pacific Terrace Hotel was incomparable - it was simply the best! From the amazing accommodations to the choice amenities to the excellent staff, this hotel is in a class by itself. All the rave reviews are true! Book a stay here and I guarantee you will not be disappointed! We will definitely stay here on our next visit to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: MDJ77
Reviews.Content: Have been to â€œThe Terraceâ€� many times over the last six years and each time is just as exciting as the first time we were there. We were there in march of this year â€˜06 and saw some of the new furnishings being moved into some of the rooms. Just returned from yet another wonderful stay and the new furnishings including the 40â€� TVâ€™s really put this already wonderful place over the top. (the price is getting to be almost over the top to but worth it to a point. The pool area is always clean and like new and the continental breakfast is a real meal (not just bagels and coffee) with plenty of room to sit by the pool to enjoy while you read the SD union paper provided every morning and a great view of the ocean from the pool area. The surrounding locations provide a real variety of food and attractions. (You have to eat at the Green Flash, the food is great and affordable). All in all the best hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!! The reviews were right.”
Reviews.Author: 2_x_Travellers
Reviews.Content: You always wonder when the reviews for a hotel are this good, whether you are going to be disappointed. Well, we weren't. It lived up to everything we expected, and more. The staff are very friendly, and went out of their way to ensure we enjoyed our stay. We were upgraded to a junior suite - HOT TIP for anyone booking one - the cabinet lights are turned off by touching the hinges!! We kid you not. You feel as if you are somewhere tropical, but near to everything. There are some free parking spaces outside the hotel, but it is first come first served. Breakfast well worth a try, and the pool is a welcome treat after a day out & about. Free internet access available for guests. Hotel recommended a restaurant called Green Flash - a 9 block walk south down the broadwalk, which was well worth the walk. We loved this hotel, and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Really is The Best!!”
Reviews.Author: HogsBreath_01
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say? My new wife and I spent the final 3 days of our honeymoon from 18th - 21st September at Pacific Terrace and it exceeded all our expectations. We picked the PT after reading all the good things written about it on Trip Advisor and to be honest because of all the ravings I had a sneaky feeling it would be a bit of a disappointment. You know what I mean.......when you expect something to be so good, it's always a let down. After a horrible overnight flight from a fantastic week in Hawaii and an extremely irritating 4 hour drive from LAX, we pulled up at Pacific Terrace. We had not slept for over 24 hours and must have looked like the living dead..........we certainly felt like it! However from the moment we stepped inside, we were made to feel so comfortable and welcome, we knew this place was different from most hotels. Our room was to die for - it was huge. We had paid for a Deluxe Ocean View Room, but randomly got upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean View Suite. It was fantastic. The bed was so comfortable, the massive HD ready Plasma TV unbelievable, the bar and kitchen area (which we were not expecting at all) were great and the balcony and view were spectacular. The pool area, although small, was more than adequate for the size of the hotel and was so well looked after. If you're around the pool area at 4.00pm each afternoon, a trolley gets wheeled out with a complimentary selection of wine for guests. I thought what a nice touch to be given something for nothing; a glass of wine would be lovely. Four glasses later, I thought it was an even nicer touch!! However, all these things said, the thing that really puts this hotel in a league of its own is the staff. I've stayed in a lot of different accommodations in my time and I can without hesitation say these guys were the best. Not only were they so very helpful and efficient, but their general manor and friendliness was really heart warming. I cannot put it into words, but I'm sure everyone else who's stayed here will back me up, they are just really genuinely lovely people. From the maids, to the room service, to the reception staff - absolutely everyone was fantastic. I 've always fancied going to San Diego and had lots of things planned to end off our 3 week honeymoon. However, we were so comfortable in the Pacific Terrace, we did nothing..........and didn't feel bad about doing nothing! This place was so awesome, it just seemed appropriate to chill out and enjoy our last few days in peace. Trust me, for all you people considering staying here........go for it.......you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Was overwhelmed by it's excellence”
Reviews.Author: Montivoire
Reviews.Content: I was quite impressed with the beauty of the hotel and it's setting. The rooms were so tastefully decorated and the amenities were plentiful. It rivals any boutique hotel I've stayed in anywhere. The staff were very friendly, helpful, and courtious, making sure any need was attended to. In particular Rick, the valet, was very knowlegable about the area and the concierge was impeccable. I have no negative comments at all. I'd recommend this hotel to any discriminating traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: doke
Reviews.Content: The staff is amazing. We checked in early and they upgraded us to a junior suite. Every single member of the staff was so pleasant and accomodating, and the best part was that it was all genuine. The afternoon wine hour and continental breakfast, both out by the pool, was top notch. The room itself was amazing. Great, classy decor with a bar and a large, flat screen HD television. A great, king sized bed. A superb balcony that overlooks the pool and the Pacific Ocean, complete with dozens of surfers, was equally staggering. There is a walking and biking trail between the pool and the beach, and everybody that walks by does a double take to look at the beautiful property. It looks like an oasis with all of the palm trees making the great three story structure look even more amazing. It does cost an extra $15 a day to park in their garage but it's a small price to pay for all of the greatness. My girlfriend and I have been lucky enough to go to many beautiful places and stay in many beautiful hotels but we both think this was the best overall experience we ever had in our travels. We are already making plans to fly across the country again just to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: BALovToTravel
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here because of prior TripAdvisor reviews. The Pacific Terrace Hotel lived up to all expectations. The location was excellent - right on the beach in a nice beach community. The staff was both friendly and helpful. The pool area faces the beach, yet is glassed in for privacy. In the evening, we walked to restaurants nearby on staff suggestions. The room itself was wonderful - we chose a non-beach front room, however, we could sit on the patio, and see the ocean and the beach walk from our patio. Our room was beautifully decorated. The sitting area had a large, flat-screen TV. We both loved the king-size bed - it was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in! Everything about the hotel was first-class -- US Today delivered to the room, great continental breakfast with fresh fruit, and wine at the pool every day at 4-5. In addition to the normal room amenities you expect from this type of hotel, the room included terry robes, lighted makeup mirror, q-tips and cotton balls, and a full-size hair dryer. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “simply the best PB experience”
Reviews.Author: Vinny'sDad
Reviews.Content: Have been to Pacific Beach numerous times and stayed in numerous hotels there. This trip, we wanted a nice place to stay with our 7mo old son. First trip with him.. The room was HUGE!!! Had a suite on the 2nd floor. Bathroom was rediculously huge as well. All the furnishings were beyond top notch. Super clean everywhere. Balcony was perfect for viewing the ocean and some of the street life.. The pool and surrounding areas are fantastic. Loads of plants, clean walks, and a very clean and warm pool. The staff was VERY friendly and polite no matter what the situation. Breakfast was perfect every day. Pastry, bagels etc. You can walk to sooo many restaurants, bars, shops, you name it in just a few min. They even have locked surfboard lockers in the garage which was great so I did not have to lug my board to the room every day. The surfing scene is very laid back and super friendly right in front of the hotel. It was worth every penny. I have to say, it is the first time a website, brochure pic, has been accurate or even less spectacular then the location itself. The Pacific Terrace far exceeded our expectations (which were pretty high!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: SBR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel for 2 nights.The staff were so friendly & helpful especially the concierge,Gary.The location of the hotel is great,right on the beach & for those with no car there is a bus stop at the end of the road that takes you to the gaslamp district! The rooms were lovely,very big & nice comfy beds.The continental breakfast was very nice & you can sit outside & enjoy it in the san diego sun. I am very well travlled & the service at this hotel was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: perezk27
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at Pacific Terrace Hotel. This place is just amazing. We had a premium ocean view room with 2 queen beds. The room was very spacious and well decorated (the wood shutters and big screen tv added a nice touch!) They offered a free continental breakfast, wine hour by the pool from 4-5 pm., and freshly baked cookies at 4 pm. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. If you want to utilize the use of their parking garage there is a $15/day charge (it's not a lot if you want a secure place to park your car at night). We didn't have to do a lot of driving since there are eating places and grocery stores within walking distance. My kids (ages 4 & 2) loved the fact that we didn't have to walk far to go to the beach - it's right outside the pool area. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Lenasu11
Reviews.Content: My friend and I discovered the Pacific Terrace Hotel while looking for a well priced place to stay in PB. The rooms were decorated to make you feel like you were in the tropics. The beds were huge and so comfy! The bathroom was marble and spacious. The pool overlooks the beach and they even serve free wine from 4-5pm. The staff was extremely pleasant. It was a pleasurable experience all in all. I will definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: SLKSABR
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a 4 night stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel...WE HAD A GREAT TIME!!! First of all, my wife and I were vacationing with our two children ages 4.5 and 6. A 'Welcome' email from the hotel was received a day prior to our arrival, suggesting we prepare for relaxationâ€¦a nice way to begin. Our 5 pm check-in was smooth, especially for the busy holiday weekend. The staff at the front desk was courteous, professional and efficient. The bellman, Rich, was particularly helpful in pointing out all of the features of the property (pool, breakfast/wine hour, parking, etc.) and our stunning room. We booked an executive suite as it was the only way to GUARANTEE that we receive a room with two queen beds. Premium ocean view and Jr. suites are offered with both King/sofa bed or 2 queen configurations and while the hotel tries to accommodate all requests there are no guarantees. The room exceeded our expectations. Out third floor suite was very spacious and nicely appointed. Notable amenities: 42â€� plasma TV, large double sliding doors w/ plantation shutters, ocean view patio w/ seating for four, wet bar w/ microwave. The bathroom was exceptionally large and had a jetted tub. The room was clean and well cared for. Our room was located on the north side of the hotel facing the Capri and the ocean. Rooms on the south side look out toward Crystal Pier. There was enough noise at street level that we chose to close the sliders at night. Iâ€™m not sure if the rooms that directly face the ocean would be quieter as they are adjacent to the pool, beach and beach walk. The pool facility was appropriately sized for the hotel. Pool and hot tub were heated to 85 and 104 deg. respectively. There were no age restrictions for the hot tub. I believe the hours were 7-10 a.m. Seating was adequate and towels plentiful. Additional shade seating would be nice. This is NOT the â€˜send your nanny down in the morning to reserve a lounge chairâ€™ pool scene. Very relaxed and laid back. Deluxe continental breakfast is served from 7-10am and is well stocked and plentiful. Pastries, bagels, cereals, fresh fruits, yogurts, juice, coffee, tea and milk are offered. Seating is cozy inside or one can dine outside near the pool. It seemed that most guests took advantage of the complimentary breakfast. Iced tea and lemonade are available throughout the day as are an assortment of board games. Complementary wine hour is from 4-5 p.m. by the pool. The hotel DOES NOT have a restaurant or pool side bar service, however, there is fare from two local restaurants to choose from for room service or pool side delivery. Guests are also able to charge back to their room at several other nearby restaurants. Location is ideal. The hotel is located in Pacific Beach just north of Crystal Pier and shares an oceanfront location next to the Capri By The Sea condominiums. Beach access is just out the secured gates. Activities are plentiful. There are several restaurants nearby and worthy of mentioning: The Fishery, PB at Cass and Opal (.8 mile from hotel), an inland neighborhood eatery (no ocean view) delicious, FRESH seafood. Station Sushi, Solana Beach, if youâ€™re up north (and returning to the hotel from Legoland) itâ€™s well worth the stop. Great hotel staff recommendation! Taco Surf, PB, Mission Boulevard between Felspar and Emerald, GREAT taco eatery just a block away. Take-out for pool-side dining. I would not recommend Taylorâ€™s. Service was slow, food mediocre and ambiance just so-so. The fitness room was under construction and was going to be â€˜very smallâ€™ according to staff. We did not utilize any offsite fitness facility. Parking located beneath the hotel was adequate and secure; I believe it was $17 a night. The hotel also provided 10 first-come first-serve spaces in the alley behind the hotel at no charge. Surface/street parking is difficult due to the desirable beach location. Hotel checkout is 11 a.m. I had inquired about a late checkout when I booked our room two months prior to our stay and was told it would not be a problem, so I booked a late returning flight to Reno to maximize our stay. However, this request was denied the night before our departure due to the â€˜unusually high amount of room turnoverâ€™. In the end, we were extended until noon and were able to use all the hotel facilities (less the room) until 3 p.m. So what cold be done better? Tough question. There were a few noticeable exterior â€˜wear and tearâ€™ marine environment issues (peeling paint, rusty metal) that could be repaired. A small pool side bar might be nice to aid in relaxation. One or two of the staff seemed overwhelmed by the demands and volume of guests and were neither helpful nor responsive to guest requestsâ€¦find replacements ASAP that are truly dedicated to guest service. Overall, a wonderful long weekend and weâ€™ll be back again in the spring for more enjoyment and relaxation!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Tropical Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: NJMotherof2
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace Hotel was exactly what we were looking for. A tropical beachy feel with an awesome view from the ocean front room! Landscaping was beautiful. They offer continental breakfast with room. Ice tea, leomonade, ice water, and coffee were available all day in a common room. Cookie hour and a wine hour also. They also had board games out on the patio tables...very thoughtful on their part. The area was great too, not too noisey and not too quiet. A great breakfast all day and coffee cart right down the street called Kono's...to wait on the line is worth the wait! The only problem was when we got there, the room had no air conditioning on, it was warm, buy they lent us a fan until the room cooled down. It also wasn't vacumed that great, but when I complained, they took care of it right away. If you are from the East like I am, they ocean water is very cold! We had a great time anyway...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Klee1
Reviews.Content: My family (2 children under 10 and husband) and I really enjoyed our recent stay. The room was spacious and newly redecorated with a great view of the ocean. We booked a partial oceanview and were very pleased watching the surfers in the morning. There was a small kitchenette (refrigerator, sink, stove) in our room. The continental breakfast was good, although we did venture down to Kono's two mornings and loved it - great coffee!! My children enjoyed the free cookies and lemonade and the complimentary wine hour was a very nice touch. Our room was kept very clean by the room attendant. The hotel is not directly on the beach but on a bluff above it. There are stairs and a ramp fairly nearby. We only had to park in their lot one evening and used the street parking whenever possible. There is also a computer on the first floor for internet access with a printer where you can print out tickets to local sights (many offer discounts). There is a public restroom to the south of the hotel building which does attract the homeless, however, we were never harassed or bothered at any time. The area is well used by surfers and fitness buffs (runners, walkers, and bikers). Overall, a great hotel. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: alastairp
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 nights at this hotel. The location, adjacent to Pacific Beach is superb. Our room, a junior suite, was very large and spotlessly clean. Earlier comments regarding the evening service are all accurate; the chocolates, radio, turn down all add an extra touch. We too had the shower screen situation and regularly flooded the bathroom floor! The breakfast could be taken back to your room if desired and the staff were always eager to assist in any way possible. Just one thing re location; the streets near the hotel are full of young adults clubbing and pubbing and so, in the evening we drove to restaurants a little further afield. Having booked through expedia I would do so directly with the hotel and yes, I would LOVE to return again!

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: doescott
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a week at the pacific terrace,and i have never enjoyed a hotel so much.i am a tripadvisor member from massachusetts,no affiliation with this hotel in any way.having said this,the terrace was everything we hoped for and more.from the staff,to the free large continental breakfast,to the room everthing was awesome.breakfast was large and varied.the room was new and spotless.a 42" plasma was the perfect way to relax in the room.the pool was spotless and towels were always replenished.cold drinks were available all day,along with free cookies in the afternoon.wine tasting at 4pm,and chocalates at night made our stay truly enjoyable.if we ever go back to san diego,i would not hesitate to stay there again .well worth spending the extra money for a good place,as it makes a vacation so much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel, Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: Looking
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a little elegance on Pacific Beach, this hotel is worth the extra bucks! The Pacific Terrace has exquisite rooms with beautiful new linens, etc. The views are perfect. All public areas are very well maintained as are the rooms. The staff is extraordinary & go out of their way to assure guests are happy (but not in an obtrusive manner). There's a nice pool & hot tub & a fantastic continental breakfast daily (not to mention complimentary warm cookies at 4pm & a glass of wine around 6pm). There is no restaurant or bar on the premises, but you don't miss them when... Steps out the door is the beach, boardwalk & many places to eat, drink or shop. There are many places to stay along Pacific Beach if your budget doesn't allow for it ~ but we'd rather stay one night in Pacific Terrace than 3 anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “PAcific Terrace, a winner!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dito! Just read the other reviews, nothing else to add other than I agree. Spent three days with my familly incliding two small kids. Great staff, great location, great rooms. Breakfast was plentifull in a fun environment. Check out at 11AM, but we were given keys to parking and hotel bathroom as well as towel tokens, so we stayed till sunset! Pacific Beach is a hippy/surfer zone, plenty of local shops and eateries. This hotel is a diamon in the rough!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: KellieCNh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from San Diego and stayed at the Pacific Terrace for two nights. Upon arrival, around 3pm, our room was not ready, we understood check in was 4pm, but had just driven 2.5 hours from Cabazon CA (where we vacationed for 5 days) and really just wanted to get into our room and relax! We left our luggage in the car and hung out at the beach until 4:15pm, went back and our room still wasn't ready, so they immediately upgraded us from the Junior Suite ($450.00 a night) to the Kingston Suite and showed us to our room. WOW.. What an awesome room!! The attendant at the desk told us that the Kingston Suite goes for $850.00 a night! It showed!! We had two balconies overlooking the ocean, one in the living room and one in the bedroom. Granite everywhere, great soaking tub, separate shower, large flat screen TVâ€™s in both living room and bedroom. Turn down service at night was great. They left a box of chocolates on each of our pillows and slippers at the end of the bed. They dimmed the lights, turned on the ceiling fans and played really nice soft music on the radio in the bedroom. We really did not take advantage of the continental breakfast, but it did look great, very crowded though. We did order room service from one of the three restaurants that serviced them (no restaurant on site) and it took about 1.5 hours for delivery and by then the food was cold. Parking was $14.00 a day if you couldn't find an open space in their tiny parking lot. Staff was wonderful. Can't really say one bad thing about the Pacific Terrace Hotel! We met people staying at Pacific Terrace without an ocean view and their only complaint was the homeless people. One side of the hotel faces a public restroom and the homeless people tend to hang around there at all hours. They also sleep on the beach at night, but never once did it bother us or our great time we had.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace, 3rd year in a row”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We love the Pacific Terrace and have come back to it every December for the last three years. The location is wonderful, the beach is great, the staff is friendly & accommodating, our rooms are always nice even though we pay for them using our American Airline points. Last year we upgraded to a small suite which gave all 4 of us plenty of room. My kids loved the staff and their free nightly cookies in the front lobby. The breakfast in the morning was crowded in the small dining room, but still nice and we could have eated outside by the pool. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: MAR911
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful, clean rooms. Did not have an oceanview room but still had a great view from our balcony. The staff was friendly and helpful. Easy access to the beach for our morning walks. I look forward to returning to San Diego and the Pacific Terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cap
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Pacific Terrace for the 2nd time and I can say once again it was fantastic!!! The rooms are newly remodeled since our last visit and quite beautiful. They have an excellent continental breakfast in the a.m. and a wonderful wine hour in the afternoon but my favorite are the warm cookies at the front desk at 4:00 everyday. Our room had an exceptional view of the ocean and we left our patio door open to hear the waves all night. The best thing about our stay was the service, all attention was given to us by the employees, I felt like a queen. Can't wait to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVABLE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All I can say is....UNBELIEVABLE! What a great place. We were staying at another place down the beach that was a total disappointment. We walked on the beach and saw the PT and took a chance at a vacancy. They gave us a Jr suite for $30 a night less than the place we were staying at. We moved into the PT and the room was AMAZING. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. If you want the "perfect" spot on the beach and a beautiful room for a terrific price, book the Pacific Terrace. Believe me, you will NOT be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the Cost!”
Reviews.Author: OKC Traveller
Reviews.Content: My family of four (one teen and one child) had an excellent experience at PT. We chose an oceanview room online and got Rm. 308. Plenty of room for four, so no need to upgrade to a suite (unless they are going to give it you of course!). Wide screen HDTV, queen beds, upgraded decor, but the selling point is the view! Get oceanview for the few dollars more per night and you won't regret it. No need to pay for the underground parking, though. Wide variety for the FREE continental breakfast, and if you've ever paid for a meal in SD, then you can appreciate this perk. The staff was great, not intrusive or overly friendly, just there when you need them. That's perfect service in my opinion. No hotel dining is not a problem. Just walk a few short blocks to any kind of food you want. Pacific Beach is a fun place to stay and the PT is BY FAR the best hotel in the area. Don't expect Four Seasons cause you're not paying for that, but do expect an excellent hotel experience for the price you are going to pay. (Check out the view in the pic!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - great first night in SD”
Reviews.Author: Aleekee
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our night's stay at the Pacific Terrace. We stayed midweek, mid May, and were upgraded from a Garden room to an ocean view room. Couple checking in in front of us also got upgraded too. For the price we paid it was amazing, nothing on our trip matched it! Room pictures on the website don't match what we got. I think they have upgraded the rooms since the web photos. Two queen beds were massive, really high, quite throne like. View was great over the pool, and then the ocean. Sound of the ocean at night was great. It was a real shame we had prebooked two nights in down town, which were a real let down after the lovely night we had here. We skipped breakfast at all our hotels on our two week trip apart from this one. Fresh and nice. We will definately go back to San Diego, and California as we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Pacific Terrace!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family had a great stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel! Initially we had booked into a hotel down the street (on the other side of the Pier) and were very unhappy. We called the Pacific Terrace and thankfully they booked us into their hotel. Upon arrival they had upgraded us into one of their family suites insisting we have a positive visit while in San Diego. The staff were phenomenal and very customer service oriented. The free morning continental breakfasts were fantastic and the afternoon wine by the pool a bonus. The family suite was very comfortable, clean and best of all was oceanview overlooking the surfers. The suite was also easy access to the pool and hot tub, also oceanview by the way!! Many restaurants and shops are within walking distance. I would definitely recommend this hotel to families who love the beach, surf and ocean views.

Reviews.Title: “If only the weather had cooperated. . . . .”
Reviews.Author: Weaver1952
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Pacific Terrace in early May. We were looking forward to a week of sun and warm weather. We did not see much sun or 70 degrees. Luckily, the hotel was great. We had a second floor suite which looked over the pool. We could step out on our balcony any time of the day and see at least a hundred surfers. The staff was outstanding, always helpful with directions and recommendations. The continental breakfast was very good as was the afternoon wine reception. The chocolates on the pillow each night were a nice touch. We will definitely stay there again if we return to San Diego, but it won't be in May.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: irene-england
Reviews.Content: We (2 couples) stayed here 9th-10th of March at the end of our holiday.The hotel rooms were a good size,nicely decorated,the complementary breakfast was good as was the complementary wine.The staff were helpful,pleasant and friendly,they gave advice on where to find good food locally.We ate twice at the 23 restaurant down the road from the hotel.The food was great. We enjoyed our visit to San Diego and intend to return soon. Irene

Reviews.Title: “Great choice; thanks TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: Debbie in Maryland
Reviews.Content: Based on tripadvisor reports, we selected the Pacific Terrace Hotel in Pacific Beach. I wanted a nice place to bring my 8-year old son while we toured the zoo, LegoLand, and SeaWorld. I was not disappointed. The hotel was clean, well maintained, and modernized. The staff all were friendly, helpful, and never far away. I was amazed at the number of staff available to help the guests. I selected the least expensive room based on the rates quoted on the phone. I then booked the room online and got an even better rate. The "garden view" room I requested (rather than the more expensive "ocean view" room) still had a view of the ocean from the litte patio we had. And I could hear the waves from my room. I was pleased with the amenities we had in our room: free wireless internet, fridge, coffe pot, and mini-bar, 2 sinks, very handicap accessible bathroom, patio and chairs outside by a little garden area, 2 very comfortable queen beds, a desk and chair plus a little table and more chairs. We were very happy. While there was no restaurant onsite, we liked the free continental breakfast in the morning. We had lots to eat there. Plus there were drinks available there all day for free. Snacks and drinks were available by the heated outdoor pool. From 4-5 pm was a free wine hour. There were tons of restaurants nearby to chose from after our busy day. The location right on the boardwalk of the beach was great. It was quiet at night, and busy during the day. The area felt very safe to me (a single mom with her young son). This is a great choice for either a couple getting away or a family seeing the San Diego sights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Sights, Wonderful Room, Wonderful Vaction”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I just loved it there. Our room (107) was perfect. It was right near the patio, close proximity to the beach. We were treated very well. The entire hotel experience was a delight. A very highly recomended hotel for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: digger
Reviews.Content: Even though we had high expectations after reading previous reviews, we were still amazed at how wonderful this hotel is. Of course it didn't hurt that we were surprised at check in with an upgrade to a full ocean view room. We had teenagers and seniors in our group; all were thrilled with this place. It is in a fun area with plenty of restaurant/bar choices within walking distance. The staff were always so friendly and helpful. They even loaned us umbrellas one day when it was raining. When we were there the weather was a bit cool, but the pool area was well protected and comfortable despite the breeze coming off the Pacific. The hotel is nearly done with a major face lift; the furniture and decor are beautiful. This place is a class act in a great location. So much nicer than the large hotel chains, mostly due to the personalized service. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike1318
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace is a great hotel but you need to understand what it is. It is in a great location, right on a small bluff over the Pacific Ocean, just north of the Crystal Pier. The view from the ocean view balcony is spectacular with the surfers and sunsets. The rooms are very nice and upscale. Staff is very friendly and helpful and create a very laid back atmosphere. They offer a small complimentary continental breakfast every morning which is nice. It is not a trendy hotel. So, if you are looking at a place to be seen this is not it. Yes, there are sufers, college kids, and bums that hang out on the beach. I've never had a problem with any of them but if they bother you then go out to Coronado or La Jolla. This hotel has been great for our kids as the small pool is warm and not very crowded. It is does not have an onsite restaurant or bar. So, if you want 4 star service while sitting by the pool then this is not the place. If you don't mind walking down the beach to dinner or bars then this is not a problem as there are many. Also, we have 3 small kids and there are many walk up fast food places very close if you don't feel like a formal dinner. I would also say the entire Pacific/Mission Beach area is pretty laid back. There aren't any 5 star restaurants within walking distance. There are many decent places to eat but you have to go to Gaslamp or downtown for the trendy places. The area is definitely on the upswing with real estate booming. It is also much more exciting than La Jolla or Coronado, which are good for shopping, but pretty boring IMHO other than that. The beach at the hotel is great. There is some seaweed around whereas Coronado keeps the beach pretty clean. There is also a 2-4 foot break for body surfing. Overall, without a doubt, one of my favorite hotels anywhere and easily my favorite in Southern Cal. Much more relaxing and enjoyable than LA, Laguna Niguel, La Jolla, or Coronado.

Reviews.Title: “Bad review - Wrong hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AMCE
Reviews.Content: Whoever wrote the horrible review on the Pacific Terrace - I think you have the wrong hotel. We stay at the Pacific Terrace at least twice every year just to get away and what you have described isn't them. They have a wonderful continental breakfast with bagels, pastries, muffins, fresh fruit and more. Coffee, tea, water and even lemonade is free all day. The premium views are amazing and there are plenty of restaurant and bars with-in walking distance. I can't recommend them more!! Escaping the heat from AZ and visiting family is our perfect excuse to treat ourselves at the Pacific Terrace.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mtsuz
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a family reunion style vacation and wanted to express our pleasure with the Pacific Terrace Hotel. Our rooms (and we had 4 of them), were all beautiful. Clean, comfortable, with beautiful views and lots of room. Very comfortable beds. The people were very helpful and friendly. We all agreed this was the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hideous Service- must read”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is certainly in the right location, however the service was hideous. No returned phone calls from management, the walls are paper thin and it's not in the best neighborhood (if you're going for spring break, then cross that thought out). Breakfast was horrible (toast was not toasted- literally right out of the bread bag, no jelly, butter, salt or pepper and they actually charged $2 each for tap water??? Unbelievable. I was very excited to finally arrive here after reading the reviews, but if you are looking for service, stay at the Hyatt LaJolla or W downown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay. It was our first time staying at this hotel and the first time in this area of San Diego. The staff were friendly and very attentive. Our 1st night we were upgraded to a suite---it was very nice and the view was great! The second night we had a room on the second floor and the view was even better!!! We enjoyed our stay and do plan to return in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: bienfait
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome!! We stayed here for 2 nights and were absolutely delighted with the service, the hotel location and the excellent staff. We received a call 15 mins. after check-in from the front office staff to see how our room was- I was very impressed by this customer service touch. The breakfast buffet is great with fresh food (and lots of it). We plan to return to this hotel again and would highly recommend others to experience the ambience it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: steg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pacific Terrace for two nights on a business trip. It is an amazing hotel which I would love to return to. I almost felt like I was on vacation. The hotel is located directly on the beach. I had a great view of the ocean from my patio. The breakfast was lovely with lots of fresh fruit and pastries. The hotel staff was very helpful and professional. The room was large and clean. The beds were very comfortable. I wouldn't change a thing.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Place”
Reviews.Author: billrose2
Reviews.Content: Husband and I reserved for three nights from the internet. We had a wonderful view of the ocean from second floor. There were several amenities that we didn't expect. Bountiful free breakfasts, bath robes furnished, wonderful bedding, free wine hour each afternoon, turn down service, free cookies and super friendly staff. Glass doors over the tub did leak onto bath floor, but we learned to put a towel down to absorb it before showering and it worked fine. Underground parking was $15 per day, but was worth not having to hunt street parking. Also their underground garage was decorated with potted plants/trees and fresh flowers in garage elevator foyer. Would certainly recommend it and would stay there again. After leaving there we attended a conference at the Manchester Hyatt down on the Bay and their rooms and service weren't nearly as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a lovely location”
Reviews.Author: MJDunne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in Jan. was upgraded to a suite which was lovely. Nice sitting area with tv and stereo, small kitchen then onto bedroom with 2 queen beds, wash area and separate bathroom. My only complaint was the lack of bar and restaurant with this hotel, the breakfast room was just ok however the location was fantastic, right on the pacific. Be aware though, I was on business and this is a very young area. I walked to Moondoggies for dinner and was acosted by loud young college kids who had drank an awful lot !

Reviews.Title: “Good but some things need work...”
Reviews.Author: BethAnnP
Reviews.Content: The first room we were in was a Jr. Suite which we were told was good for a family of 4. NO WAY! So, we immediately upgraded to a Family Suite. It was on the 1st floor, a little loud on Friday & Saturday nights but ok. There was a leak somewhere in the bathroom near the shower that got all of our towels wet after we used them to dry up the leak. The Continental breakfast was a hit with the kids & the cinnamon buns were yummy. We ordered "room service" one evening & the food was room temp when it arrived & both kid's meals were incorrect - we ordered chicken tenders & fries and grilled cheese & fries & got 2 hamburgers (whatever). We were told a crib would be in our room upon checking in, we had to ask for the crib to be delivered. Hmmm.... all in all- if we went again, we would rent a house instead of staying in a hotel - this or any other for that matter. A week is just too long in a hotel room with 2 kids - even if it is a 2 room suite. The room service was funny too - we came in two times while the turn down service was being performed & the maids were JAMMING to some "Mexican" tunes on the clock radio. They were nice & the room was always very clean, but it was pretty funnny.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: FindoFace
Reviews.Content: Our family of four, including boys ages 10 and 12, just returned from a one week stay at the Pacific Terrace. We stayed at this hotel solely based on the other Trip Advisor favorable reviews and were not disappointed! We booked a "standard room" through our travel agent and were more than pleased with the partial ocean view we had from 2nd floor... it was spectacular! The room was very spacious; tastefully decorated; nice balcony; had a kitchenette with microwave, stove and frig; beautiful bathroom area was separate from the rest and was very roomy; the glass shower doors looked pretty but water leaked onto the floor every time we showered! Very comfy queen beds; in fact, this had been a concern of my husband's when we were hotel searching because his back can't handle uncomfortable beds. No problem here! The continental breakfast was invaluable to us... fresh fruit, a dozen cereals, fresh pastries, bagels, yogurt, juices, coffee, etc. What a great way to start the day without having to leave the hotel or pay extra. A few of the days we were able to enjoy the complimentary wine hour from 4-5. Lots of eating places within walking distance. Loved the pool and whirlpool, especially being right next to the ocean. Very friendly, helpful hotel staff. For convenience, we usually bought our "touristy" tickets at the front desk for $2 off per ticket (SeaWorld, Zoo, Wild Animal Park, LegoLand). We always found parking on the street nearby so avoided the $15 parking garage cost. Various parts of the hotel were undergoing remodeling (which was never a bother to us); when it's all done, I would say that ALL areas of this hotel will be a "WOW"!

Reviews.Title: “We Love the PT on PB”
Reviews.Author: adkbakerhiker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in San Diego for the first time at the Pacific Terrace Hotel and loved it. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The bath and beds were the best, and the location and layout could not be beat. The fresh cool January air in the open hallways was a far cry from the suffy closed in hallways of even the most posh hotels. After all "your on the beach". The staff was very friendly and the continental breakfast was superb. We truly hope to return again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice locatiuon and hotel”
Reviews.Author: albeeee
Reviews.Content: can't go wrong here, Max at the front desk was very helpful, ocean was actually too loud, imsgine that!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: AJB_AH_IL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel 12/21 - 12/24/2005. Had a deluxe Ocean View room on the 3rd floor. We loved it. The breakfast was perfect. The close proximity to the beach was wonderful. Lots of surf activity while we were there. The construction was not a big deal. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Excellent location. We parked in the garage below the hotel. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated and looks great!”
Reviews.Author: jeniroli28
Reviews.Content: Our deluxe Ocean view was just that. Deluxe. The view was worth every dollar I spent for that room. The room was spacious and the tiled bathroom with glass doors was a nice touch. They served a great breakfast outside by the pool which had a selection that seemed to go on forever. After breakfast we took a walk on the beach which is only a stones throw away. Over all a wonderful experience, and can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Pacific Terrace and Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: Bosman
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and two sons (11 and 13) stayed at Pacific Terrace just after the high season was over in August. The hotel was well run, the rooms were big, the free breakfast was good, and the location was spectacular. Pacific Beach is a very busy urban beach, a nice mixture of funky beach bum and fancy tourist. Lots of good restaurants at a variety of price points and beach-oriented stores nearby. Easy drive to downtown SD and you can even get public transportation fairly easily and cheaply. The surf is good but not threatening. We were able to find free parking on the street. Definitely hope to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: tanglesfoot
Reviews.Content: My Daughter and I stayed at the Pacific Terrace in San Diego this past October. We were upgraded to a junior suite when we checked in. It was perfect. Lots of extra room. beautiful view, excellent staff from the front desk to the housekeeping group. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel by the sea”
Reviews.Author: FIONA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in October. The first 2 nights were spent in a partial ocean view room that had recently been re-decorated. It was very tastefully decorated & was a very big room, the partial ocean view was amazing, so beautiful. On the last night we were asked if we would like to move to a full ocean view.
